I explained to Molly my need to have a receipt, which I had previously been promised I would receive twice, and that they still aren't providing me with receipts. Molly was extremely condescending with me during our discussion. I had to point out to her that they haven't provided me with receipts but only confirmations of charging my credit card. I even had to show her a receipt from a separate transaction from this same location before she finally admitted that their receipts had to come from their POS system, and what they had provided me wasn't from their POS system.  Molly assured me that she would personally take care of this going forward and I wouldn't have to ask for a receipt from them again.  It is now late September and I still haven't been provided a receipt for this month's membership. I emailed Molly to follow up on this on Sept 9th and she has neither answered my email nor sent me a receipt and it is now Sept 24th. I no longer feel comfortable coming to this gym and want my membership immediately canceled. You haven't held up to what your employees have promised me on multiple occasions.

Definitely very appealing vegan fare... I love that the menu is short and every dish seems to have a lot of thought put in it. I ordered the noodles and the cauliflower 65.

Noodles were just amazing, right from the texture of the noodles to the spice balance of the sauce/broth  and the friend mushrooms, it was all perfect. I ate the last bit of the sauce in the bowl.

Cauliflower 65 to me was ok, the pieces of the crisp (papad) didn't seem too fresh as they were not crispy like they should be.

Loved the halo halo dessert, quite innovative mix of flavors. 

Overall great experience and I surely want to go and try other items on the menu. Most importantly, presentation was GREAT, hard to find in vegan restaurants. So this is a perfect place for a nice vegan dinner date.

My biggest qualm about this place is the pricing, way too high for a frequent visit.

The greatest neighborhood in all of Philadelphia has one of the greatest establishments offering great food, a terrific beer selection and reasonable pricing. The staff is friendly, efficient and polite. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun!  This is a spot that can not be missed!

My daughter got a little confused and thought she was buying Imagine Dragon tickets for West Palm Beach but instead she purchased in Tampa. She managed to get us floor so we decided to keep them and take a road trip. Since we had floor and it's first come first serve we came very early to make sure we got to the front of the line. Unfortunately for us we stood in the wrong line for a really long time. By the time we figured out what was going on we were in the back of the line of people heading to the floor. They handed out wrist bands to signify who got to be on the floor. That part was great but better signs marking the respective lines would have been helpful. Security was pretty quick but I never bring anything in with me except one credit card, my phone, and a car key. 

Once inside things worked out better. We managed to find a spot along the rail and began what had to be the hottest night of my life. It was so hot that I felt dizzy at times. They sold expensive but necessary frozen lemonade on the floor which saved me. It was cash only which forced a necessary trip to the expensive cash machine. 

The show was amazing. We were so close to the band and they dropped balloons and shot out confetti several times during the show. This was the most civilized crowd I have ever been in. No one pushed or tried to cut in front of me. We all just danced and had the best time. In Broward it is a fight to keep your spot. I loved the show and it made all of the uncomfortable standing and heat worth it. 

After the show arena attendants were rude about patrons leaving. I sat down for a minute to catch my breath after standing for four hours in extreme heat and I was screamed at. Since we came early we were in the front of the parking lot. Leaving was another nightmare. No one moved around us for over an hour. We were completely stuck. Parking attendants to direct traffic would have been appreciated. The concert let out at 11 and we didn't get on the road until well after 12 AM. If I came back I would take Brett M.'s advice about parking at the exit and taking a long walk to the entrance in order to be able to leave. 

I think how much you enjoy your show at this arena depends on the weather. This arena has covered seating but it is open on the sides with lawn seating. If there is lightening in the area they will stop the show or cut it short. That is what happened to us the night before in Palm Beach. The finale was changed to acoustic because of bad weather as people were forced out of the arena. I am so happy we decided to keep the Tampa tickets where we saw the full ending of the concert. It seems easier to get good tickets here as opposed to more populated Broward County and my daughter lives in Orlando so I may be back.

My husband and I were given a gift card and we visited your restaurant Sunday. We opted to order from the regular menu rather than the brunch menu. 
The salad portions are huge!  I had the Farmer's Salad and it is delicious. We also ordered a cheese calzone and a dozen buffalo wings. Everything was perfectly prepared and our server was very attentive, especially considering the place was packed. Plus we had enough carryouts for another meal!  We will definitely return.

Great place to go for dinner! The pimento beignets are delicious...and the fried green tomatoes. The hot chicken was pretty hot but our waitress Lindsey was so awesome and brought us a glass of milk. The peanut bombe was out of this world. Great service and food!
The heart and soul of Tampa the best steak sandwiches ever created.  The steak has been the main returning reason when they were first on the causeway, to current location.

When my friends and I asked the hostess about the origins of Capdeville, she told us that there are two things that the owners absolutely love: "Food and Rock n' Roll." Now take that idea and roll with it as you peruse the menu of eclectic entrees and appetizers ranging from Fried Red Beans and Rice to Fish Tacos. It proclaims itself to be an interpretation of a British social house that has been Americanized, and I think they have that spot on. The atmosphere gives a since of freedom that allows the patrons to be both elegant and relaxed, whichever one is more their style.

As far as food goes (and I think the other reviewers will back me up on this one), it is a complete necessity for someone at the table to order the Truffled Mac n' Cheese. Take about melt in your mouth deliciousness right there. It's incredibly rich, but by the time you've finished it, you'll still want more. The burgers are also pretty spectacular. I personally tried the Capdeville Burger, which was everything I wanted and more. The fries were delicious and perfectly seasoned (not too salty like at some places), and the price was absolutely acceptable. 

The only down-side of our trip was a not-exactly-delightful Pimm's Cup. You'd think it would be difficult to mess up a Pimm's Cup (my personal cocktail of choice), but whoever made it did a pretty good job of doing so. It seemed hastily made (perhaps because there was a pretty large crowd at the bar when we ordered) and wasn't worth the $9 they were going to charge. This problem, however, was immediately solved by our waiter who was super cool and took it back. We opted for Abita Strawberry instead, a great combination with the burger and fries. 

Which brings me to my favorite part: the staff. I suppose I'm not very familiar with the staff as a whole, but the waiter and the hostess that helped us were absolutely stellar. The waiter was very helpful and completely cool with us sending back the Pimm's cup (sometimes you get those stuffy types that don't hesitate to let you know how much of an inconvenience it is - not the case here). The hostess (Lauren) was also fantastic. She got us settled as soon as she could, and even paid us a few visits and answered the questions we had about the restaurant and the inspiration for it. And it was thanks to her that we got to have the most delicious dessert ever: King Cake Bread Pudding. I kid you not, friends. This bread pudding was made from a Haydel's King Cake that was brought in earlier that morning, and it was divine. 

So all-in-all, I think it's safe to say that Capdeville will be a place that I will frequent often for their delicious food and even more delicious prices.

Unbelievable flavor in this food!! Make sure you try the couscous curry wrap that was amazing. Also the buffalo chicken wrap was very good. 

However the real specialty of Tareks Cafe is his breakfast. All the eggs and omelettes are amazing and full of flavor. He also makes his muffins homemade and fresh everyday so make sure you pick one up on your way out!

Delicious. I went there with some family friends a couple weeks ago, and it was hard not to drool all over the menu. I am a big fan of the prices, the small, intimate setting, and the overall laid back vibe. Building up to my visit, every single person told me to get the Krispy Kreme Bread Pudding. So, of course, I got it (our table also got the bacon brownie, yum). While I'm not much of a dessert person, the bread pudding was delicious. We shared the two desserts between the 5 of us, which was the perfect amount. The Pimm's Cup was just right, and the Boudin Balls were amazing. 

We had made reservations, since it's a pretty small place, but were running late because of work. We called, and they said no problem, so we showed up about 20 minutes after reservation time, but got a seat right away. I can't guarantee this luck with everyone, since I tried to book a couple weeks later for a Friday night and they were all booked up. If you show up and get lucky, it'll be worth the wait. I can't remember the name of our waitress, but she was an absolute sweetheart. Trust me, you will not be disappointed with the food and the atmosphere here. And if you are, then I have my doubts about you. :)

I've been coming to this Taco Tote for a few years now, always bringing my kids who love it as much as I do. It's simple counter service tacos with a decent sized salsa/fixings bar and a 144-flavor coke machine at a good price. I tend to go with Chicken Adobodo (which I can never pronounce right and end up saying the "bodo" part about three times) while my kids enjoy the various "fajita" tacos (chicken or beef). They have limited kids meals (chicken nuggets or a taco) but I've never heard complaints (and often snag and extra nugget to dip in some salsa - part of a standard Dad's right to "taste test" the food. You know... for quality).

You can see the cooks preparing the food behind the cashier - chopping up the fresh meats and cooking them on the grill. It always comes out hot and the tortillas are some of the best I've ever had (you'd think a flour tortilla is a flour tortilla, but they know how to make a *good* tortilla at this place). I like to drizzle some dark, smokey "salsa" on my tacos with lettuce, lime juice (from little wedges), and a bit of guacamole salsa. I'll fill a few tubs of various "hot" salsas for dipping my chips as well - love to mix and match a few flavors. The beans and rice are pretty standard (part of the 4 stars) - part of a combo - but you can also get the "pack" which includes a baked potato instead. It's as delicious as a baked potato can be.

As for the coke machine - the kids *love* these new touch screen fountain soda machines with upwards of 144 flavors. Grape Mellow Yellow mixed with cherry fanta? You got it. Vanilla Barq's rootbear with a splash of peach coke and some diet lime sprite? Uhm... no. But you can have it if you want it!

Overall, tacos are a solid 5 in my book. The rice and beans are just regular, standard fare - 3 stars. The addition of the kid-favorite soda machine is always a nice bonus - a solid 5 there. Sometimes in the *back* section of the restaurant, in the booths by the windows you will get some annoying flies - definitely a 3 for that, but they stick to that back area, which is hot anyway from the large windows and so best to be avoided. Overall... 4 stars. Tada! I *can* do basic math. And Taco Tote can do good tacos (which is really what this review is about).

A little discombobulated but small enough to get around easily.  Baggage check-in personnel must've been new as it seemed that I knew more about the process than she did. Everything was packed accordingly but they felt the need to detain us while they checked out the luggage only to tell us that everything was fine. 
Other than that things were pretty average.

Not the untimate taste but pretty clean and friendly place. You can say the street taco for what it is. It's very cheap but also the portions are small. Decent place to check out when in the nearby area.

Sweet Tomatoes is a craving. It's also my post half marathon meal go to- buffet/all you can eat? Yes please.

I love eating here, even though it's not the best food I've ever had. The salad bar is always clean and fresh. My go-to's-  Chinese chicken won ton salad and the tuna tarragon. On the soup side, there are always the staple chicken noodle chunk and kettle house chili options as well as 1-2 vegetarian options(split pea or lentil seem to be the regulars). There are usually 1-2 others in rotation- French Onion and/or clam chowder. The seasonal soups are always the best in my opinion. The Albondigas Mexican soup is my favorite. The bakery section is the star of this location - offering 3-4 different biscuit/muffins including the seasonal one, dessert cobbler of the season, as well as a focasia, pizza bread, and sourdough/multigrain bread. Let me not forget to mention the frozen yogurt machine and toppings. Dessert sundae is always a must! I usually steer clear of the pastas and mac and cheese. They're bland and overall not so great.

Sometimes this location can be a little messy with people slopping soup and random food everywhere, but more times than not, it's clean and there is always someone ready to pick up my empty plates/bowls as soon as I'm done.

Sign up for the Club Veg emails and get coupons galore. I never come here without some kind of 20%off or other discount coupon! Makes it much more worth than the $12 dinner price tag.

Ordered a burger and diet coke. Small misunderstanding and my order never got put in. Instead of apologizing I was told by the manager on duty it was my fault. I have been a customer for some time, not sure I am coming back.

We were visiting here from TN and found this close (about 7 mins) to the airport. It was smaller than the pictures on Yelp make it seem but that didn't take away from the experience at all. We went about 430 on a Saturday evening. It wasn't busy at all. The bar was open and there are about 6 tables in the front but they also have a more secluded room in the back with a pool table for private gatherings. When we first walked i. The music was playing 
So the vibes were nice!  We got a table and the man behind the bar came right over to greet us and get our drink orders. They had a full bar and carried a lot of different beers. We just ordered Corona (no pun intended lol). A young lady then came over and took our orders. We got the chicken Philly egg rolls w/tots  and the fish and chips. The eggs rolls i believe are homemade (not frozen) because she asked if we wanted onions, mushrooms, and jalapeos in them-even gave us a option on which cheese we wanted in them. The fish was crispy and fried to perfection and the fries great too! Overall, this visit was great and they service was also great. The guy even gave us some good places to visit while in the city! Great service !

This place is super cute! We were able to snag seats at the bar on a busy Sunday afternoon and our experience/service was 10/10. 
You can't go wrong with the mimosa kit, the juice options were sooo goodn
The truffle fries were hands down THE best fries I have ever tasted in my entire life and I'm not even being dramatic. 
The burger was also delicious with the perfect runny egg on top.

This is a newer local bar and restaurant. I have had a decent experience each time I have gone. The bar is nice, drinks are strong and they are reasonable. I have had pork chops, mofongo, tostones, and rice. Each platter was delicious. I do feel the staff are "standoffish" or seem like they do not want to be at work. Overall it is a nice restaurant and bar with good mud

Wow!   This may have been the best meal we've ever had.  Everything was spot on.  The service was impeccable, cocktails were perfect and the steak was killer.  I'd HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place while in Philly.

Decided to go here for a bite to eat after playing a bit. BIG MISTAKE! Do NOT go here if u don't have to. We got seated right away, but, then we sat for 10 mins without anyone coming over to assist us at all! So, we got up to leave, complained to the so-called "manager" turns out, he was one of the people standing around doin absolutely nothing!!! Needless to say we probably won't be back for a long time, if at all! In pic, workers standing arnd doing nothing, completely ignoring us!! Soo rude & unprofessional

Bree was amazing! I almost cancelled my appointment and was going to wait until i went back to NYC but decided to keep my appointment-Glad I did.

Bree is very thorough and knowledgeable about waxing. She is always very easy to be waxed by. I'm so happy I found my new waxer! 

Sonia at the front desk was also very nice. 

This location is def adhering to all covid precautions. Thank you ladies, see you soon!

Very disappointed that the manager and staff that was preparing and serving the food I was planning on having wasn't masked. We do have a mask mandate.  We left.  I wear a mask all day so I don't share my respiratory droplets on my customers. I want to stay employed so I mask because the ramifications of what will happen if I test positive for covid will affect many many people. I go out. I see people.  But someone is masked because it's the right thing to do. Russell's you can do better. I'll miss you.

There's little I can say about Parc that has an already been written. If you've never been to this classic French bistro style you definitely need to have it on your visit list. While we're off in here for cocktails at the bar, the food -- in particular the appetizers -- are spectacularly good.
Probably my favorite place in Rittenhouse Square. With your inside or outside on the sidewalk, it's a little taste of Paris.
Great staff! Helpful & friendly. A clean, well organized store. Easy to find items. Always has something on sale that I need. Love this store!

This is the only thing open late night near Mount Juliet. I've been waiting for 15min no answer on the intercom, drove around and looked inside to see if anyone was working, saw an employee with dreads sipping on a soda with not a care in the world

Bella Sps staff offers great customer service and professionalism. The environment is complemented with the great smile that Monique offers to you when you arrive to the reception.  Nurse Carolyn is very knowledgeable and a great motivator and Dr. Suarez always greet you like if she have known you all your life. I recommend Bella Spa.
Dr. Ledger and the staff at Spring Hill Dental Associates was very. The doctor was very nice and funny. He explained thoroughly with my treatment plan. I highly recommend this dental office.

Been going here for years and been getting a foot massage that includes the whole body. Lady at the front tells me this the foot massage is only for the feet for one hour. I was here a few weeks ago and this was not true. I think she was trying to get me to pay more money for the same massage. Never going here again. As a customer I don't like feeling like I am being lied to. I will pay for service but not if I feel if you are being deceptive.

My review echos a lot of what the other reviewers who gave this place 3-stars or less said.

Pros:
-Excellent portions
-Fresh fish
-Real wasabi (the kind that you can feel in your sinuses and not just on your tongue)
-Decent Service

Cons:
-Catered to Americans--i.e. too much dressing on the salad, too much sauce on top of a roll, too many flavors within a roll (Tip: ask for dressing or sauce on the side)
-Booths need to be secured--I got shoved into my table because the person sitting on the other side of the booth moved.

I'd come back.

In would give this company zero stars if that were available.  My young  son and I were coming into Phoenix from London.  Our flight was delayed and we were exhausted.  I had reserved space on a shuttle that should have given us plenty of lead time but with the flight getting in late we only had 15 minutes. We ran to the shuttle, and there it sat, mostly empty. I thought oh, lucky day.  But no...I was told that because it was only 5 minutes until departure, our names weren't on the "list".  This despite the fact that I had prepaid for these seats.   I asked how  to get on the list.  I was told it's in the drivers hand in a sealed envelope that is "forbidden" by federal law to be opened.   No matter how much I begged and pleaded, the shuttle sat in front of us for the 5 minutes before leaving my son and I standing on the sidewalk .  When I asked to speak to a manager, I was told "we don't have managers".  I made a complaint to this company and never got so much as a phone call.  I would never use this company or recommend  them to even my worst enemy.

I've passed by this place dozens of time and finally decided to go in yesterday. Judging from the outside I didn't expect much but the inside decor is actually pretty nice...and so I got my hopes up, and was sorely disappointed.  For 12-15 bucks a dish you get tiny pieces of chopped vegetables and cube size spare ribs.  Really?  you can't give people decent size food for that price?  I don't know how this place can compete but than again, there is not much competition in Santa Barbara, how sad.
Best Asian buffet in town. We come here on regular basis. My wife gets her sushi fix and I love duck and kal-bee among many other things. Grill is excellent too as well as deserts.

Being from the south I'm always looking for good seafood! This was ok! Good ok though! I had the mixed pasta but I should have just gotten all shrimp! It's pretty pricey too! Love the vibe and music! Definitely downloaded the pandora 90s R&B after eating

My husband and I stopped in for the first time tonight.. We had the calamari app which was tasty and cooked perfectly. I had the captains platter and he had the reef platter which we both enjoyed very much. Our server from Mass. (Cheryl) spelled the same way as mine, was very attentive and personable. I would highly recommend her seeing it was only her 2nd serving shift at this establishment and she was fantastic:))

My husband and I love craft beer, so Philly Beer Week is one of the best times of the year - when we have time to enjoy it. I actually had the weekend off for once, so we made sure to hit up as many of the events and bars as our livers could handle. BRU Craft & Wurst was celebrating their 1st birthday so we hit them up for a late lunch.

They had a live band performing (mostly covers), and although they were good performers, DEAR LORD was it loud inside! We asked to be seated as far from them as possible, and it was still incredibly difficult to hear one another. A place that primarily shills beer/alcohol should foster conversation, not lonely consumption. We like the concept of the 'self serve' drafts that charge you per ounce, but for this latest visit we stuck with the bar's draft list. They had some sandwich specials as part of their celebration - we shared the roasted pork and garlic pork sausage with sauerkraut, both of which had pickles and chips. The food was great with our cold brews, both meats super juicy and tender and instantly put us in a summer state of mind. If it wasn't for the loud music, we would've hung out longer and had another drink, but our ears were ringing and we left to enjoy the sunshine.

If you want an experience with impeccable staff, service and good...tululahs garden is the place. After eating there after the Moshulu, I was so upset that I didn't book them. The difference of attention from staff and care was most noticeable and the food was to die for. I Agree with Jackson and the other reviews below about the Moshulu. Food mediocre, staff inattentive and lack the care for guests and definitely not the place if you want your occasion to be special. I can't believe the difference of how we were treated with a special occasion at tululahs garden a week later, vs Moshulu. I told the staff at tulalahs how awful our whole experience at Moshulu was and how I wish I would have booked them instead. I dined at Moshulu years ago for a brunch buffet and was really excited to come back. I made a very special request weeks in advance and although requests aren't guaranteed, staff wasn't prepared with any knowledge of what I asked to be written in the book. Hostess didn't seem knowledgeable about seating logistics. Our table was immediately inside the door to the left facing the parking lot which defeated our initial excitement and choice of booking this establishment, which was really stressed ahead of time for having a water view. I wasn't made aware of a dj on top of the ship so couldn't eat there with grandparents and loud music, Even though I asked lots of questions when booking. Waiter came over and told me it was an "off day" for seating rooms and an "off day" overall. We decided to remain at table but the rest of our special night was ruined because we chose this special place for the views and atmosphere and to celebrate a very special and meaningful milestone.. If you are seated in the ship on the left as we were, I would opt to spend that kind of money at an excellent restaurant with excellent food and stellar service such as Amada or any Jose Garces restaurant. At no point throughout the evening did any managerial staff stop over or check in or ask how everything was. When we got the bill the 20% gratuity was added to the check so it didn't matter how they treated us. The manager walked by us as we were leaving and didn't say a word, just headed upstairs. No goodnight, no nothing. The lack of care and professionalism made this worse. Plates stacked on table while tea was being served. Crumbs everywhere and nothing reset. I don't care too much about a reset table but in what's listed as fine dining, I was surprised. Worst $550 I have ever spent and we love spending money on great food, service and experiences. It was such a letdown. When I called the next day to speak to a manager, the Owner's daughter was very nice and promised a call back later in the day. I didn't receive a call that day, No call the next day, the day after. I called back a few times as The lack of acknowledgment first at the restaurant and now by phone, really solidified the lack of care that the manager on duty displayed that night. I finally received a phone call exactly 7 days later. Manager was rude, condescending, and placed blame on me and questioned my feelings. He scoffed at my explanation of events and only apologized for how I feel but nothing on the restaurants end. I was frustrated and questioned by someone who didn't show his face once that night but claimed he was there and claimed his staff was beyond excellent. He told me I was a waste of his time. If this was the case, why would I have called and why would I be leaving a review on yelp? I opened a yelp account years ago and I don't remember using it since years ago. The manager really could have made things so much better by being nice, respectful and at least trying to understand. He instead made fun of me, made me feel like everything was my own fault and insulted me. I would have loved to be invited back for a redo in a nicer location on the ship as I originally requested or on s day where it wasn't "off" as the server stated but now, not only will we never come back there or any sister locations in the city, we will never recommend  Moshulu or any of their sister places to our friends or any one else. I stand by Jose Garces establishments for their professionalism, food, and service. I have never been treated so poorly by someone who chose his career in the restaurant business in my life. Awful, hurtful and sad. Waste of money.

Horrible experience. Ordered a cookie cake to be picked up between 11 and 11:30. Showed up around 11:30 and was told my cake wasn't ready, it was still being decorated. Now I have to be at this party at 12 and there were no apologies, no nothing. Just "I'm not in charge of making the cakes maam " unprofessional and unacceptable. I understand mistakes happen but be apologetic and help me, the paying customer, get what I'm paying you guys to do. Will not use this place again.

Tries a little too hard. And it reminds me more of a place you'd see in LA than Philadelphia. In fact, it reminds me a lot of Swingers on 3rd. But, so it is. I enjoyed it for what it was: a highly stylized diner-cum-bar, a hipster magnet.

I love this place, I am a local and never been a "regular" at a bar. But the staff is so welcoming and fun I would recommend to anyone visiting or living in the city. They have drink specials everyday & Thursday $5.00 pizza night is great, but can get kinda crowded. It's a must if your in Mid-city.

I bought my boyfriend a couples massage here for Christmas. We didn't know what to expect, but we both ended up having the best massages of our lives in a really beautiful, clean space. My boyfriend had Troy, and I don't remember my masseuse's name, but both were superb. The after massage sauna was the most wonderful touch - we also enjoyed the hefty glasses of wine we got! We are looking forward to coming back to Le Reve soon!
I went in this past Thursday to pick up my watch. Whoever was working the register was sweet and had a sense of humor :)

The Hollister Brewing Company is the gem of Goleta. Even more so when your wife forces you out to all the shopping in the area.  They brew all their beer right here on site - so very fresh and they've got a great brew master - really tasty beers across every variety. And you can't miss with their food. Fresh delicious and reasonably priced. I in fact make the trip out from Santa Barbara frequently for this place (and pick up some light bulbs from Home Depot to justify the drive out). And for you beer drinkers - they keep a beer on a Cask keg system all the time.  A return to mid evil Europe :) so tasty ....

On a quick weekend trip to Nashville, I almost forgot to visit the Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum! I am so glad that I was able to get in a visit before heading to the airport!  

First - it is a gorgeous building, outside and inside the lobby.  It's very well designed, with soaring ceilings and windows in the front, and beautiful wood floors.  There is a sweeping staircase and elevators.  The walls are covered with awards and names of musicians.

No, wait - for real first off - everyone is really friendly here.  The ladies at the ticket counter, the folks at the coat check (complimentary!) and the young man at the beverage kiosk.  All super nice. 

The place is CLEAN.  The floors - whether stone, cement, wood or carpet - all clean.  Walls and windows - clean.  Sparkling.  They are paying attention to this - there was not a speck of litter anywhere.  The cases around the exhibits were crystal clean - and I didn't see people pushing their fingers up against them and getting them all dirty.

There are plenty of "hands on" kinds of exhibits for listening to music and getting information but so much of the visual part of the museum is composed of clothing.  The place is full of headless mannequins wearing the most amazing array of outfits I never did see in my life.  I have to confess - I love the costume exhibits at the local art museums in San Francisco - and this really made the museum compelling for me.  All the outfits are properly fitted on mannequins which stand at the size/height of the original wearer of the item -- so it gives you a sense of how big and tiny some of these folks were (Loretta Lynn was tinytinytiny!).  

There were so many great artifacts there, in addition to outfits there were instruments, automobiles and many other things.  I would definitely return and would love to attend a special event there.  My mom was very jealous.
Great service even when it's crowded! I use the app and order online and it's always ready within 5 minutes of ordering! Easy to order before I leave my house and ready when I get there.

We were first greeted by pleasant staff! Menu so great!! Had amazing flounder and grits! Chipped beef excellent! Home fries with green peppers and onions best ever!! Local college spot. Go Temple Owls!

I was lucky enough to go on a private tour on a Saturday afternoon with a few friends. Co-owner Andrew was our guide and he did a fantastic job telling us all about the rum making process and explained everything in an easy-to-understand manner. Roulaison is a small and new rum distilling company and, I'll be honest, I know nothing about liquor production. Everything here is handcrafted and it's all local. All of this was pretty new to me, but I found the tour very interesting and Andrew was extremely nice and was happy to answer questions.

After the tour came the tasting and I'm not a liquor drinker, so this got real interesting. I can usually handle liquor if it's mixed with something, so I was thankful for the teeniest little thimble full of samples that we had to try. Some of the rum burned, but that's probably because I "can't hang". By the third taste I had to reach for water- I'm such a lightweight. I did, however, really enjoy the rum liqueur that was offered, mainly because it had some sweetness to it. You can actually have them mix you up a cocktail, if that's your thing.

I highly recommend the tour, especially if you like learning about new things and how things are made.

The place was pretty busy so I was excited. The menu looked great and as a vegetarian I had lots of choices. I ordered a flatbed sandwich with avocado and asked for egg whites. The cashier struggled with the order but finally got it.

The bad part was that it took a long time for everything. My espresso shot was cold and bitter. The sandwich tasted pretty good but was also cold and much smaller than what was pictures on the menu. Lastly I never got the side of fruit I ordered. My wife had a parfait and said it was just ok.

We had a hot water heater go out on us. They came out from the Duke Energy program we had. They called within 5 minutes after getting our appt. They were so courteous, professional, knowledgeable. They replaced the old water heater and it was cleaned up too. I would definitely recommend and will use them again.

Visited this place for the first time today.  Bought 2 bundles of railroad ties.  2 guys loaded them on my trailer with no problem and refused a tip.  Best customer service I've experienced in a long time.  I'll definitely be back!

Thank you April for a fabulous full face make up application for an important charity event.  April is a consummate professional.  Her suggestions were totally relevant to my complexion and skin type.  I was so pleased with my experience and with the outcome.  I look forward to being with her again when the occasion calls for looking my absolute best.

Stopped in last night for our first visit after a flight in from CT through Tampa headed to Clearwater. Do not let the curious looking plaza fool you - this place makes quality Viet food. The staff and owner (I think) were very hospitable and inviting. We ordered some appetizers and a Grilled Pork and Flank Noodle Salad Bowl. Flavorful, hearty, and light at the same time. Meat was exceptionally seasoned/marinated, in good quantity, and quite tender. It was all very tasty and a fantastic post flight meal. Enjoyed our first visit and we will be back! By the way, the prices are very reasonable. Give it a try.

This place is so beautiful and the staff is incredible! The doctor was so understanding of my needs and really took time to get to know me. They really make you feel like you're at home. The prices are just as competitive as anywhere else too!

I drove by this place a lot over the past few years. This week I decided to try it. The servers are very friendly and the place has a nice atmosphere. The food was awesome too with very large portions.
WAYYYY too expensive for the mediocre sushi they serve.

This is my first & probably last trip
To this location. All of the workers had an attitude. The bartender was very rude...the waitress told us we couldn't have our drinks on the floor (LIES) & the chick at the prize shop had an attitude as well. Horrible experience. :(

I purchased 3 slices and after eating the first slice and a few bites of the second slice, I noticed a small bug, I picked it up and checked it carefully, I didn't want to overreact without being completely certain. I even showed a couple of people who verified that it was a bug,  and then I found another small bug. So horrified and fighting the urge to throw up, I called the store and told them what I found, I was told to bring it back to the store, which I did. The owner was horribly rude, he tried to convince me that it was oregano, which it clearly wasn't, and me in my stupidity forgot to get a picture. He then proceeded to toss me my money back and banned me from the store, as if I would go back there.Just a horrible experience.

Edited to include the private message the owner sent me

Hi this is the owner perfect circle pizza thank you for reviewing me on yelp but couple things!first there was no bug or fly like you were pretending and get some education to tell the deference between bug or fly and Oregano and about my cleanest to the my store I guarantee man my bathroom are clean the you house not ti mention my shop you can come even close to compare to any place in Drexel hill you can even call health department and just mention my place and they will laugh at bc they know about my shop thank you again we just not you place and have good day

Have been going here occasionally for the past couple years. Always have a good massage. Some therapists are more chatty, which I don't care for, but to each her own. Lobby is clean. They hand you a water bottle before and after your massage. Will be back next month.

Was looking for some good Italian eats near the hotel where we were staying.  Used the app on my phone which turned up Pie, Pizza and Pasta. Went in and there were only a couple of other people in the restaurant.  Ordered a large pepperoni and black olive pizza and it was outstanding!  We ordered hummus and pita bread as an appetizer. Outstanding! There is a fully stocked bar. Was definitely worth the walk as the food, drinks and service was incredible. I read other reviews where it was posted that the service was not good. We did not experience that as all food and drinks were brought out from the time of order to our table in about 15 minutes. Drinks and appetizers were brought out within 5 minutes. Give it a try and I can assure you that your experience, and quality of food, will not disappoint.

We drove by last night and decided to stop in.  Everything was SO freaking good, it's not funny.  This has Colombian food with Creole seasonings.   I can't proclaim how good it was.  We had grilled corn on the cob to start off with, which was covered in Parmesan cheese and spices.   For our main meal, what ever meat you order comes in a type of pita, but it's made out of corn meal.  Forgive my ignorance in the correct name for the dishes.  I had the shredded chicken with mashed avocado and green peppers.  Basically, it's cold chicken salad, but no mayo.  It came with 2 different sauces on the side, an aioli and a cilantro and olive oil sauce.  I also had a margarita.  He got a grilled chicken with caramelized onions, which he also said was tasty.  We will be back.  Great little place.

This place is so great. It a small restaurant close to spring garden street. We were looking for mexican food to eat and we're between this and el vez. Since I already at at el vez I decided to come here and I was not the least bit disappointed. It's super authentic and the owner was so welcoming. He even navigated the menu and helped us chose the vegetarian options. I recommend getting the mushroom quesadilla and the vegetarian wet burrito. Both delicious and so filling. The portions here are pretty big for the amount you're paying.

Minando has a pretty good buffet, especially considering we went for lunch and not dinner, AND for a (primarily) sushi buffet. We went on a Friday afternoon and it was busy but not full. Our server was friendly and always filled our drinks quickly. Apparently this place used to have a liquor license but it's now BYOB. This is perfect because there is a Wine and Spirits right next door. 

I was impressed with the sheer amount of sushi and salad offerings. All of the rolls tasted fresh and didn't taste or look like they had been sitting out. The "Friday only" lobster roll was pretty good. They had a large variety of roll types, even my mom (not a huge sushi fan) was able to find 5 or 6 rolls that she really loved. I tried almost every single one and didn't really have any terrible ones, some of them had too much mayo sauce for my taste though. Overall it's the best sushi buffet I've been to. However, keep in mind it IS a buffet. The sushi, while good and fresh, isn't likely to be the BEST you've ever had if you're comparing it to fancier/expensive/whatever restaurants. Nothing wrong with that, though. The salads were all decent and varied from one another. 

The hot section was okay, I'm not sure if this changes much at dinner. I wasn't expecting too much from the hot section because we went expecting to eat mainly sushi. My only real complaint about the hot section was the beef teriyaki: it looked nice but was impossible to chew. Everyone in our party tried it, but it was just too tough. Maybe it was an off day? The chicken teriyaki was good, as were the rest of the things on the hot bar.

Even though I had my fill of sushi and other food, I HAD to try the green tea soft serve for dessert. Delicious! I also tried the chocolate, raspberry, and green cake bites. All of them were good. They also had flan, if that's your thing. 

I recommend Minando. People say it's expensive but I definitely thought the $17/person lunch was worth it. I can't vouch on the $30/person dinner. Check it out!

Came here because i got bird droppings on my car while visiting a friend in the area and because I had a good experience at their Cherry Hill location.
After my wash I noticed that not all of the bird droppings came off. I said so to the manager, who cleaned the spots personally and rewashed my car. Every time I've visited a Diamond Express location I've received excellent, courteous service.
I must say, I don't understand some of the reviews on here.
I get a bad staff review, people have bad days and while in a perfect world everyone would be bright and cheery all the time that just isn't the case in the real world. I generally wouldn't mention such a thing unless it was a regular occurrence or the owner/manager failed to address it.
The people that said they're car came out with dirty wheels and whatnot... apparently you didn't bother saying anything. I mean, it's a machine, not a human detailer. I'd expect something to get missed on occasion, or an extra dirty something (like wheels) to not be 100% clean. I had that issue, said something, and they fixed right away _with an apology_.
People make mistakes, so do machines. It's not right to give a bad review without letting the business try to rectify the issue.
The lady that said a chunk of paint came off her car? I don't understand how that could have possibly happened. The only thing that touches the cars is cloth, foam, and soap. I asked about the material they use at their Cherry Hill location, not only was the gentleman very knowledgeable about the material, he further put any concerns to rest by letting the brush hit his hand while it was turning. How was his hand ok but your car paint isn't?
Don't listen to the naysayers. This place is great.

Easy to find with street parking. Place is a no frills kinda place. Nothing too special with the decor. It was a bit on the small side. Got a Brazilian wax which was pretty quick and painless. Found some stray hairs when I got home and ended up taking care of those myself. All in all not bad but not amazing.

Making a PETCO trip I stopped in for mid day fuel! This is a must for everyone to check out! All day breakfast Vegetarian / Vegan heaven!  The Egg sandwich ~ GF bread, spinach, cheese & avacado plus side salad. So Good! Everything is fresh and cooked perfectly!  Staff friendly, Happy and very attentive!  Cool music, eclectic hipster vibe. Gem of The City!

Incredible people,  atmosphere Coffee! Luna was a gracious host. Great place especially if you are tired of the same old chain coffee/tea. Very tranquil environment. I would highly recommend a stop when in the city. Absolutely Fabulous!!

One of the best meals I have had a NOLA this year.  This new restaurant lives up to the hype and anticipation.  The marinated shrimp had beautiful complex flavors - none which overpowered the other.  I still wonder where they get bonnet peppers in Nola.  The Roasted Brussel Sprouts and roasted beets were next level. The hamachi & melon was an unexpected yet perfect pairing.  From the hostess to the bus boy the staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and ingredients.  The restaurant is in a comfortable space and the crowd was energized and vibrant. I will definitely return
This place is amazing. Tasty soups. Really tasty food. Very reasonably priced
Visited Tibbs over 4th of July weekend for a double feature.  $10 for two movies, big screens, and an awesome (and affordable) concession stand.  They have everything.  Great for family fun.
This is a great place for good food before going to the Riverside Theater. Besides its great quality, the food is very reasonably priced with generous portion size. I highly recommend this place.
Great place. So friendly and clean. Services always top notch. Staff is great. Food is consistently great!!  Love this place!

I am specifically reviewing the bakery at this location. Now, Fry's doesn't exactly come to mind when I think of the bakery I most want to go to, but I wanted one of those birthday cakes with the thin picture wafer. We were having my little boy's birthday party with a Star Wars theme and I ordered a cake with a picture of my son during Padawan training at Disneyland. 
The party was starting at 2:00, I ordered the cake to be ready at 1:00. I figured the less time we had with the cake, the less damage could be done to it. 
As it always turns out, my husband was ready way before me. He was just sort of waiting around while I was busy with my hair. So he asked, "Should I go get the cake?" What could possibly happen, right? 
He leaves. I finish getting ready. I make sure I have everything I need. Candles, camera, treat bags, everything has been checked off my list. The kids have been ready for a while. Where is my husband? He calls. 

me: (instead of answering "hello") where are you? 
him: I've been trying to call you. I dropped the cake
me: (total, complete silence) 
him: hello? 
me: you're kidding, right? 
him: NO! I dropped the cake. It's windy and I was trying to open the door and blah, blah, blah (I sort of drifted out or passed out for a while)
me: (quiet again)
him: oh, so what, now you're mad? 
me: uh . . . .no . . . . just . . . .well, go buy another one. I mean, what else can we do? (I was in a sort of daze really. I wasn't even mad, just numb)
him: OK, I'll call you back

As it turns out, he went back in with the remains of the first cake. The bakery people saw it and made him a whole new one - exactly the same as the first one-  with the picture and all. AND . . . .  wait for it . . .  wait for it . . . . . for free! Yes, they didn't charge him. Plus, they had it ready for him in about 10 minutes. They are complete life savers. I joked with my husband that the bakery people probably thought he had a super mean wife and felt bad for him. Either way, they saved the party and saved my husband some grief. Too bad nothing can save him from all the "cake dropping" snarky comments he's been getting.
Tried this great new spot and the food was good. Nice portion size, great gluten free options.

We asked for a double when we reserved the room. When we checked in we were told they did not have any doubles available and the hotel was sold out. We had to settle for a single. They did offer a roll-a-way but that's not the same. The elevators are old, small and slow. The room itself was decent and clean with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly as well so that helped.

I love this place. The staff is incredible and the decor is amazing. We came back from the Eagles game sweaty, hot and aggravated heading to the restaurant in the back. Our server was awesome and the staff at the front desk extremely helpful and pleasant. This is not a chain hotel, this is an experience that is warm and inviting

This was the best service we've had in a very long time. With a party of 7, we know its going to be difficult to get seating snd srrvice, especially during Matdi Gras, but we were seated immediately, and I asked for a view and got that too. Steven, our waiter, was OUTSTANDING. He was very knowlegable about the menu and make suggestions for dessert. He was completely professional in his delivery of food items and graciously retrieved extra drinks and sauces for us. We'll definitely be bsck next year. Chris, the manager was also very accommodating and gracious. He stopped by our table a few times to make sure our visit was perfect. Completely pleased with the generous food portions and tasty food.  This is a must visit restaurant and nar in New Orleans. I would give 10 stars!

Went here with family while visiting in Indianapolis. The brisket was amazing! You barely had to chew it! It was the most delicious, tasty brisket I've had. Took a bite of my nephew's fried biscuit which was tasty too. Definitely a return visit when I'm in Indy again.

I want to thank agape films for their creativity! My video was a hit! Everyone in my family can't stop talking about how special the video came out! They are the best to work with! I am so grateful I met them!

I visited New Orleans last weekend, came across this place and had to give them a try since i was craving gumbo. There was no wait when we arrived which was good because  i was starving. We were seated at a very small table and so close to the people next to us that i could literally hear their whole conversation.. I ordered seafood gumbo and my boyfriend ordered a combination plate with jambalaya, etouffee and shrimp creole , we also ordered bbq shrimp, everything was great! Including our waitress and just the overall service.. Oh yeah and their alcohol drinks are strong and good too... By the time we left, it was a long line down the hallway of people waiting to be seated..

Tang Bistro's been on my radar ever since it first opened. A lot of Northern Chinese spots seem to have opened up recently (South Silk Road, Blossom Northern China Cuisine and Chinese Crepe). TB specializes in Xi'an cuisine.

We came on a Tuesday evening and the place was half full. The inside is quite spacious and even has a patio facing out onto 109 Street (after all, it housed Urban Diner). The menu is beautifully done and more upscale than your normal Northern Chinese spot.

- Liang-pi (cold noodles) ($7.50) - crap, I didn't realize that you had the option of getting this non-spicy, mild, medium or intense! Would love to see how "intense" it really gets. The cold noodles had a chewy, slippery bite. Comes with the usual bean sprouts, julienne cucumbers and spongy gluten. Good but I prefer Noodle Feast's version.
- Cucumber salad with garlic sauce ($6.50) - the cucumbers had a satisfyingly crunchy bite. The vinegar/garlic sauce was bright and refreshing. Would get this again.
- Spicy pig ears ($9.50) - the spicy pig ears had a tasty chili oil sauce. Great texture but the portion was pretty small for the price. CC thought it came in a "ear shaped" bowl.
- Scramble egg & tomato ($10.50) with hand pulled noodles ($2.00) - the hand pulled noodles had a great chewy toothsome bite to them and the egg & tomato sauce worked well with the noodles. The combo felt like you were eating Italian with an Asian spin to it. The egg reminded me some sort of delicious cheese. I know that sounds weird but it was good.

The dishes are a bit on the oily side of things but everything was solid. Will be back to try more dishes. 3.5 stars.

I don't know where all the negative reviews come from but this place was awesome! We got the two hour unlimited game card for $23 each and it was probably the most fun I've ever had at any arcade in my life! I played Jurassic Park, Transformers, Werewolf and House of The Dead 4 and they were so awesome. My favorite was the Werewolf one because the seat moved along with the game so it wasn't a sit game the whole time. Also, the race car games move as you drive too. I have nothing but great things to say about this place and I am so glad I got to go and experience it! Loved it! Definitely plan to go back and bring friends and family!

Amazing.

We went for lunch and it was our favorite New Orleans experience. The garden room is lovely, the service impeccable, and the food was to die for. 

We had the $.25 martinis - delicious and not lacking in alcohol.

I started with the salad and he had gumbo...it made him tear up it was so good ;)

We then had catfish and chicken - both excellent and good portions.

Finished up with a souffl - they even wrote Happy Anniversary on it!

Everyone makes you feel special there. Commander's Palace is not to be missed!
Another great lunch!  Signature Ribeye was outstanding, as usual!  All of the staff was attentive and professional.  I love this place!

I seriously love this place so much it hurts. The staff here was more than welcoming, the lattes were both incredible in taste and aesthetics, and the grits made this New England girl a true believer in southern cookin'.

If I lived within a 30 mile radius of this place it would be my go to spot for brunching and lunching. Also, their baked goods are unreal. I'm so upset I didn't try the goat cheese and blueberry muffins or the sweet potato, but the snickerdoodle cookie had my friends and I talking about this place for days.

Plus, it's just TOO cute and everything is local and fresh. You seriously cannot go wrong here.

Last April  I threw my back out when I was sound asleep. A friend recommended Cool Springs Chiropractic, made the appointment for me and drove me to the appointment. I've been seeing Peter for a year and my back is pain-free without any medications and I am so happy!! My husband came  to a visit with me and now sees Peter regularly also.  Our oldest daughter was getting neck pain while working at a desk on a computer all day. She saw Peter for a while and he also helped her. She actually mentioned a few days ago that she wants to go back for another adjustment. We would all highly recommend Cool Springs Chiropractic, very professional staff and just sweet sweet people.
Honestly the best corn bread I've ever had.  Service is excellent and freindly.  The portions are generous. The food is delicious and filling. Very reasonably priced for what you get.

Always good and cook fresh. I loved coming here for everything when I am in the area. The parking is a little crazy in the front but they have rear parking. I would say what to order, but I had mostly everything its all good.

I just want to add what I ate which was a grilled chicken po-boy with swiss cheese and grill onion and mushrooms ($ 9.25) large french fries ($3.95). My sandwich was good and stuff and my fries was hot and crisp. It was quiet at the time I went but it's usually large crowds.
Kim is the shit!!! Talk about bottomless mimosas... this is the spot damnit!  Food needed salt but everything else was perfect!!!

Came here for a work event...let me preface this by saying I didn't have to pay. Drinks were good, food was average. Service was average. We had a fun time, I would come back, but maybe not during a peak time.
This is the best captain d's ive been to yet!, great fast service, extremely fresh perfectly cooked food, very clean place! They doin it right!

As everyone says, BEST WINGS in the CITY! 'nuff said!
It's a nice little bar in the outskirts of the gayborhood. Always a good time

I hired Old City Movers after comparing a few different Philadelphia based moving companies here on Yelp. Old City Movers were great from the start. They were very clear on prices and what was included and what was needed of me. Prices were very fair. They quoted me at between 3 to 3.5 hours and it only ended up taking 3 hours. The three guys were super friendly, professional, and quite courteous. They helped me disassemble the bed and put it back together. They also asked whenever they had any questions of where things should go in the new house. They were extremely careful with out furniture and our new house. I would definitely hire them again.
The burger is blunt. I oredered Medium but I got Well done.. It has no flavor, it was so dry.

Today was my first time visiting this location, as it just opened two days ago. Service was fast and friendly, my food was hot and delish, and my order was 100% accurate. I'm sucker for the King combo, and usually can't finish it. Today I got close and am feeling pretty miserable, which is why they only got 4 stars. Don't pass up the horseradish sauce or the seasoning salt for the fries! Both are amazing!

I renew my review - especially after the response.

a) Was told - it would "likely" be $95
b) Person was not nice
c) Amazing - Best Buy was able to quote - WITHOUT seeing the computer.
d) Don't know why Geek in Pink Computer can't o an estimate as Best Buy did; not as capable?
e) And amazing - that Best Buy quote was lower than Pink Computer's least likely but possible quote of $45; Best Buy was $40. And the service was great.
f) Suggestion to the owner. Responses can be good and helpful. But - yours was not. It simply said "you're right - I'm wrong" - and - that's certainly your prerogative. I even more strongly suggest to any readers - go to Best Buy.
g) I like to buy local. But, not be taken advantage of. I'm absolutely certain that the charge would have been at least $90. It's not rocket science for anybody that knows anything about computers to know - what's involved on a brand like Toshiba - to install already purchased RAM.

I don't remember how I found this place, but I am glad I did.  It has become my standby especially for gifts for my Mom for mothers day and valentines day.  EVERYTHING is delicious, and they come in an awesome wooden box.  Many of the chocolates have a little story behind them like the elementary school mint chocolates.  The bugs are adorable and, when you're Mom's on a health kick, you can get her the fruit squares or the figs and she doesn't feel quite so guilty when she finishes the box.
Good little place. Stopped here after a visit to the zoo. Simple, quiet & friendly. Great Poo boy. Stopping by next time for sure. Try to have cash on you is better.
It was a great experience.  We were a larger group and service was great.  Food came quickly, was hot and very tasty.  It was a very good visit. We will be back.  Thanks

Food is delicious, service is slow. I'd give five stars but it took ten minutes for the server to come to us on a slow night (I checked the time, and yes only four tables taken not including ours) if she hadn't have been so nice it would've been more annoying but whatever.

Wow... The service here was fantastic. They took care of us from the moment we walked in until we left. Very attentive but never intrusive.

The food was yummy  too. From the starter bread to the appitizer to the entrees... Each was fantastic. My only regret was not having enough room for dessert. They looked delicious  just could do it. This way we have something to look forward to next time.

Very good

Highly recommend the meat/cheese board 

Can't go wrong with the stuffed porkchop. Pies are the best around.

Decided to go in despite some mixed reviews from awhile ago and I'm so glad we did! We were there on Monday so my husband and I had the BOGO shrimp dinner and they were fresh and delicious! I noticed that they also have all you can eat snow crab on Monday so we will definitely be back with my mom when she comes to visit. 

We lucked out because since NFL football was on we were able to get oysters for .50 a piece, you can't beat that deal! And happy hour is all day every day, usually we miss out by the time we get out for dinner but not here! We will DEFINITELY be back asap!
If I could go every day, I would go see the Tri-County staff at Exton Pa.  One of the best in the business.

We purchased a boat from Marine Specialties in 2015. They have been maintaining it for us ever since.  We also store our boat here during the winter months.  During the off season they take care if any repairs or maintenance that needs to be done so we can enjoy summer on the lake. Reasonably priced and great customer service. They are always very accommodating. I highly recommend them.

I didn't want to write a review on Abe's Place until I actually sat and had a meal in their restaurant instead of take out but I couldn't resist. To be honest the only thing I've eaten from here has been the wings and they are pretty bomb!

 Compared to other wing places I've eaten at, their wings are way bigger in size. So far I've only had the buffalo flavor but I definitely plan on trying many more.

Ok, I'm sold! The Piazza's new Pod Park opened today and it's such a wonderful use of old dead space. This lovely pastel colored, open air space is exactly what the area needed and where many will, and should be flocking to this summer. 

The tunes were bumping, thanks to a solid dj. The kids were playing in modern formations and on rocking horses. The doggies were wagging their tails, as they're welcome here, and folks were grabbing drinks from various shops shaped like cargo shipping boxes! Way cool! They included a Tiki bar, Craft Cocktail Concepts by Blume, Urban Village Brewing and more! Think anything from exclusive IPAs on draft to Frose' (frozen rose') and sangria. A lil something for everyone! 

All were enjoying the sunshine and good vibes.

There's a decent variety of food...Mama Maria's Italian Ice, Urban Empanada Box, Passyunk's own Essen Bakery, Tokai for vegan French Toast and bacon a la cart, Bru, Lil Sum Sum for dim sum and Spread Bagelry. 

There are some shadier areas and pretty textured white umbrellas. There are also really cool modern seating options. 

There are light strands, cut out iron lamp poles and marquee lights on the shops for at night. 

There's also a stage! I can't wait to see who performs! 

There's giant wooden Jenga and a neat viewing platform. 

There's even a toy store with bubbles and chalk to keep your kiddos busy. 

It's definitely a unique space I'm thrilled to see! It's so nice to have a reason to come back to this area again!!

Oh, and the friendly looking robot statue named Bebot, who was originally created for Burning Man at the entrance, is so fun! 

Dog park, large kids' space and nursing areas to come...

*As of Monday June 10th, the parking lot to the left of the entrance will have FREE parking with validation from any of the shops!

**Restroom are air-conditioned trailers in the rear of the park.
Last minute detour into this restaurant on a late monday night was awesome. Food was delicious and plentiful. They tailored our sons dish due to allergies and he loved it!

This place is great! Awesome food, wonderful and friendly service, complimentary wine. The menu is completely vegan and our group of five loved everything. The barbecues jack fruit sandwich was tangy, with great texture.  Also loved the quesadilla, turmeric rice dish, and those tacos - so yummy!! We loved the loaded nachos which we shared as well as the  . quesadilla/salsa/guacamole dips.
This will be our go-to meet up place. Loved the decor and vibe inside. Beautiful space. 
Love, love, love!

I'd like to start my review by acknowledging that Jeny took her time and thoroughly tried to fix what someone else in the salon started. I am very happy with the customer service and patience she gave me. That being said, I will still never return. I walked in without an appointment and asked for a full set of acrylic nails. I was greeted instantly by the owner/manager and sat at station 6. I told the man I wanted long tapered shaped similar to a "coffin" but not bowed out at the natural nail line. He seemed to understand what I meant. What first bothered me was that he did not clean my natural nails; did not trim them or push back and cut the cuticles. He used the nail drill to file the tops of my nails which is not a good practice as it makes the natural nail too thin. Then he glued on the nail tips. He did it very quickly and carelessly, so some of them were noticeably crooked but I figured that could be at least somewhat corrected along the way. He asked me how thick I wanted the nails and I explained I wanted them to be thick enough so that they were strong and had a nice curved apex (highest point in the middle of the nail plate). I started noticing how bad they looked while he was filing the sides and they only got worse after shaping and the final filing. Instead of the tapered square look I'd asked for, he did a dramatic coffin shape. I can understand there may have been some confusion due to a language barrier, but every single nail was terribly uneven and the apex on every nail was flat. Not to mention they were much shorter than I wanted. I stopped him and pointed out, explaining very thoroughly, each flaw. He said he did not see any problems with them and his other customers would've been happy with them as they were. I told him I was unhappy with the nail shape and wanted corrected. I spoke with the manager and waited 30 minutes until someone else was available to correct my nails. That's when Jeny did her best to correct the work. I am still really unhappy with the end result but I appreciate her trying to fix someone else's mistakes. The manager and the man who I originally started my nails made me feel like I was just a difficult customer because I was unhappy with the poor work done.
Bouncers keeping everyone outside when it's not even that busy inside. Not worth the wait. Tons of other places around to go to! :)

Nice staff but very average quality Mexican food. Their fish selection consisted of Tilapia. That should give you a good indication of the level of quality. However, I took my chances, ordered the (Tilapia) fish tacos, took one bite and sent it back. This place really more or less resembles a fast food Mexican joint.
Dr. Curtis is the best! Professional and very through! The staff is friendly and you can tell it is an all around good environment. Definitely found my new eye care facility!

As a disclaimer, I am reviewing it as Kanu and not the new pizza joint. I actually didn't know that Kanu switched to being a pizza place until I sat down and wrote this review. I was just there two weeks ago. So, as most people point out, the place is classy but expensive....and the portions are a bit on the skimpy side. I like going during happy hour (which I don't think they are having anymore) when the drinks and some appetizers are at a discounted price. Atmosphere is trendy and fresh. My only complaint is the chairs aren't that comfortable to sit on and chat. My girl friend and I split two  appetizers and had some wine. Both appetizers were fresh and tasty. I am not going into details in describing them because I am not sure if they are even still on the menu. I am willing to give this new pizza place a shot, but I really hope they have a happy hour.

Meh.

I was not very impressed with this Wasabi location. And I will preface this by saying I have been to two other Wasabi's (the one downtown, and the one out in Town and Country) and both of those locations were pretty good. The service at this Wasabi was wonderful, so I am not complaining about service. It was the food. Just terrible. I ordered a lot of nigiri.... amaebi, ikura, maguro, sake, tataki tuna, and uni. I was really excited for the uni too. But it was AWFUL. I seriously cannot believe they would sell this to people. Did the chef even taste it? It was not 'old' or 'sitting out' for too long, just to clarify. It must have been from Maine or maybe the urchins they harvested weren't in season....I don't know what it could have been. But my taste buds do not lie. It was sour, and even bitter. Instead of being soft and smooth in texture, it was almost chewy and it was definitely firm. Blegh. Totally cockblocked as I was prepared to buy a shitton of the stuff. The other things I had were only so-so. The tuna and salmon did not have great flavor. The tuna tataki was the only redeeming piece of sushi on the entire plate. I left still hungry as I sent the uni back. They were understanding about it, but ugh. It was just awful. I am not going to bother to come back to this location if they aren't serious about ordering good quality seafood for their sushi. :(
On the bright side, Bob's called me the very next day to tell me they got fresh urchin in-stock. Totally made me rejoice because the uni from Wasabi was just that terrible!

Jiffy lube helps serve its local communities, and families like mine. I have been a customer of this location and was treated very well by the staff. Today I stopped in and thanked them for helping people like me with muscular diseases.

Came her for the first time after I had been wanting to stop by for years on a Wednesday night. The place was PACKED, I think because of the gem show, but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. Unfortunately our table was right next to the front door, and it was a chilly night, so we weren't super comfortable even while wearing our jackets. Some of my review is probably a bit tainted by the fact that they were so busy, but they didn't handle the rush super well. It took awhile for someone to come take our orders, and then awhile for our food to arrive. The food didn't come all at once, but one thing at a time, which was a bit annoying when you're really hungry and just want to start eating. Also, they forgot an item from my order, so I had to wait awhile for it to arrive. I ordered the chicken vindaloo, which I expected to be spicy as vindaloo usually is, but it wasn't very spicy. I didn't find the flavor that great either, personally. Most of the Indian food I've eaten has been in the UK, so my standards may be a bit high, but I wasn't super impressed. I also had a chicken biryani that was ok but not great. Our naan was quite burnt, rendering parts of it inedible. However, the shining star of the meal was the chicken tikka masala - that may have been the best chicken tikka masala I've ever had. While I wasn't thrilled with my dish, I would definitely order the chicken tikka masala again. I also ordered a takeaway order at the same time that I placed my main, and I had to ask multiple people for it and go back to the counter in the back before I got it, after sitting and waiting for what felt like an eternity. If the chicken tikka masala wasn't so good I probably would never go back, but for that alone I would brave the crazy service just to have more

Have been here quite a few times growing up, and coming back for the holidays, I knew what to expect. It's a good restaurant by Burlington County standards, but if you've been outside of the area before and come back for the holidays, you know that this place is so overpriced and doesn't offer anything of quality. First, the decor is so outdated you feel like you've been transported back to a 90s banquet hall inside. The Christmas Eve menu was a mixture of fried food, steamed bag veggies for sides, and pastas in jar-like sauces. Among our dishes, we had the filet (40$ for a steak that wasn't prepared properly either the first or second time and was the size of a baby's fist); chicken francese (supposedly in a white wine sauce, but really just was a creamy/congealed butter sauce). This place is ok for senior citizen groups looking for a slightly-fancier alternative to a diner, but if you're going to pay the price this place charges, why not just go to Philly or NYC for quality food?

Handlebar is my favorite coffee shop in the world and I'm grateful it's here in SB. Used to make the trek downtown for the canon perdido location and have been thrilled with the de la vina one. 

Best lattes and cappuccinos ever and love the gilbralter roast for at home brewing. The food offerings are great too!

This restaurant is in a prime location facing Rittenhouse park. On a beautifully sunny Sunday, my boyfriend and I decided to stop in for lunch. We were able to request which side of the street we would like to sit on. We walked around the local shops and the host called my cell phone to notify us when our table was ready. The seats outside are petite bistro sets which seemed cozy and European. Being able to look at the sites in the park while eating was a plus.
I ordered the shrimp salad and Loved it! My boyfriend ordered the cheeseburger and enjoyed it too. There are not that many food items on the menu to choose from, which was a bit of a disappointment. The young male waiter was very professional and sounded like an 80 year old butler from an earlier century. It appears some people sit outside all day chatting and sipping cocktails in the sun. 
I really loved the location and European feel of this restaurant. I definitely will be returning!

I used to really love the old location that wok box took over. Don't get me wrong, the first time I went there the food was great. But over the years it really has become fast food. I viewed it as more of a restaurant before, but now it's just chinese McDonald's.

Started with tomato salad with anchovies. The salad is good, the anchovies were  not worth the upcharge, 4 anchovies from a can for an extra $2. I had the 14oz strip, peppercorn preparation. It was cooked to my desired doneness and I was pleased. My companion had french onion soup then the spicy seafood alfredo. I was told the soup was good, but the cheese topping wasn't very good and it seemed like it was a cheap cheese substitute. He liked the pasta and said it was a little more spicy than expected but good.  It is a good old school Italian restaurant.

Oh wow. I had been meaning to check out this place for a long time now since I am a tremendous fan of Peruvian food. One of my best friends is from Lima and he introduced me to Peruvian ceviche (which I have to admit, is better than Mexican ceviche), tiradito, lomo saltado and of course pisco!

Chifa is a type of cooking that Chinese immigrants created in the 19th century when they first arrived in Peru. They would try to replicate their recipes with the ingredients found in Peru. And to this day the style still exists and is considered to be very economical, like cocina economica.

Anyway, back to the restaurant. We came in with a tremendous appetite and wanting to try a bunch of things. We ordered the red curry with crab and eggplant, holy moly it was delicious! The lomo saltado, humita and Chinese pork. Everything was incredibly good. 

I had heard that the chef is a big fan of The Princess Bride, and he had a drink named after Iigo Montoya. I've never seen the movie but I do know of a famouse scene in the movie with this character. The actor is Saul from Homeland, fyi. The drink is made of tequila, passion fruit and thai chilis. DELISH! The hubby went with a Cusquea.

All in all, great atmosphere and wonderful food!

The food was ok at best, the portions will most likely not leave you with leftovers.  We ordered delivery, overall it was fast. The gentleman who answered the phone sounded more curt than welcoming.  After asking for our address he cut us off the first time we gave it then hung up on us midway through the second. We called back thinking it was an accident, he brushed it off like it wasn't an issue. We gave our address and order then he quickly ended the call without a thank you or goodbye.   
We will search for a place who actually wants our business in the future.
The food quality has gone down. I eat mostly at the one on 36th & Powelton. They don't have many vegan options like they use to. You leave there with buyer's remorse.

It was a cheap event and found it the day prior to race day so I decided to do it. I did the 10k which had roughly 27,000 people. The only downside is (like other races) many people don't know their place even though it's announced that slower people should be towards the back. I had to weave my self through a lot of people who were just walking within the first 1/2 mile which really frustrated me. It was great and all but if you're taking the provided shuttle back be warned it will be a long wait. So, either get in line early or find your own ride back. 

Weather was hot and humid but there were quite a few people who ran under 5:00/mile even in this weather. Beer and food that was provided was not bad! Especially since you could grab as much as you want unlike other races where they limit the free drinks to one or two cups.

Everything here seems simultaneously full of potential yet disappointing.

The beer list is usually good, but there's only one place to read it - a dark, small chalkboard. Seems that people seated anywhere other than at one end of the bar aren't privy to that info. When I went last, it was difficult to see what price each beer was supposed to be. Happy hour prices are a vaguely advertised mystery.

The location is great. It's a spacious corner property with bike parking and lots of street parking, but the space feels haphazardly furnished, like someone threw a couple of church pews chairs into an empty hall with some tables and added a bar at one end as an afterthought. The lighting is nice for a cozy bar atmosphere, though.

They have outdoor seating and serve food, but the service is incredibly spotty. Bars shouldn't try to be restaurants if they're not interested in good food and have a way of delivering it to tables. The nachos I tried a couple of months ago were barely passable. I've been spoiled by the Cantina for too long, it would seem.

"Eehhh."
Hey, what's not to like about this place! Great made to order sandwiches and salads. Every order is a delicious surprise. And a soda fountain with real sugar cane flavors. I eat here often for lunch.

We were in town looking for a retirement home. I needed to get my hair cut so bad could not wait to return home to see my stylist. 

Since I'm an Aveda user decided to give this place a try. 

As any senior knows it's pretty nerve racking going to a new salon. I became even more apprehensive when this young girl came out. She introduced herself to me and away we went
