When she finished I could not have been happier. I have great cut that suits my fine, thinning hair. 

When we finally get settled over here I will be returning to see KAITLIN. 

BTW from the receptionist to check out gal they could not be more friendlier.

I used to consider Penang to be one of my favorite restaurants. Up until two months ago, my partner and I ate there at least twice a month, frequently taking friends who'd never tried Malaysian food and and who weren't quite sure what to order. We begin every meal with the roti canai appetizer, which is wonderful, and we were attempting to try every entree on the menu. The last time that we went, however, we didn't have such a good time. We were starving, and we were eager to have a good meal. When we entered the restaurant, the young woman behind the counter asked us if we were there for the tasting party, and we told her that no, we just wanted dinner. She kept recommending it, and we finally said that we would give it a try. We were asked to pay up front (an anomoly) before she took us to a section of the restaurant that was separate from the rest, and seated us. We sat there hungrily for more than 20 minutes without being offered food or told about food. Whoever was running the tasting party ran it like a hot mess. The young woman who appeared to be in charge (not one of the regular staff) ran back and forth talking to people that she appeared to know. We finally decided to leave, so we got up and asked the hostess for our money back. She asked us if we wanted to sit down at a regular table and order, but the restaurant was much busier than when we first arrived, so I knew it would be at least another 20 minutes before we saw any food. I firmly said no, and we left. It was an extremely disappointing experience, and I'll hesitate to go back again. It's a shame that such a crappy experience has soured me toward such a good restaurant.

I always enjoy going here. The sandwiches are great, and the staff was very helpful. I got the Thanksgiving sandwich and the combination of ingredients was really delicious. I will definitely come back.

The worst hookah i've ever had 
And you cant tell the different from the morrocan tea and the water they give you which is just tap water and the charge you for it

Be prepared to hunt when you go in here.  It's not uncommon to walk out with nothing either, but that's the way it is at a store like this.  You flip through racks and racks of clothing to maybe find two pieces you like at a cheap price.  Their shoe selection is pretty good though and they always have a lot of sizes left when I go.  But don't bother with their home selection, it's really limited.

This is a real find.  through the end of August, 2011 the entire Lunch menu is $5.00 for anything.  You read that right - Their entire menu is available for just $5.00.  Pizza / Sandwiches /Wraps / Salads - Anything / Everything on the menu is just $5.00!!

And It Is OUTSTANDING!  Perfect lunch size portions; Food is High Quality and the service is quick!  My personal favorites: A Buffalo Chicken Wrap with fresh, home-made potato chips; A Meat Lover's Stromboli; Cantaloni and Gravy.  The table gets a basket of garlic knots and a bowl of red gravy (spaghetti sauce) for dipping.  I Love The Red Gravy

And what a great Red Sauce the chef has: It's just a little on the tart side,  spiced perfectly, smooth as butter and so good!  It has become my favorite restaurant red sauce.

And they have a complete dinner menu that's as outstanding as the lunch menu; Prices for dinner are $$ but the portions are very generous.  I recently had a dinner with pasta in red sauce with a Meatball, Sausage and a Rib - It was just this side of heaven.

The dining room is small - some might say intimate - with seating for about 20 to 30 people.

You will not be disappointed - unless you like your Italian food from the freezer.  

La Tavola is a real find.  Stop in and try the lunch - You'll be back for the dinners as well. 

Remember - the $5.00 Lunch Menu Expires on August 31, 2011.  You Have Been Warned!

Although the owners have changed, the quality remains five stars all the way. Now run by Eric and BJ, the Royal Elizabeth is still the best B&B experience we've ever had. Great breakfasts, super comfy accommodations, wonderful restaurant recommendations (with more places opening within walking distance every year), and just a friendly and welcoming vibe. We can't wait to go back!

The service was good but the food was mediocre.  I love chicken tortilla soup and had high hopes. My Dad loves posole. Sadly, these two soups were almost identical and neither tasted good - they were both very spicy with a burnt flavor. My stepmom's chorizo burrito was not tasty either. She is convinced the meat was actually ground beef. Tacos or nachos seem to be a better bet here.  Also, the music is super loud and it's definitely a festive bar vibe which is cool but not what we were expecting. Again, the service was good and the place was packed. Most of the happy people had margaritas and nachos. It's more of that kind of place.

I first came here back in February, when they hosted my friend's art show. They were so sweet and accommodating - at the time I was too broke to be eating out or even buying coffee, and they didn't give me a hard time for sitting in there for ages without ordering anything. (I make sure to tip extra now, to make up for my first visit...) I went back yesterday for the first time, and was struck anew by how much I loved the atmosphere - the art, the coziness, the friendly baristas. And this time I found out how good their food and coffee are! Their bagel sandwiches are delicious and will leave you absolutely stuffed, and I disagree with the reviewer who said their coffee was over-roasted. Their iced coffee, at any rate, was perfect and not nearly as acidic and bitter as, say, Starbucks'. I wish this place weren't so far out of my way, because I'd come here every day if I could.

Willa Jean is awesome...what a special space with delicious comfort food. I loved the corn bread appetizer and the meatball sandwich that I had for lunch. The frose was also outstanding!

It was all so relaxing and made me feel less like a tourist in such a great city!

AMAZING! everything was delicious!  The food looked just like the photos. We had fried chicken and biscuits with hot honey. The biscuit is the best I've ever had. It got a croissant outer snd soft biscuit inside. I'd go back just for the biscuits. The bbq shrimp toast was bursting with flavor and so was the grain bowl. The cookies and milk, so delicious and the wedge salad was enough fir three. And scrumptious. The avocado toast, Brussel sprouts and matcha tea was sold out. Our very personable server said these items were very popular. If you like the farm house rustic feel with a modern twist and amazing comfort food. This is a must. On my list to revisit.
Absolutely delicious! Such a great experience. The food was fresh and amazing. Service was wonderful. The patio is beautiful.

I had a pretty good experience here last week. Came in with a friend for dinner on Tuesday night and we were somewhat in a rush. The wait to sit down was 10 minutes but we didn't want to wait for that so we sat at the bar which was empty. We waited at least 5 minutes for someone to come over and had to ask to see a menu so we could quickly place an order. I havent been to olive garden in a year and at first glance of the menu I thought the entrees looked a little over priced. To my surprise we also got a choice of soup or salad and we get unlimited breadsticks. The soup and salad is actually a pretty large portion. I ordered lasagna and took my leftovers home. I had a full size meal leftover. 
Overall olive garden was clean, the employees were nice, but in no rush.

DO NOT GO HERE. My mom went here in the summer after she got bit by a snake. The nurse jabbed a needle so hard into her arm my mom yelped in pain. 

A few weeks later, my mom was still in excruciating pain. Turns out the nurse inserted the needle wrong and as a result my mom developed what is known as "frozen shoulder." She has been out of work for months and is unable to lift anything or move her arm at all. She is miserable and in the worst pain of her life everyday. Writing this review today because she just got out of surgery for it. Just wanna say thanks to that nurse who acted like my mom was being dramatic!

10 stars.

Last night, I had a 5 course meal cooked by a man that is not a chef, does not own a restaurant, but cooks for the love of cooking.  I understand he cooks over at the downtown Farmers Market, now and then.

His name is Vivek.
I'm going to go all the way out and say that his meal was by far, better than any meal I have had in any of the local restaurants..
Better, than any of the fancy schmancy restaurants I have eaten in..

His attention to diversity in taste, texture, flavor.. It was all there.
From his salad with garbanzos and peanuts with radishes, cilantro and mint..  It took my breath away.  I have not had such a wildly diversified taste in ingredients as I did this salad. Light, tasty, my mouth exploded with flavor.  

His ribs were rubbed with zingy dry spices.. fall off the bone meaty pork ribs with such good spicy flavor.

His lamb mixed in with basmati rice.. He did not throw away the lamb drippings but incorporated them to give the rice such deep flavor..

If you are on the POP Nashville mailing list, watch for this mans name to pop up and grab a ticket.
This is the BEST deal in Nashville for excellent food at an excellent price.
Absolutely amazing..
I cannot say enough good things about this man and his cooking AND the wonderful people who run POP Nashville.

This IS THE JEWEL of Nashville.
All I can say is WOW!

Terrible business.  DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BUSINESS. They make you pay cash when dropping off clothes, not when picking up the finished product.  Attendant said another customer dropped the credit card machine, which "broke it," and they didn't fix it.  I pointed out to attendant that my shirts had rings around the collar and he tried to demonstrate that by spraying a pre-treatment and brushing them it would work.  Well, when I picked-up the shirts, they still had stains on them.  I told the same guy who was there when I dropped off the shirts that they were still dirty, he claimed to clean them and did not offer to clean them again.  The shirts are un-acceptable to wear in public.  I will never return to that business and they don't warrant even a 1 star rating on here.  Paying cash prior to receiving shirts was a mistake and now I know exactly why he said the credit car machine was broken.  They most likely will go out of business soon.  Repeat, DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BUSINESS.

Came here to celebrate a friend's belated birthday. We ordered the Sun roll, Volcano roll, crunch roll, box sushi, and the albacore delight roll and the teriyaki chicken bowl. Looking outside the restaurant, first impression is that it looks like a more run down restaurant but I wasn't going to base it just off looks.

The sushi is sooo good! The fish is super fresh and all were really good. The volcano roll however is a hit or miss since its served hot and wrapped in foil which is what you don't expect when eating sushi. The teriyaki bowl was okay, chicken was pretty bland. But I would definitely recommend the sushi. 

Sun sushi however is a little on the pricier side so expect to pay more. However the quality of the sushi is well worth it. They were super stingy on the wasabi and ginger. There were 4 of us but only served one mini plate for all of us to share. The waitress was nice enough to bring out a little more but only when we asked.

We all ordered green tea ice cream for dessert along with Mochi. Can never go wrong with green tea ice cream! They even were sweet enough to sing happy birthday to my friend with a candle on the ice cream which she enjoyed very much! The waiter also offered to take pictures of as well too.

Overall the sushi was great and the service was awesome!

The food was amazing!! Our service was pretty slow (there was a moment where we thought our server had forgotten about us, it took him 20 minutes to bring our drinks out), but the restaurant was extremely clean and everything we had was delicious!
Perfect soccer mom joint. The kids will enjoy it while mom enjoys the price.

Me and my boyfriend try to go here every Sunday. I highly recommend the sit in all you can eat for $15.99. We have never been disappointed. My takeout experience for here has not been so great, hence the one star off.
The worst Chinese restaurant I've ever eaten in Tucson. Their chow fun had more veggie than noodle. The cabbage piece were so thick, didn't bother to slice it. Big couple of chunks. Ugh. No thank.

The Grand Isle was the perfect place to end my trip in New Orleans. The service and food were wonderful! 

My friends and I started out with the Crab Dip and the Crawfish Beignets. I absolutely loved both! The Crab Dip was piping hot and accompanied by crispy bread while the Crawfish Beignets were so flavorful and unique! 

After trying these two amazing appetizers I knew I had to order more! Thus, I also ordered the Chargrilled Oysters which were out of this world!! The oysters were smoky but the Parmesan cheese on top brought the perfect contrast! 

For my main dish I ordered the Creole crawfish pasta with a side of the Smoke Fried Oysters. What can I say? I'm a hungry girl! The Creole Crawfish Pasta was creamy and yummy! The Smoke Fried Oysters were crunchy and the remoulade sauce was the perfect touch! 

Overall, my food palette loved this restaurant! Thank you for having us!

Came to this bar because I am new to STL and heard it was a great spot for karaoke. Even did my research on the very vague website only to go there, be served horribly, for there to be no karaoke. Only had one drink because the bartender was too busy serving the other TWO tables in the building. Ordered a pizza that she forgot about and brought out to me burnt. Will never go back.

I agree with Laura's review below.  I hate stools and benches. I like to be able to relax and rest my back.  I'm not fat, just not a fan of being uncomfortable when I eat out.  Enough of my friends have raved about the carrot cake that I'll probably buy one to take home for my husband's birthday.  However, eat inside I will not!

The fried pickles were great as they were spears and not chips.i went on a Saturday and the place was dead. So the atmosphere wasn't great. As a former restaurant owner and having a spouse who has been in restaurant Mngt for 30 years, I didn't like that the Owner was drinking and working behind the bar. In fact, if anyone from the "alcohol" commission saw that, they might have an issue . Very unprofessional. The two female bartenders were very attentive but would like to see their work when The was more than one person at the bar.

My parents recently moved to Newtown so they received a coupon for free dozen bagels from Newtown Bagel Co. Since my parents always have a bagel and coffee for breakfast, I went with my mom to pick up some bagels for them while I was visiting. We felt bad asking for just the free bagels, so we asked for 2 dozens and picked up 2 tubs of cream cheese as well.  

There was no one in the shop as we went in at around 1:30 pm and they close at 2 pm on most days.  We were greeted by a gentleman, but he went into the back as we were picking out the cream cheese and a younger girl helped us with the bagels.  

I felt a bit awkward because as soon as I told the employee that we had a coupon for a free dozen and wanted to get a total of 2 dozens, she said they are pretty low on bagels and asked if we wanted to come back tomorrow and said they probably only have about 2 dozens left (which may have been true if she counted just the ones that were in the bins... but there were about another 5 dozens prepacked on their countertop.)  I knew most bagel shops close early and expected to have a less of a selection available to us, but I didn't expect her to ask me if we wanted to come back another day.  Maybe she was just being considerate... because she wanted us to have more to choose from?  But I just felt that wasn't the thing to say to customers that made their first trip there (with a coupon which made me feel a bit more uncomfortable). She must have known it was our first time there because only first time customers can use the coupon.  

Anyways, I told her that we would see what they have left and go from there... and we were able to pick out the 2 dozen bagels and they still had about another dozen or so left in the bins alone.  I was thinking maybe she said that because they would have to reject other customers that came in after us if they ran out, but they were going to close very soon and they still had a good amount of bagels left.

I wanted to see if she would offer to cut the bagels for me... since throwing them into a bagel cutter is way less work than me sitting at home and cutting 24 or so bagels, but unfortunately she didn't offer and I didn't ask since I just felt a little bit uncomfortable there.  Afterwards when I mentioned this to my mom she said maybe they don't have a slicer... which.... I doubt, but if that's the case I apologize for mentioning this at all.  The employee did offer to give us some freezer bags though, which was nice of her.

As for the bagels, I enjoyed the bagels... they tasted just fine.  I read some other reviews and some people said they were too light and didn't fill them up... and I can see why they say that, but I don't mind because I actually don't mind a lighter bagel.

I would go back and grab some more bagels if my parents needed some when I'm in town, but my first experience wasn't exactly what I expected.

Amazing experience!!! First of all our server Nick was superb! My fianc and I loved having him as our waiter - super knowledgeable about the menu, so nice & when we did the whiskey tasting & told him to pick his favs...he did not disappoint! Would go back again and probably request to be seated at a table Nick is serving because he was that awesome. 

And the foooood!!! We did the chef's tasting where we got to pick 3 starters, 2 entrees, 1 side, and a dessert that is portioned for two for $45 pp and WOW. Everything was the bomb - my fav was the smoked ribs and the mussels (the meatiest mussels we've had). We also had the octopus (delish), the burrata (creamy), the hanger steak (cooked to perfection), the crawfish Mac & cheese (tasty), and the ricotta dessert balls - HEAVEN! 

Had to share a lengthy review because we already can't wait to go back!! Highly recommend.

During the summer of last year, I paid over 1000$ for their services for termites. The contractor told me they would do a second treatment if I saw termites again. A few months ago I did. I called them to schedule a treatment, but they said I could not get another treatment because they had to see termites in this house. For clarification, they said nothing about this when I was about to sign the contract. I even showed the inspector pictures of termites in my yard. Practically a scam.  Nothing in the contract says that in order for me to get another treatment I have to show termites IN my home

This place has great food. I absolutely crave their thick juicy burger. Fries are yummy. Their traditional wings are some of the best in west county St Louis. Their bbq ribs are delicious. Highly recommend this place. And they were super fast delivering when ordering takeout! I love supporting our neighborhood restaurant. They also have a tv and heaters outside which is perfect COVID safe place to watch the games

Downtown St Louis.  Great dining experience!  The waiters know their meats and do a presentation and detailed explanation of all of the cuts available!  The sides were also very good.  Had the 16 oz ribeye but probably shoulda got the bone in filet.  The ribeye was juicy and marbled but the filet looked even better.  

For the sides, the spinach had a citrus type flavor which was different but good, and Brussels sprouts, gnocchi, the mash potatoes all great!  Probably the best part of the meal was the desserts.  Ordered a creme brulet which was good but saw the apple dessert creation and decided to order that too.  The desserts are are Flintstone style - ginourmous :). 

Overall a double thumbs up!  And best of all, right across the street from my hotel so no commute!

One of our clients where I work told me I needed to go see Sandi, because she is the brow goddess. She was not kidding. She is amazing and super fun. I have myself on a regular schedule with her now, and I am not mad about  it all. I also LOVE the wax they use and the brow powder is my new jam.

Best bacon I've had, great burger - very yummy food all around 
Great spot and worth pulling off the interstate for

Flavorful, healthy, classic southwestern breakfast. Hash browns were freshly made and had just the right kinda chili-enhanced snap. Eggs, coffee like you'd expect it. (Coffee was slightly better than the classic diner fare). 

Lovely setting. Good service. Nice price. 

Great neighborhood joint. Wish we had a place like this in Skinker-Debaliviere.

The menu online is a little different from the menu we had when we were there this past weekend.  I'll write the review based on what I remember.  The atmosphere was really cool.  They had two dining room areas and a courtyard.  We got a seat outside near the fountain but to get there we have to pass through the kitchen which was pretty neat.  I got bitten by mosquitoes 5 times that night but that's the disadvantage of sitting outside.   The service was creepily friendly.  They refilled all non-alcoholic drinks regularly and they had two people serve your entree so they arrive on the table at exactly the same time. 

Things we ordered:
Angry Oysters - Fried oysters on top of a corn chowder.  This is pretty good.  The cajun seasoning overpowered the oysters though. 

Shrimp stuffed with ham -  This tasted like a buffalo chicken wing.  The pickled onions and okra was amazing with the shrimp and ham.  Probably one of my favorites that night. 

Seafood Bisque - There was no seafood in it and a bit salty for my taste. 

Wild Mushroom Gnocchi - Tons of mushrooms and flavors were good. 

Some kind of crusted fish - Really really good.  

That's all I can remember.
Perfect food, quantities and service! The food was super FRESH. I will send friends and family. Thank you.

What a helpful team. I needed new residential garage doors and knew very little. From the receptionist being able to answer some questions as I began my research, to James (the owner!) who came out to measure and discuss options, to Chris and John who installed my two garage doors, they were all knowledgeable and respectful. I would definitely recommend them for their professionalism and customer service.

I like the decor, love the breakfast and the coffee is top notch.  When i'm feeling nostalgic about the 90's grunge days, this is my nashville go to spot and it gives me a little time to ponder what ever happened to that Afghan Whigs CD I let my roomie borrow.

Great place! The atmosphere for a Monday night was really nice! Lots of menu items that all sounded delicious. I love the local brews list (but a bit pricey...$10 for a Green Bench IPA!?). I had the Belly Up burger which was really really good. The fries are crunchy, the pork belly is always a great alternative to bacon. But the egg, THE EGG! Awesome place to go after work. Especially for the specials ($6 for a $12 burger!) 
Definitely going to be a regular!

This place brews its own beer, but it's more like Miller Lite than the craft beer you can get at a lot of places in Indy. My porter was a bit flat and flavorless. Rock Bottom brews stronger, more full-bodied and flavorful beer.

The food isn't too bad--we had an appetizer pizza that boasted basil, tomatoes and sausage, but the latter was M.I.A. The chicken lettuce wraps could have benefited from more finely chopped chicken. 

This place isn't all bad; the hefeweizen is pretty good. So are the big screens above the bar, if you're going to watch a game.

Dining shortly after Bruno sold to his partner Sal and, I believe nephew, Reno a couple of years ago, things just weren't the same. Obviously they were trying to cut cost. Since then, I've visited numerous times and they've not only rebounded but they've lowered their prices. How do you get a salad or soup, phenomenal bread and fresh peppers, and a large portion of cavatelli smothered in a delicious white wine and broccoli rabe sauce for only $19?

This place is amazing!  They provide the perfect grass seed based on what your particular lawn needs. And it works! We have tried for years to make a shady spot in our yard a grassy area...and now it is. So much more cost effective and it works!

Didn't know to write this or not....last month we came in. .and went to order...no salad...no baked potatoes...no sirloin steaks....service off..7:10 on Friday night..only 3 tables. Wonder why ? I'm months since new owners...no beer..no potatoes....no steaks. Prime rib..salads..yup !!
Just picked up my doggo from CC Pet Care and he is so so soft! I can see his eyes! I love that I can text with them about booking/pick ups. Definitely recommend them!

The hidden gem of Apollo Beach! Well, not sure how hidden it is, but is for sure is a gem. They are on the edge of breaking out of this place it's so busy. I go here at least 1 time a week, and its the only place i buy meat (unless i', im a pinch and/or its a Sunday) They have fish, beef, pork, chicken, lobster, the good spice rubs, bbq sauces, you name it. Seriously, can't say enough good things about this place. Also, try their pre-prepared items - A++++

Johns water ice is the best!!! I want for this to be open every what.
I absolutely love the chocolate and pineapple ice. Their ice is so smooth and perfect!
The ice cream is also great. I like doing a chocolate ice with strawberry ice cream mix. Or pineapple and vanilla ice cream mix.
Superb place! Friendly service.
Found this today. Great place with well made traditional meat pies. Give them a try!  Owner was extremely nice, also.

I've found a new fave place to become addicted to!!! Everything is so fresh and the restaurant looks clean. A huge plus!! There's endless combination possibilities for building your bowl and burrito. I got noodles as my bowl base and loaded up with spicy tofu and shrimp tempura. The sauces are where it's at!! As a drink, I got a freshly cracked coconut. So refreshing. I will be back

I went back to Nico's for a second try and I must say that I was pleased by the improvement. My husband had the Green Chile with Tortillas and the sauce was phenomenal- my only complaint is that this is a pork only dish because I think they slow cook the sauce with the pork at the same time. I had the Chicken Tacos and they were tasty with a good heat and flavor to them. 

One consideration the menu does not describe the items in question so you will have to ask if you have any dietary restrictions.

Jacob knows trees. It is so obvious by the way he artistically trims them. He looks at each tree like a friend and makes cuts that are not only healthy for the long term growth of the tree but are also pleasing to the eye. It is rare to find someone with his knowledge and ability who can meet the needs of his customers with a love for his work like Jacob. His work ethic is admirable. He shows up on time, completes the work he says he will complete for that day, and thoroughly cleans up at the end of each day. He worked for a week on our property trimming 6 fan palms, one huge old oak tree, three smaller oaks, and cut a gigantic hedge that was higher than our roof and about to take over one whole side of our house. He also did a beautiful job on our neighbor's Canary Palm.  His prices are competitive with other tree companies (I got 4 bids). Jacob is also respectful of the neighbors asking permission to clean up on their lawns and making sure they were okay with the view from their side. It was a pleasure to work with him and I plan to use him for many more jobs.

Update - CLOSED? - Went on Oct 14, 2017.  Lights out, door locked.  No "closed" sign, but no one in the store.  Called them three times on Oct 28, no answer.

-----  (ordered review) -----

My daughter was attending a middle-school fund raiser at a nearby Applebee's, so my son and I had to find a way to burn an hour of time.  I punched "bagels" into Yelp, and Brooklyn Bagels caught my eye.

I grew up in Brooklyn, so the phrase "Brooklyn Bagels" has a very specific, almost sacred meaning to me.  Sure, I appreciate the appeal for any bagel restaurant to apply "Brooklyn" to their name - it's not legally-defined, and it improves business.

This place is the real deal.  I don't know exactly what makes bagels from Brooklyn so special, but out of all the bagel restaurants I've been to in Southampton / Willow Grove / Warminster / Hatboro / Horsham / Huntingdon Valley area, only this place nailed it.  The texture and flavor are perfect.  The New York-style menu spans much of the room.  The owner (I presume he was the owner) is friendly, and the sandwiches are excellent.

The ambiance isn't great, and seating is limited - but from what I recall of similar places in Brooklyn, that too is authentic.  

I strongly recommend Brooklyn Bagels, and as you drive there, make a point of sticking your hand out the car window and flipping off any "Manhattan Bagel" franchises you pass on the way.

The bacon, egg and cheese on a glazed doughnut was nothing short of amazing. I am a fan of savory, sweet dishes and it was perfection. I went back the next day for another. 

They have a cheeseburger on a glazed doughnut, but I told myself that I wouldn't try it until I lost 5 of the 15 lbs. that I need to shed. That doughnut burger is surely something I am willing to work toward. That's going to be one hell of a cheat/reward meal.

Not impressed with the "bento" style lunch box. Presentation was sloppy, half bowl of rice, teriyaki vegetables were mostly cabbage and the crunch shrimp roll was tasteless.
The miso was good but the dressing on the salad was not appealing. (I normally love ginger dressing.) 
Part of me wants to try again but I also want good food that fills me up. 
Maybe your meal will be better?
Ate here last week the place was clean and service was great. The soup and drunken noodles were to die for and I will be back soon for another great meal.

Great dive bar...one set of taps is your usual domestic offerings, one is a little more daring.  Good, attentive bartenders.  Cash only.

(haven't tried the food yet, but I'll report back when I do!)

Cute little place and I hope it does well. The tart flavor was good, but left a little bit of an after taste. The toppings selection wasn't huge,pretty basic. The reason I'll come back is for the maraschino cherries. I am a closet maraschino cherry eater. I love them.The tart mixed with the cherries, oh sooooo good. Usual froyo flavors. Self serve and you pay by the ounce. Even though I had at least a half a jar of cherries in that cup, it wasn't too pricey.Really nice people working there. Will definitely come back.

Great burger! I got the classic Kobe and the onions / praline bacon were out of this world! It was after rock n roll marathon, so it was wonderful there was a casual part downstairs where we could place an order and sit to wait on our food. The tater tots were odd, and the fries I believe were old, but we did come in at an odd time. The guac was delicious! We did have a beer situation where I was without a beer for entirely too long (they ordered an Abita Strawberry from upstairs, but it never came??). At least 5 workers were in there doing busy work, we were the only table, so that was mildly aggravating. I would go again, tho.
What can I say - I have never had anything bad from here.  I love the Bonzilla sushi burrito and bon bon salad always leaves me wanting more.  For this price who can beat it!?

Overall- not the worst I've ever had but with Mexican restaurants being so plentiful.... pass this one by. First they sat us at a round booth that was really small for 6 people even though they had plenty of open tables. The server was pleasant enough but took a long time to come take our order. Salsa was pretty bland but cheese dip was good. Our food took forever to come out then when it did they didn't bring it all at once. And my sons nachos had sat under the warmer so long they were very soggy. And my daughters steak was super greasy. My taco salad was very good though. Just a mediocre experience and way overpriced compared to the average Mexican restaurant. To top it off the cashier didn't bother getting off his personal phone call to take my money.

We recently moved to the area and have gone here to eat/drink about 6 times. The Shrimp po boy is delicious and the portions are great! 
 Although I have noticed that the staff is more concerned about not working/hanging out with each other than actually doing their jobs. 

Our last visit there was an absolute nightmare. We were seated but never waited on. After about 15 minutes I got up and went to the girl who sat us and asked who our waitress was. We finally got waited on and received our food. Although I have had the Shrimp Po boy at least 3 times prior, this time it was terrible. I have worked in the food industry for 11 years and could tell specifically that the oil desperately needed to be changed in the fryer. When this isn't done frequently it causes the food to taste burnt. 

They were not very busy and about 5-6 of their employees were all sitting outside next to the bar just chilling while we received terrible service and food. 

I've read some of the other reviews and apparently this happens frequently. 

If they could get their staff in order this place would be 4-5 stars.

I have been taking my dog here for many years.  Dr. Newman is always very good with her.  He and his wife are very nice people.  I find the cost is very reasonable.  At times I think they are quite cheap.  I personally would highly recommend this Vet.
I just brought a pizza home and it was excellent,I recommend this pizza place. Ordered by their website picked it up 25 minutes later- no problems.
Great breakfast! Great service. Unique menu. More than just your normal breakfast items.....they step "outside the box."  We had a group of 8 and everyone enjoyed their meal.

Tried Famous Jays the other day. Came in and ordered a Pulled Pork dinner with green beans and baked beans. When I came home, I got both of the beans but the pulled pork turned to BBQ Ribs. The ribs were good but I'm not a fan of ribs, hence I ordered pulled pork. Maybe next time they get it right!! Place was empty and the cook was sitting at the bar when I ordered with the woman and he insisted to get the food for me and it came out wrong

My in-laws treated me to lunch here and what a treat it was! I had a Mediterranean burger, a lamb and beef blend, it was soooo scrumptious my spouse and I came back a few days later, we just had to have another before we went back home. It's an engaging decor with lots of memorabilia, and a very friendly staff even though the place was totally packed when we were there.  Thanks Mom and Dad G.!

Beautiful and Historic! I really love this place from the preshow music that vanishes into the stage to the stary skies that wish me sweet dreams as I leave after the show!

I heard they just went digital and the sound booms and no one has to carry film rolls of Gone with the Wind that weigh over 100 pounds (thanks NPR). 

Paid 10 bucks for a Sunday night show. Only one movie to choose from, makes the decision easy. But even considering the higher cost and limited selection, this place is AMAZING!

I really love the architecture and decor. I could come here with no movie playing and just wanted around. It is really old school and really cool. 

I did not try the food and the seats could be more comfortable, but this is a unique Nd authentic movie going experience, and I cannot complain about a thing. I plan to go out of my way to come back here. The Tampa Theatre is a true landmark.

This is the most humiliating place I have ever eaten. Hamburger and wings were burnt Chrispy , yes they served it ! They gave me back my hamburger with about a 8 inch hair in it .  I'M DONE FOR LIFE.....  YOU MAY AS WELL EAT WITH DOGS !!!  Their filthy .

I was searching for a salon in Philly and came across Salon Bass since it had such good reviews and let me tell you it did not disappoint! I had an appointment with Joe for a cut and color and he is amazing. Freshened up my color and gave me a fresh new cut and I am in love! I will definitely be coming back to Joe from now on and I highly recommend him.

Had an amazing experience working with Joey Gilbert law on my case. I was constantly being updated on the status of my case. Every phone call I made, I had staff members who truly cared about their work doing everything they could to reassure me everything was being done to handle the process properly and efficiently. I could not  have been more happy with how things worked out. Truly phenomenal team who cares about their work.

I'll make this brief (since I tend to get long winded with my reviews):

-Been coming here since it was attached to West Coast Video (yikes - throwback!). I would DREAM about their chocolate chip cookies and had to make my mama get me one whenever we rented a VHS. 

-Best Cookies (IMHO): Chocolate Chip, Heath Bar

-MILKSHAKES! Their mint chocolate chip milkshakes are my personal favs. I usually ask them to do half whole, half fat-free milk in order to try and cut the calories. Still delish.

-Careful of the employees! LOL. They're all high-school/college kids who are probably in the midst of their first employment so be patient and watch what they're doing so you can get what you ordered! The upside to this is that they can be very generous with the portions and sometimes dish out the extra milkshake in a side dish if they made too much (no extra charge! Be sure to tip well).

-Try and get there or find out when the cookies are coming out fresh from the oven. I mean, this experience is DIVINE. Hot, melty, scrumptious cookies from Hope's are like none other.

-Now that Hope's is attached to Peace A Pizza which actually used to be seriously good before they went mega-local-chain on us. Haven't even bothered getting a slice here in years but, from what I remembered, they went from amazing to mediocre to borderline bad. Sadville. A slice of White pizza and a milkshake used to be the best combo...

Ok. I think I've said my piece! Yay, Yelp!

So good, we went back the next night too! Fantastic seafood, great service, and live music too. The shrimp, oysters and scallops are all phenomenal. The coconut rice is a family fave. There's a lovely outside seating area, but we love being inside near the music. We saw two different acts and both were really good. This has quickly become our fave restaurant on Treasure Island! We'll definitely see you next time!

I am born and raised in Chicago.  I moved here two years ago and was very excited when they opened up the Chicago staple, Harold's Chicken.  I have been here several times with the last time being the worst.

We stood there waiting on someone to take our order.  No one greeted us or asked if they could take our order.  He just looked at us.  My husband ordered a perch dinner with salt, pepper and mild sauce (it's a Chicago thing).  We had to clean our own table with wet napkins in order to dine-in. When he got his food, they were the smallest two pieces of fish I had ever seen!  For ten bucks, I expected a little more, especially since this was not the first time we've ordered the perch dinner.  

I'm just really disappointed that they could not keep up the service and food they presented when they first opened.

Love it, Love it, Love it.
Been there a couple of times.  I live in Carson City and will make the drive just to go to the Depot.  The food has been flavorful and fresh.  The onion rings are delicious.  The beer is very tasty.  Prices are reasonable for the quality you are getting.  I will be going back and telling all of Carson City how great it is.

Not bad for a chain restaurant in a train station.  The food came out quickly and no one really bothered us while we killed time waiting for the train.  There was a little bit of a fruit fly issue though, but that may have been a fluke.

Came in for dinner and it was our first visit here. Walked in and was welcomed right away and the place was very neat and cool decor. The place was busy. The menu had a lot of options and we got the wings, philly, chips n salsa which was amazing. Our server Molly was very sweet and on top of things. Very pleased with our first time and we will definitely be back again and again.

The food, drinks and service were sub-par. Upon ordering out drink, we were told that we had to order food as well which was not part of our plan and was not something that was mentioned prior to us being seated.

Yes. 

It's expensive, and I waited about 10 minutes between ordering and getting my food (there weren't THAT many people...), but worth it. They have some dipping sauces, but I prefer it just plain
the food is pretty good, and they also have good beers. the popcorn that comes with the Bourbon flight is amazing!

The best thing about Tobey's Junk Hauling is when you call, you get TOBEY! 

I called and left a message and within a few hours Tobey called me back. We discussed what I had to haul and he gave me a verbal "guesstimate". The stuff I had him haul was a HUGE 10ft x 8ft x 3ft old timely entertainment center wall unit. It was BIG and HEAVY. 

In all fairness you can't really give an accurate estimate over the phone when you are a junk hauler...you can only guess. 

Tobey arranged to come over the next day and called me when he was on his way. He looked at the job and revised his estimate, we agreed on the price and we were good to go. 

Tobey and his associate moved the goods and away they drove. He not only saved by back, he saved me from borrowing a truck, he saved me a trip to the dump, he saved me from having to ask a friend help me move it, he saved me time.

If you need anything hauled away by a really nice fellow, give Tobey's Junk Hauling a call...you won't be sorry.
I made a great review of all the issues from roaches to ceiling leaks and they had it taken down saying it was false. It wasn't false it was a night mare.

If you're visiting Santa Barbara, you have to eat at Brophy (Brothers). A pirate tends bar downstairs, for chris'sakes. Go raw for as many courses as you can stand while you sit and watch a sunset fade into the horizon behind the marina. Wait longer for a seat on the upstairs patio unless you like sitting at the busy bar. Key advice: Don't get too plastered at The Endless Summer while you're waiting for a table. You might forget your keys at the hostess stand.

I've eaten cuban/carribean food all over the world, and El Cubanito is my favorite place ever.  I admit I'm fairly biased: I was one of their first customers when they opened in 1995, and they were my gateway into the world of east latin american cooking.  The brothers who ran the shop were always friendly to me and recently when I returned I saw that the same brother is still running the place, still serving *exactly* the same food.  The type of Cuban they cook is simple, homestyle cooking and I prefer the final product to the Versailles either in Miami or Los Angeles.  Beverages include a wide selection of cuban canned sodas (Materba, Ironbeer, Matey), great fruit smoothies/shakes, and Cuban Coffee.  Authentic Cuban decor features a wall of baseball bats signed by various Cuban players and a very unflattering effigy of a skeletal Castro for those who are unclear on the proprietor's political views.
Breakfast sandwich was awesome!! Came here for breakfast, the feel of this place almost looks like a European eatery. Hospitality was prevalent throughout my experience.

My husband and I had our wedding reception at the Randall Gallery last weekend, and it was amazing!! The venue is so gorgeous; there's a lot of beautiful art, so you don't have to worry about decorating. 

Mark and Joe are wonderful to work with, and made the whole planning process really easy on us. (This was a huge deal to me, since we were planning our wedding from Seattle.) They were very helpful and quick to respond, and made our celebration spectacular! 

The food was really delicious, and our guests were very happy. I also love the flow of the place, and that we could use multiple levels. Everything went so smoothly; we all had a blast! I could not have imagined a more perfect venue for us. I would definitely recommend the Randall Gallery to all St. Louis brides, and for other events as well!

Truthfully, I was not impressed with the meal I had here. With such high regards from fellow yelpers, combined with the location of this place (the heart of French Quarter) I thought I was in for a real NOLA treat... Unfortunately, my taste buds had a much better time at other local restaurants with better prices. 

While the food was underwhelming, I must say that all of the staff that I encountered were very pleasant and easy to connect with, from the hostess to the busser, which I did appreciate about this place.

I really like it. I seem to tend towards local companies, and since moving to the St. Claude neighborhood, we're not in range of the prytania theater. My wife and I have seen a few movies here so far this summer, and the prices are reasonable ($7 for a matinee, $11.50 for the mark up on a 3D film after 4). As a tall guy, the seating is very comfortable, with plenty of leg room and reclining chairs. It's not fancy, but it certainly does a good job and seems to be a pretty well kept secret in the area. If you live down river of downtown, you should definitely consider a trip out here for summer movie enjoyment.

Many positives...beginning with easy, ample and FREE parking behind the restaurant!  Our order was taken promptly and the staff quickly advised us about the menu in regard to vegetarian and gluten free items.  Amazing iced-tea (unsweet tea mixed with their yummy housemade strawberry lemonade).  I enjoyed one of the best salads ever...the Pepper Patch with an amazing dressing, roasted jalapeo vinaigrette.  The side of roasted vegetables was tasty!  Our son often orders quesadillas when we eat out and he rated the Veggie Quesadilla at Urban Cookhouse as topnotch!  The crowning glory...the strawberry lemonade milkshakes.  We enjoyed dining on the outdoor patio in the shade.  The staff was excellent, attentive, helpful and friendly.  We will be dining here again!  Great place for lunch, afternoon snack or dinner!

Greek's has great pizza in Fishers. A big bonus - free delivery! If you work in Fishers, it is a great option for the office, especially on a rainy or snowy day. There Greek salads and stromboli are both good choices. My favorite is their Gourmet House pizza - Greek's Italian Sauce, Onions, Assorted Cheeses, Meatballs, Sliced Black Olives & Feta Cheese. It's nothing too out of the ordinary, but the feta really does it for me. Greek's also has some fun chicken pizzas- Cordon Bleu ala Rafael, Gourmet Wings and Gourmet Chicken Ranch

Let's face it, Philly is severely lacking in the ramen department.  And by lacking, what I really mean is that it doesn't really exist.

Enter: Nom Nom Ramen.  For ramen lovers out there then, this restaurant should be somewhat of a nice surprise.  Except that it's really not all that.  It's not terrible, but i certainly wouldn't characterize this as good ramen.

The broth is mediocre and lacks depth of flavor.  The noodles are even worse - it's like they threw in spaghetti noodles and called it ramen.

The char sui is flavored fine but is a little tough.

Since there's really no other ramen joints, it might satisfy your ramen craving.  But don't expect something you'd get in LA or NYC.

The first time I came here I just got bagels and this morning we got breakfast sandwiches. I was impressed with how much filling there was. It was tasty and filling. I had bacon, egg, and cheese, and my boyfriend had scrapple.  However, after trying the bagels on two different occasions I have to admit they are just not that good. They don't have the right texture. They are almost crumbly and fall apart as you are eating them. They seem more like bread. It's slightly chaotic inside and can be confusing to order. I would come back for a breakfast sandwich or to try some of their other breakfast selections since they are local. I would not order bagels from them, as I much prefer the bagels from another place.

Probably one of the better restaurants at Peppermill. 

Fresh and tasty sushi, good bread, decent service, and fair prices (given that they are serving quality sushi in Nevada). Plus, the theme is pretty legit. You can practically swim around with the whales and bum around with the crustaceans in this place. 

I just hate when you order a drink and the waiter says "Uhhhhh errrrr I have to bring it in from the oustide. May take longer." ...JUST BRING ME MY A-A-A-A-AL-ALC-OHOL!!!!

I am spending tonight here traveling for work. I wish I could give it a better rating but I can't. 

They seem to have really let the quality go downhill.

Two stars because the front desk staff was polite, but everything else is one star.
BK is trying to improve customer service. .. I was asked my name to "better serve" me. Whopper not hot...barely warm :(
I aways enjoy my meals here. They have a wonderful staff and my coffee cup never has a chance to get low.

Great value! I have live across from them for many years.  Food is always good, very very consistent,  and staff always friendly. Huge fan of their lo mein. Everything always very fresh and they are not shy with the portions. Thank you!

Positives- Nice gluten-free menu options as well as some better-than-average pub food selections. Nice local beer selection as well.

Negatives- I have been here a few times with friends and I don't think I'll go back. Not because of the food or the service but because everything takes so long. I've never left this place, in and out, in under 4 hours. Takes FOREVER to get seated and even longer to get food. I value my time too much to give this place another shot. I think they must tell everyone that walks in the wait is about 40 minutes.

Great local neighborhood place.  Fried green tomatoes with shrimp and remoulade was great overall.  The shrimp on the dish were chilled which didn't bother me but my wife thought it a bit odd.  Fried seafood platter with shrimp, oysters, and catfish very enjoyable.  Had a side of fried sweet potatoes which we really enjoyed.  Although we were due for some fried food, we noticed the menu included some lighter, healthier fare such as a nice redfish dish that the guy next to us got.  Don't forget cash though because no credit cards are accepted.

Was walking around with my father while in town for a conference, looking for places in the neighborhood. Found Devon Grill totally by chance, and it was excellent! Everything from the staff to the food and drinks was seriously perfect...such an unexpected pleasure. Will definitely be back when in Philly again!

I recently went here with my two sisters and my mother. We were all trying to get in at the same time or at lease close and they went out of their way to accommodate us. My mother and one sister were both extremely pleased with their massages and therapists. The other sister and I were liked ours. All of us would go again. 

The one drawback was that it is a very basic massage studio and I could hear some talking in the other rooms. Not the conversations, just a bit of noise. And both my sister and I could have used a small space heater in our rooms. But maybe that's our fault for not asking.
Great guacamole shrimp. 1/2 price beers during happy hour. Fantastic sunset view!!! Kid friendly too.

We stayed at the Bellevue and this SB is right by the front revolving door. I went in there several times over a course of a week and the staff are very nice. One guy is very dapper with his fedora. 

They have a good selection of Philly and Pennsylvania SB mugs as I picked them up as gifts. Many of the SBs we passed during our trip didn't have both mugs only one of the other, mostly Philly mugs. A really cute but small SB. Very busy in the mornings

Best Cuban in Tampa! I have found no one who beats La Bamba's pulled/roast pork. Also love the fresh chopped onion on top of the beans. Delicious! 

The place is nothing to speak of and I wish they were open for dinner and on UberEATS, but that's just for my convenience.

Food = 5 stars
It was really a great meal and authentic.  The staff was attentive and friendly and it was a good atmosphere.   Really regret not trying specialty gelato dessert but seemed reasonable at the time.

Staff was so friendly!! Great place to have fun on Bourbon ST! 

I went to S&S with a large group and got the party bags they offer. The service at dinner was amazing and the bags were so cute/fun. Every one in my group loved it! The waitress, Lindsay, was amazingly friendly! There was a miscommunication on pricing of the bags so the owner and manager (Joe and T) offered a free bottle of vodka in the VIP section for our whole group. It was very generous and kind! Would definitely recommend visiting S&S while in NOLA. Thank you Lindsay, Joe, and T for a great experience!
Absolutely worst service-- and for an ice cream spot! No acknowledgement of their customers and completely flat attitude. Get your sweet treat elsewhere. They're not worthy of your business.

My new favorite restaurant in Philadelphia. The Stracciatella and bread was amazing. I ordered the gnocchi and my husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs with a side of garlic bread . The gnocchi was delicious. For desert we had the cheesecake and tiramisu. The tiramisu needed a little more alcohol but the cheesecake was fantastic.

We came to this brewery in downtown St. Pete as a quick pit stop before going climbing at Vertical Ventures and we ended staying for so much longer! We had a Groupon that we bought for only $11 and we got four separate flights for each of us. It was easy to go right up to the bar and instantly work out the details of the Groupon and get rolling with our drinks.
The atmosphere at the bar is great. It has an open store front, rather than a door, so it's very light and breezy inside, as well the decor is simple yet very playful and nice, with many table games to play while you're there.
We were also able to check in on yelp and get a pint of beer of our choosing for only $4 or so, which was very nice! We took these drinks to the back where they had a classic game set up, Mario Kart on the Nintendo 64! It was very fun sitting down and playing Mario Kart and letting more time pass than we realized.
The drink choices covered most of what a person might want while out and they were all hand crafted, mostly local beers, which was awesome. My favorite was the pelican blonde, but the sour beer is definitely worth a try as well. This is definitely a company that promotes the drink local ideology. All in all, the atmosphere was amazing, and so were the drinks and the deals. We ended up spending more time than we realized here because it was a great experience! Definitely recommend stopping by here.
Clean store. Friendly staff. Great produce.
Not all it's cranked up to be, the food is eh, it's okay. The staff seems more and more lazy every time I visit. The delicious milkshakes are the only thing that keeps me coming back !

Had pretzels nuggets which were super pretzels with a tasteless white cheese sauce.  Had the typical salty super pretzel saltiness.   Had PJs Stingers.  Over whelmed with salt.  Teaspoon of oil at bottom of wax filled plastic basket.   Cheese steak egg rolls nothing to write home about but again salty.  Confirmed my ongoing critique that this place is not the place to eat.  Service good.  Atmosphere good.  Beer selection hearty.

We had so much fun today! We went with several families with little ones from 15 months to 2 years went for the afternoon and had a blast. The playground was crowded with kids (many different ages) so we had to stay close to our daughter as she ran around but in general it went really well. The beers were tasty and we liked the food a lot. The pizza, soft pretzel and wings were great. We'll be back! Love what you did with the space!

We stopped in on a whim on a Saturday night for a drink and snack after seeing a show. We found a table right away, everyone who served us was kind and attentive, and our hummus and beers were FANTASTIC. We loved the atmosphere and will definitely return.

It's a small theater on the U of A campus. Major acts and theater productions come here, which is awesome, both for students and locals. 

Plentiful, clean bathrooms. All the seats are 'ground floor': there is no balcony. There didn't seem like there was a bad seat in the whole place. The rows are pretty narrow though, so it's a pain crawling over people's knees to get to your mid-section seats. But once you are seated, all's good. The sound and the stage views are excellent. 

I saw a Broadway production here and was impressed by the quality.

Come here once a month. Let's just say as a guy remembering the style details after a while gets to be too much to keep up with. 

They remember your details for next time and print out a little note and ask you if this is what you want again. Best thing ever. 

Hot face towel. Get it. Nobody is watching, trust me, you will ask yourself how did I not do this right away.
Love it!!!! Drinks amazing with real fruit juice.  Food amazing!  My favorite on the gulf coast.

For Florida, Mazzaro's is a great Italian Market. The service is friendly and helpful.

It has:

1. a great variety of pasta, both homemade and ready-made
2. decent variety of cheese, tomato sauces, pastries, deli items
3. good variety of things like anchovies, balsamic vinegar, and coffee beans
4. large selection of wine.

If you have time, you can order sandwiches, treats from the deli and pastries from the bakery. They can be eaten outside in the covered patio.

If possible, try to visit Mazzaro's during a weekday. Mazzaro's is always a madhouse during Saturday.

Mazzaro's is a great place to find normal ingredients for Italian cooking and hard-to-find items like guanciale. Ciao!!

I bought the perfect dress for graduation except it was way to big (and I already got the smallest size). It was a pretty inexpensive dress and I was willing to get it altered. It needed taken in as well as additional padding on the front. She had me put it on and then she put pins in it where it needed altered and added the padding. Then I changed and she wrote up a card with my name, phone number, and price. I was in and out in no time!
Since I've never had alternations done before on a dress I didn't know what to expect price wise. She told me it would be $67 and she asked if I wanted it done. I thought it was a little pricey at first but after doing some research it's a pretty competitive price.
As for the location it's a very small and cozy shop with two dressing rooms and one pedestal and mirror in the center. I think the couple lives above the shop because their two dogs were behind the counter. I could see all the articles of clothing hung in the back room-- make sure you come well before you need something finished because she has a lot of work ahead of her!
When I went to pick it up I rang the bell and a man found my dress and rang me up. I thought it was weird that I didn't try it on before paying but I tried it on when I got home and it's absolutely perfect. I can't even tell some places where she took it in.
A couple things to note: they do NOT accept credit cards and you must be willing to wait a considerable amount of time before picking up your clothing item(s). I said I would like to have the dress in exactly two weeks and she agreed that it could easily be done in that time frame because it is a short dress. Yet she wrote on her card the last possible date I wanted it with no extra information. Also I never got a call when it was finished so I picked it up on the day that she wrote on the card. I feel like this place could receive plenty of bad reviews just because people weren't able to get their items in soon enough.
So overall this place has terrible customer service but amazing results. I would have other clothing fixed here.

I have to give credit to the young woman at the counter.  I ordered takeout and arrived, only to have someone behind me walk right in and budge the second line for his pickup order.   She greeted him at first, as I looked on.  I was just going to let it go, but then served me first, which was right.  The guy had a few words with the counter person, but he was clearly in the wrong, but I guess he was just oblivious.  Thank you to that young woman for putting the rude man in his place.

65 degrees in February is quite unexpected in Philly but the perfect opportunity to explore this city. Walking through Center City, I came across this unique French bakery offering a range of pastries from croissants to flourless chocolate cake. Being a pastry lover, it was difficult to resist adding another bakery to the list of places that I have been to but  I am glad I took the chance to try their pastries. The employees were very kind and helped me select a few pastries that met my dietary restrictions.

The taste of the pastries was between 3.5 or 4 out of 5 while the customer service was 5/5. I look forward to stopping by again to try other pastries from their selection.

I went there today attempting to pick up foods. During the COVID 19 pandemic, no one, not a single person who handles foods there was wearing a mask... I left. And I will not go back. The workers didn't seem to care, nor the managers or owners. Do I trust foods from there? Sorry, no.

My fave in town for sushi. Used to like Horinoya best, but surly service put me off. Shogun is good, but it's in Metrie (and freezing-- turn the AC down!) Anyway, Little Tokyo has an extensive menu with usual choices and then some, including an interesting twist on gumbo-- a miso soup base w softshell crab if I remember correctly. Since I'm a Mid-City gal, I'm happy to find a sushi spot by me!

Delicious brunch food, and even better service. The French Toast is soaked overnight, and the potatoes come with some kind of delicious cheesy sauce. 

We came here on a Friday for brunch, so the place was pretty empty. Only a few tables had filled by the time we left. 

If you are heading to the WWII museum and looking for great service, good food and reasonable prices, give it a shot!

What a great place. I was staying at the Hilton next door and this place became my home away from home. Assistant GM was absolutely the friendliest reception I have had in a long time. Wish this place was in Phoenix so it could be my new Cheers. Wow I felt like I was home hanging out here. If you're in downtown Tampa you MUST MUST MUST stop by here for a drink and some laughs.
Great location, tasty food, staff was great.  Reasonable prices. Good music.  Wide variety on menu.

Creative countertops did an amazing job on our kitchen counters. Danny is an expert and super easy to work with, and their timely installation made our lives that much easier. I would definitely recommend!

Great work, but took two stars off.

One for run-down pedicure chair.  I was the only person getting a pedicure there and either all chairs are run down, or they did not think to put me in one that did not make strange noises.

And another for not being directive enough.  Took time to understand who is going to be working with me and where.

A great little place - it's smaller than most "major" plumbing supply stores and, of course, the big box home supply shops - but it's miles better and the folks here have been able to recognize just about anything I send them a picture of right off the bat.  I have several rentals properties around town ranging from 1940s through the 80s era and the plumbing in these can be a bit of an adventure.  Need a replacement stem? Just take it out, snap a picture, email it to them and I can just about promise you not only will they know what it is on sight, they'll have it for you.  I've even been talked out of buying one of those new stems and given a silicon ring for a buck and shown how to replace it instead - you just don't get that kind of service at the big box shops.  Even for my properties on the east side I plan my routes to end up at Bonnets and Stems when I need something - it's worth it.

If you could have a new favorite place to come  in and enjoy a meal this would be mine.
I came to NOLA to visit my son who is working here for a short time and this was his pick.
Having no idea I went to the web to see what I was going to enjoy.
Your greeted by a very friendly staff member, it was a Tuesday night at 8:30 it as packed with a wait line so we chose to eat at the bar.   Drinks were up quickly, food order was placed.  Corn appetizers and we both chose to chicken with caramelized onions.   Holy ....the corn was the best I've ever eaten, grilled served with a red sauce and cheese.  I could have made a meal. The chicken arrived it was sweet and tangy too much to finish ...thank god for being able to take home the rest for a "midnight" snack.
Now I'm only here for 10 days and I have a list of many restaurants that I want to check out, but I will make sure that I return to Mais Arepas
In closing these photos don't do the food justice.  Enjoy

LOVED this place when it was Tijuana Flats - used to go there at least once a week and was so excited when I heard they would be reopening under a different name. Then they kept pushing back the opening, first the end of January, then sometime February, then late February, and finally March 9th (even though they said they would be open March 8th when called).

Even though it's under the same management with the same staff with similar food, it just isn't the same. For one thing, they've given the place an "upscale" makeover, complete with Apple computers as registers and taken simple things like napkin dispensers off the tables. If you were a fan of the cheesy double stack tacos, you're out of luck - they must have been a Tijuana Flats-only item.

My husband and I ordered our food and 20 minutes later, we were still waiting. Someone came over and asked our name because apparently the order never went through (so much for fancy technology). Then 10 minutes later, our order came out but it wasn't entirely correct. When we pointed this out, all we got was a blank stare. No one ever apologized for the wait or the mistake in the order. The food itself was just ok, but that could be because they threw it together in a hurry. All in all, it was a pretty disappointing experience after waiting two months for the reopening.

I have just recently moved to Philadelphia, where finding the perfect fit of an apartment for myself did not come easy. However, as soon as I toured Hanover North Broad with the Assistant Property Manager, Brandon, I knew Hanover was the next home for me. 
Brandon is an uplifting, honest and welcoming person who made applying for an apartment a breeze. He made sure I found everything I was expecting and looking for when choosing an apartment style. When it came to having furniture delivered and I was unable to be at my apartment for delivery, Brandon made sure it was taken care of. He called me as soon as it was delivered and notified me that everything went well. 
Now that I have been living here for a month, I am more than happy with my choice of selecting Hanover North Broad as my home. 
Thank you to Brandon and the Hanover staff for making my first apartment experience the best. You guys are awesome!!
Ricky is great! I've engaged his services multiple times for my Rental properties. He's reliable, dependable, trustworthy and always has a great attitude.

The really nice lady named Daisy there was very helpful. The Sanrio selection was amazing considering that all of the corporate stores had closed. Also included Melissa and Doug crafts and extremely well made and soft baby toys and stuffed animals. Daisy gave me and my sister a free gum pack each for finding her on Yelp so if you find them on here I suggest that you tell her. (If the cashier is Daisy). There was extremely great service and wasn't too busy. I would most definitely come here again!!!

I thoroughly enjoyed my shiatsu massage with Michael Vasta. Michael is clearly an expert in this form of massage. He was  kind and professional.  My body felt amazing the hours and even days following the massage. I highly recommend Michael and ReYou massage for a healing experience that is different from the traditional Swedish massage.

Because of their lack of attention to detail and the inconsideration to customer satisfaction, I would like to give this Hilton location a ZERO RATING but I can't.As a person that travels often (~100days per year) I expect/assume based on hotel brand certain things when I check into my hotel room. In my most recent and final stay at this hotel in April I checked in electronically (by passing the desk), took a nap, got up had dinner with my colleagues, returned and went to bed. 
I get up the next morning to take a shower and as I step out (dripping wet) I realize.... there are NO TOWELS in the room. Now I'm wet, upset and have to get ready for my meeting. At this point I'm forced to use two hand towels and the towel like rug I had placed on the floor to dry off. 
I get downstairs(fuming) explain to the desk clerk my quandary, she apologized and ensured me it would be taken care of. I explained to her that I am a paranoid traveler and that I preferred to call the desk when I returned. I did that upon returning and they delivered two towels. 
The next day I decided not to put out the do not disturb sign. When I returned I saw the bed was re-made everything was in order. I assumed because of my past issues the message had got out and that oversight would be corrected. 
I immediately left the room without checking the bathroom, got back late fell fast asleep. Woke up the next morning get in the shower guess what no towels.

Best local spot in town. Amazing wait staff and the the manager Brandy will go above and beyond to make sure you have a amazing meal and experience! She adds a personal touch to every trip that makes you feel welcome. Best burgers, beer and Brandy in town!!!

This is now my favorite place for bubble tea! I've been looking for a place that serves the flavored green teas instead of just the milk teas. I'm used to the delicious bubble teas from New York and this place is very close to it! I tried the passion fruit green tea and fell in love! Their frozen yogurts are great too! They have lots of toppings to choose from. The price is reasonable as well.

I stopped in here on my way up to Northern California and went on a roller coaster of thoughts with this place.  First, when I walked up and saw the open air cafe I was blown away by how cool this placed look and was stoked to see there was a line b/c that generally means that you are in store for a treat when locals take the time to wait for fare.  

Then after waiting in line for a while it occurred to me that maybe the line was due to the comically slow service.  I waited about 10 minutes in a line of about 6 people before putting my order in.  I considered a few times going somewhere else, but decided I should wait it out.

Finally, I had arrived and was able to place my order.  I got an Ethiopian blend coffee and their extra thick sourdough toast with almond butter.  Both were totally worth the wait.  The coffee was a perfect complement to the wonderfully sour toast.

Long story short, this place is definitely worth the trip, but don't plan on getting in and out quickly.
Food was decent but a little pricy for what it was. We could have spent $20 more and ate next door at Delicia!  (Which is fabulous if you haven't been!!)

I was not in philly long but was glad to find this place. yummy and fast and easy. sweet potato fries were a nice treat and the mock chicken was something i would order again.

Glad to see the vegan options too.

In my one experience here, this place overbooked on reservations so there were two other parties besides ours waiting for the same room. When we got there, the manager told us that they had too many reservations, so when I complained he finally gave in and gave us the room, but at the expense of his other guests. 

The manager was extremely rude when we left, and I advise those who go here to check out other places.

This place has a really elegant southern atmosphere. The inside is really well decorated, you can def tell you are in Tennessee. 

My coffee was old and not that great. Drew's Brew. Also I ordered something called croissant French toast which I had never had before but combines my two favorite things. It was good but one of the pieces was completely undercooked

I would love to blame it on the fact that it was busy but it really wasn't. Atmosphere is better than the food on this particular day
In the middle of the French quarter this restaurant is a bit of a tourist trap; specialized in oysters I was a bit disappointed in my dozen natural ones - fresh tastes different...

This dogtown staple focuses on some of our favorite bar food items and does them all well.  It's very clear that this place has grown over the years.  The front bar area has a cool old fashioned feel.  As you meander into the adjoining rooms, you can tell that they were added on at a later date.  They don't have that same warmth.  The patio all the way to the back is totally different than the front area.  The two walls are made of clear garage doors.  You feel like you're outside without being in the elements.  And there are TV's everywhere.  

For food, we had the hot wings... perfect.  A gyro plate... flavorful meat, and super soft pita bread.  And a burger... large portion, cooked to order, with a slight char.  On the downsides, both salads that we had were soaked with dressing.  In the future, I'll request mine on the side.  But the dressings themselves were super yummy and tasted like they were made in-house.  

Service is ok... The 3 girls we dealt with seemed gruff but got the job done... almost Flo or Rossaneish.  I think one of them could take me in a fight.

Lovely place to shop and get fleeced of all your hard earned money.  Coffee is good, produce is good, flowers used to be reasonably priced for a dozen roses but not any more.  A nice and expensive shopping experience.  Trader Joe's might be a good idea and Whole Foods also is much larger and again nosebleed high prices. You are paying for the lovely ambiance.  Someone has to pay the rent, right ?

As I'm not opposed to eating any meal by myself, I took the opportunity to try Fare for brunch on a beautiful Saturday morning. The outdoor seating area is delightful and quite spacious for downtown Philly. My puggle and I sat comfortably on a bench (her underneath on the floor) and were immediately served our own water (hers in a doggy bowl). We enjoyed a relaxed brunch with well balanced  & free flowing coffee and a friendly (and cute) server. The eggs florentine was tasty and the perfect size. They seem to chose healthier options here like wheat toast and sweet potatoes which I love. We will definitely return possibly for wine because I LOVE wine!

The gelato here is to die for! They make it from fresh ingredients and you can truly tell. My boyfriend and I come here once a week just to have gelato and espresso. Their lattes and cappuccinos are also fantastic. You can get gelato in your latte and that is their signature item! The service is always fantastic and the prices are reasonable. You can get three scoops in a small and their flavor choices are vast. The price is about $5 which is reasonable since they pile the gelato as much as they can. I highly recommend the Mediterranean salted carmel, the amaretto chocolate chip and the amarena cherry. Those three flavors together are a tasty combo. Although the hazelnut, coconut, baileys and wedding cake are also amazing. Too many to name so come here for the best gelato in town and see for yourself.

We have been twice. Both times were amazing. This is a staff that is well trained and takes their job very seriously. They make good food and they want you to enjoy it. A knowledge team of foodies and delightful to boot.

I have been to Katie's Pizzeria, so I had high hopes for Katie's Pizza & Pasta and it did not disappoint! We were quickly seated at the most perfect table for two outside, next to the little garden. Both Ted and Katie were nice enough to stop by and chat, even giving us a few peppers from the garden. 

I had the Asparagus Pizza, which was delicious. The crust is a bit chewy, in the best way possible. My boyfriend had the Basil Tagliatelle and loved every bite. I recommend the Sgroppino to drink. They are quick to serve, but it would be nice to get a little fresh bread and OO while ya wait or with the pasta, just in case there is left over sauce :)

I loved the artichoke salad from KP and was disappointed to see it was a whopping $14. The pizzas aren't terribly large, but had to enlist some help to finish it. So if you want to share a pizza, you might need a salad or a small plate as well. Katie's isn't easy on the pocket book, but it's great for a treat!
Stumbled by this location by accident picking up Chinese food next door. Good to know we now have a Popeyes within [somewhat] driving distance whenever the craving kicks in.

Loved loved loved this place. Atmosphere, ambiance, food, service was excellent!! from the walk through the kitchen to the courtyard and the dining area you feel as if your in a movie. I highly recommend putting this historic restaurant on your bucket list.
My usual stop in the neighborhood and a place to entertain friends. Always great food. I come for the buffet: tandoori chicken, lamb saagwala, and of course lots of naan.
Ate here Sunday with my son and his wife and we all were in agreement that it was the best pizza we have ever had

Johnny Rockets used to be a great establishment will you to come get an affordable meal at a great price. It is now not the case. The food is mediocre and so is the service and I doubt I would ever come to this establishment again.
Love this place, good portions, good prices.  Quiet atmosphere.  Cooked to order food!!

Excellent cuisine in a lovely atmosphere surrounded by beautiful artwork, which is apparently by the owner (our server told us this).

Because it was early my friend and I had the dining area to ourselves, which made for nice convo. We appreciated the big band music playing in the background.

Appetizer of scallops and mushrooms was exquisite. Entree of grilled salmon with a mango sauce was perfectly done, with accompanying vegetables at the perfect al dente stage. No room for the creme brulee or white chocolate bread pudding.

As an aside, I was wearing jeans and tennis shoes and my server did not judge me. But then, I'm not ignorant enough to demand that a bill be split sixteen ways :)
