A place to go for great shows & plays! Clean restrooms & a great concession for drinks & food !

This is a convenient, clean place for local residents to get a decent, if unremarkable, meal.  The menu is "Midwest" with lots of comfort food and little variety when it comes to low fat or health conscious items.  The remodeled dining room is complemented by a nice bar and reasonably priced drinks.  The staff is friendly and the kitchen is consistent.  If you're looking for a nicer meal without a lot of pretentiousness, you could do a lot worse.  Just don't expect a memorable culinary experience.

I yelped this place and decided to try it out with a girl friend of mine. We both came in very hungry and although we left very full, I cannot say I was 100% satisfied with the food. I ordered a burrito because I decided to play it safe because I mean being a Mexican restaurant, how do you mess up a burrito? But I spoke too soon. As I received my burrito and cut it in half, I realized that it did not look very appetizing at all. It was very dry and the flavor was definitely lacking even though it was stuffed with ingredients. I definitely will not order it again. However, before eating the entree, my friend and I ordered their special nachos and I absolutely loved it. It was a great start to the meal. Drinks were okay as well. Nothing special.

I'm not sure how likely it will be that I return here because I've tasted better Mexican restaurants. However if you're someone who likes to try everything and anything, I'd say there's nothing wrong with checking out this cantina.

Good music, decent beers, but what really got me was the people there. Not super friendly and fairly clicky. I know that this is not the establishments fault but its who hangs out there. I was by myself but if I went back with a group of friends this might be a cool spot to grab some drinks.

Love this place. This is more pizza for say the "whole foods" type of crowd-think toppings like goat cheese, pesto, eggplant, and pine nuts.  If you're a traditionalist who likes pizza from Papa Joe's or Sal's, then yes you might find this pizza overpriced and not to your liking.  Personally I like this upscale pizza place-I've actually been on frst dates here.

Love love love me some Poke King. Their portions are HUGE. Their rewards program is awesome. Always fresh and cold seafood. So many options for add ins and different flavors. So many locations as well. A+

Visiting St. Louis abs stumbled upon this absolute gem! Had to eat at the bar as it was packed on a Saturday night but the bartender made it worthwhile. Such excellent service! The food was unbelievably fresh and such unique pairings of flavors really made it special.  I ordered the Black Garlic Butter Pizza abd was not disappointed! Each flavor stood out with the lemon and honey making it extra special. The videos of Katie cooking on the big screen made it easy to see why this food is so very special. I only wish I could get this quality in Los Angeles! Thanks for making it a special night! 100% would recommend!

I thought this nail salon was amazing!! I'm pretty simple when it comes to my nails, but wow I blown away! They give you complementary water with your service, which I've never had before so that might be normal but I thought it was a nice touch. The staff were EXTREMELY friendly and made me feel welcome. The price was right too (finally something I can afford)! Only $34 for a basic mani/pedi. I will definitely be going back!

Whenever I know I'll be waiting a long time, I like to use that time to write a review ... and given the experience I've had so far this evening, I'm sure I have some time. 

We had a large party, so some delays are reasonable and to be expected. What's not expected:

1. Half hour for drinks
2. 45 minutes until the bread baskets showed up.
3. Did I mention we didn't see menus for twenty minutes after sitting down?
4. An hour and forty minutes into the show we had our food.
5. We sat outside, which was alright until they turned the lights out on us shortly after receiving our food ... luckily there was a flood light halfway down the side of the building to kinda light part of our end of the table, feel sorry for the assholes at the other end.
6. Multiple people ordered multiple drinks that never showed, some ordered appetizers that never showed.

I had the chicken parm and it tasted pretty bad. For comparison Fazoli's has better chicken parm and I can't eat that garbage without shitting myself. The chicken tasted like it had been left in the deep fryer too long and the kitchen staff hadn't changed the oil in quite some time.
Food is really delicious and not that expensive,server( giovanna)very attentive and friendly,definitely my weekly hangout.

I adore The Lemon Bar! The staff is very friendly!. My mom had the The Spring chicken salad sandwich with a house salad and I had the Turkey avocado melt with a house salad and a lavender lemonade. The food was SO good and the lavender lemonade was a dream. I bring all of my out of town guests here
Good barbecue. Been here a few times, I always get the pulled pork with spicy collard greens. The cheesy spinach is really good. I'd definitely come back

I have been coming here for years, food pretty decent and reasonably priced,  however,  they are always rushing your meal and rushing you out the door, bad practice.  I guess quicker turnover means more money.  Very annoying!

We got the fish tacos and chowder. It was excellent. The service was even better. I have a cilantro intolerance and the chef went out of his way to make the tacos cilantro free. He actually made up a completely separate and on the fly Pico to go on top of the tacos. And it was amazing. I highly recommend this place. The vibe is awesome, the food is great, and I have never been to a resturant where they tried to accommodate my cilantro distaste like this!

Excellent service. I attempted to sell a ring at diamond banker across the street where I was offered $3700. Green Hills Diamond Buyers offered $7700. I would recommend them if you're selling any type of jewelry. They seem to be honest and fair.

Aside from the outrageous wait times, this place is great. 

I've had the raspberry chocolate crepes, banana fosters (?) and the pumpkin/sweet potato and wow they were good.

Wonderful option for healthier yet tasty pizzas. Their pizzas are like flat bread style and for those who are gluten sensitive, then this is your place.  We had a gluten free pizza, and wanted something different. We had prociutto, fig spread and cheese on our pizza. It was very tasty.  A personal pizza is a good size for two people so that you can save room for their amazing nutella dessert pizza. Their prices are even better when you go on creative loafing and get a gift certificate there. Can you believe our bill came out to 1.50. Yes I swear, it was awesome.
Parking is not the greatest in Downtown Tampa. I really don't like driving around the area, but you will end up paying a small price on the meter.  
You can sit outside and enjoy fresh air since the outside is mostly shaded, as well as bring your dog. 
It was definitely a great afternoon. Would be back again. This is my first try at this location, but I have been to the Westchase location which is even nicer. But they both are as equally tasty.

I love this place. I've been a few times since they opened not too long ago. It's a very clean, calming environment and the owner is so friendly! I brought my daughter here on my last visit and we both got pedicures. The ladies did a good job but my only complaint is that my tech seemed to be rushing & was a little rough. I found myself wishing I had my daughters technician, who was gentle and took her time. There were no other customers while we were there either, so there was no reason to rush. I'll be back though!

Super disappointed and frustrated with the service at this place. I began ordering and the lady, while leaning over as if to fall asleep on the counter, rudely interrupted to let me know everything was pre-made. It was as if I literally pulled her out of her nap. I was excited about trying this place but abruptly left after the miserable service. Get another job lady, maybe where you can sleep on the job for real.

They delivered hay that is moldy. Then refused to refund because it had been more than two weeks. Well they put the moldy hay on the bottom so how would we have known until we got to it.? 
Our hay is kept indoors on Tucson, there's no rain. So what difference does two weeks make?

This place was my favorite place downtown!!!! I loved it! I love the hand battered onion rings! I love the delish cinnamon ice cream!!!! I love the boozy lemonade!!!! And the ozark burger is to die for!!!! 

Buttttt I will never go again!!!!! I cannot stand the prissy blonde server!!!! She is soooooo rude!!!!! She treated me and my best friend like crap when we went in!!!!!

It started by us 2 girls goin out for lunch. At first I ordered a cherry sprite. Which I get every time I go. She tells me that they dont have a full bar that they only had a couple items downstairs! Lol that's a lie and I knew she was just bein lazy and didn't wanna walk to the bar and get me the drink I wanted. Ok that's fine.. She didn't tell my friend about the menu, the sodas, the sauces or help her with any of her order!!! So I of corse had to. Since I had became a regular there. We got our food. She was still rude, ignoring us, not refilling our drinks or checking on us or anything! 

It didn't really bother me at the time.. It was just one bad service expierence at the range.. So whatever.

A few weeks later I brought my mom and pregnant sister. I got the same waitress again!!!! Fml!!!!

First I ordered a Cherry coke! She tries to tell me they didn't have it!!!!! What!!! I was like,"well its on the menu!!!!" and she got snotty and said she would check!!!! Omg! She just don't wanna walk downstairs!! Again!!!! Geez!    

We got out drinks and rushed my family through out order! Didn't offer and charged us all for catchup!!!!! For one the fries come with the side of sauce!!!! And we had to pay for it!!!! That's bs! She ignored us, no refills, she had an attitudes and when it came time for our check she put it as far away from out reach as possible!!!! And she slammed it on the table and walked away!!!! No thank u... No come again!!! Nothing!!! Wow!

And for that reason I will not be "coming again" sorry prissy blonde! Maybe u shouldn't serve /:

Don't recommend their "raw" sushi. It looks old like its been sitting in the refrigerator to long & it's not very nice looking "cuts" of fish. Gross! I recommend going to their S. Virginia location. Much nicer sushi!!! If your planning on ordering California Rolls this place is ok.
Not impressed at all over priced terrible service and just doesn't taste good. I love pizza and was excited to try this place but it was a huge disappointment

What a return to childhood and Blizzards after big wins in Little League. Prior to this month, I don't think I had eaten at a Dairy Queen in at least a decade. Strangely, as an adult, I no longer find their burgers/hot dogs to be the greatest cuisine on Earth. That said, the ice cream remains as delicious as ever. This was a nice trip down memory lane, though I fear what eating DQ regularly would do to my waistline.
The best coffee in NOLA...unpretentious, friendly and wonderful. So glad to give these wonderful people our business.
Wide variety and whimsical book lover names for all the beers. Casual and very friendly. They're always ready to offer free tastes and you can get a round samplers as well. And you can buy books.

I recently rented from Alamo while in Tampa, FL from 6-16 through 6-21.  I booked the car through the "name your own price" deal on Priceline.   

I arrived to Tampa and went directly to the rental counter, which was in the airport and rather convenient.  There was a short line, but the person at one of the other counters (I believe Thrifty) had no line and was able to start checking me in.  This process was rather easy as well.  The agent gave me instructions to go to the ramp and select a car in the compact section.  

When I arrived at the section I had an option of 3/4 vehicles.  I was looking for one with a trunk, so I only had a 1/2 options.  Pick the one that looks newer, and am on my way out when I notice there is no cruise control.  I planned on doing a fair amount of driving, so this was important to me (and something I never considered would be missing).  I parked the car and check all the others---nothing.  So I went back to the counter to see if there are any vehicles that have this option (told them I didn't mind downgrading if needed).  

I was told I would need to upgrade my vehicle 2 categories for $11/day.  This seemed pretty unreasonable to me, so I declined and went back to get another car. Luckily, there was a compact car with cruise control that had magically appeared.  It was a hatchback, but had a trunk cover, so it worked.  Left the lot (relatively easy) and was on my way.  

The return was actually very pleasant, aside from the difficulty I had finding a gas station (that may have been on me).  The employee checking my car is was nice, quick and thorough.  

Over the course of the rental, my biggest complaint was the car had no power. I was driving alone with one backpack and no additional weight, and the car was constantly struggling.  I had a Hyundai Accent (I don't think I would put that in the compact category, but I may be wrong).

Overall I was disappointed with the fact I was lied to by a manager, in order to try and pressure me into a sale ($11 upgrade), and felt the car was below my expectations.  I chose this path over an offsite agency (fox, economy).  Alamo was twice the price, and the service and car weren't much better.  I say that having 2 fairly good experiences and cars using Fox from Vegas to LAX, and have no experience with them in FL.  Realistically they should get a 2.5 star, but they could do much better.
Love this place!  Great for GF diners and the non GFs can enjoy flatbread and beer.  My new go-to in Conshy after Plymouth Meeting errands.

Not normally one to leave a bad yelp review but I was Very unsatisfied with the customer service at this store. Came in and bought a dress and then went back in the store five minutes later realizing I wanted a different dress. I asked to exchange it and there was a $7 difference. The girl would not refund the $7 even though I had bought the dress 5 minutes before that. I have worked in retail and a small boutique just like that with the same return policy and always returned customers the money if they just bought an item. I even told the girl that I don't live there and would have no use to the $7 store credit and she still wouldn't refund my money. I was never informed of this return policy when buying the dress in the first place. After searching around for something to buy I ended up picking out a piece of jewelry. A sign outside said all jewelry 10% off. When the girl rang me up she didn't even give me the 10% discount...I had to remind her. Such poor customer service and would never advise anyone to shop there.

This place has become like a place I visited in a third world country.  It is always dirty.  The straw and napkin area is rarely replenished.  The workers either don't know how to work the register or are fooling around.  My order is rarely correct.  The bread for sandwiches is usually out by 11:00 am.  I ask for little ice snd the cup is full of ice.  Request for mocha is iffy at best.  This used to be my go to spot.   But with over flowing trash cans and poor service, I will have to go another place.

Tried this place again and the cash register person could not work the register snd get the order correct. Then she went to talk to someone and couldn't even remember what I had requested.  So I left.

Friday happy hour, $3 drafts. I did get some onion rings too, but haven't tried anything else on the menu. It's busy, but they're quick, and the wait-staff are consistently checking on you. We were able to get our rounds of drinks/food pretty quickly. 

Just caution, you can't sit outside with your drafts. You're limited to bottles. 

I'll be going here again, probably for happy hour.

Man! I tell you. This place is awesome. The stacked nachos are off the chain!!!! Try it and you will see. The menu is small, but each of the foods are an amazing meal. Feels like bar rescue, simple menu but delicious. They do have a daily menu on the side. On a blue paper. That usually has something nifty. 

Let's talk about the beers.  So, this place has a lot of beer. They don't have the "mainstream" beers per s. But what they do have is an amazing selection. One that would make you lose it. They do have their version of Blue moon or shock top. DON'T get that. Tastes like bitter old lemonade. Everything else is pretty good. They will have some private beers. Again, no buds or millers etc... 

But between the food and the beers, I highly recommend this place. Service is great too!

If you're looking for a really good charcuterie, then you should visit this place!

I had their cheese and charcuterie and it was perfect!   What I like about this place is that it has three areas. On one side is their cheese shop, on the middle is the restaurant/bakery and on the other side is their coffee/espresso bar. Their cheese connoisseur is very friendly and knowledgeable and she let us try some of their cheeses and also explained to us some of the cheese/food/wine pairing. Service is awesome and servers are really friendly! 

The location is also perfect! It's far away from touristy State Street but still has the perfect Santa Barbara vibe to it. Such a fun and cozy atmosphere inside the restaurant and I would definitely go back to try their other stuff!

P.S.: you should definitely try their marinated olives, they're to die for!
The food speaks for itself!!  The flavor and presentation were the best I've had for Mediterranean food!  The real deal!

I've patronized the Night Kitchen for many years and have always loved everything I've bought there.  Until this time.  I bought a lovely looking cherry tart for $22, an average Night Kitchen price.  Usually things are worth every penny you spend, but this time the tart was all crust with hardly any cherry filling.  I was SO disappointed.  I will no longer assume that everything sold there is top quality.  So sorry.

I wish there was a Push Universal Training Studio in North Jersey. Either that or a virtual class/onsite trainer from there. I first started training with Troy and then consistently trained with Justin. Both are fantastic!! Justin helped me strive harder and achieve my fitness goals. The environment reminded me of a Rocky/Creed movie scene. I love that type of gym ambience. The price is so reasonable. Justin went above and beyond in making sure I left the gym feeling productive and not rushed. The staff and clients are very welcoming. Thank you Push Universal Training Studio for all you do!!

We hired this company to do a new house deep clean after renovation . I was very disappointed and infuriated to see a lot of the drawers and shelves were not cleaned. Floors looked horrible and worse than before . Unbelievable.

This is the worst service organization I have dealt with in my life.  I strongly discourage property managers from using this service.  They are holding on to timely payments that are sent and not processing them on a timely basis in order to charge late fees and have zero flexibility in waiving those fees.  Check sent on June 11th, payment processed on July 2nd.  Late charge of $5.  Sent in replacement check prior to old check clearing and placed a stop payment on old check.  They then process the first check almost a month after it was received and charge a $30 fee because of the stop payment that was placed on it for not being processed timely.  Nobody will help and they totally stonewall your ability to escalate to a CEO or senior manager (we can't release that information... fill out your complaint online).  Horrible horrible horrible service company built around padding their profit with fees caused by their own mistakes or ineptitude.  Property managers... your tenants are suffering from a severe lack of service if you use this company.  They need to be reported to a consumer agency (BBB) or something.

Eff this place. I took my wife here for couples massages, and was beaten over the head for a 45-minute massage during which the masseuse talked my ear off. When you first walk in, it feels as though you are walking into a drab cave. It's dark with no color whatsoever. I felt like I should have been deliberately sad. I stood at the front counter to announce my presence for my appointment only to be ignored by the TWO ladies behind the desk that were far more concerned with their own conversation. They babbled on and on until I finally spoke up, and was greeted with what I can only describe as contempt for being a customer. The room for the massage and the table were comfortable enough, but what could have been a redeeming effort was ruined by a masseuse that I wish had come with a mute button.

Damn. This place rocked my world. If you know me, you know I'm obsessed with Chinese food. 

It was busy on a Saturday night, but we only waited 15 minutes for a table for 4. The table ordered: mala chicken, moo shu pork, shrimp with snow peas and mushrooms, and hunan tofu. I only tried the chicken and pork, but both of the other dishes looked amazing, got rave reviews, and the plates were all clean by the end. I could see that the shrimp was cooked to absolute perfection.

Next time I go back (oh, there WILL BE a next time, for sure) it will be really hard not to get the mala chicken again. Menu listed it as very spicy, and while it had a kick it definitely wasn't Han Dynasty spicy. The morsels of chicken were so tender and fried beautifully - there was a very light coating that provided just enough crispness. The sauce was surprisingly complex, with notes of sichuan peppercorn, black vinegar, honey, garlic, and chiles. The portion was quite large but I ended up eating it all. Well, F kept stealing pieces but I guess I did offer to share both dishes we ordered... Next time he's getting his own.

The moo shu pork was OK, but moo shu isn't really my thing. I will say it's by far the best moo shu I've had on a very short list. Loved the seaweed (?) and glass noodles; it was very fresh-tasting.

Housemade pickles to start and chocolate-dipped fortune cookies with orange wedges at the end. What could be better? Some reviewers have complained about the portion sizes but I thought they were a reasonable size. You're not getting two pounds of food like at a cheap Chinese takeout joint, but the food is infinitely better, fresher, and made with higher quality ingredients. Worth paying a few extra dollars for.

Dinner entrees are a bit pricey for typical Chinese food, but on par with what you might see at the local Thai places ($14-$17 per entree). Certainly still affordable by Main Line standards!

I planned a surprise trip to Santa Barbara for our 10th anniversary. I was referred to SB Chauffeuring from the hotel I had booked and it was one of the best referrals I have ever been given. We had a wine tour scheduled for the afternoon with Maria who was hands down one of the nicest people we have ever met. Her knowledge of the region was vast and her professionalism was exceptional. Guys, there will be trouble if you don't let her open the door for you :)  That evening I had planned to surprise my wife with a visit from some west coast friends we haven't seen in a while. I informed Tony of this surprise and he help it go off without a hitch. With our friends waiting in the limo and with the help of Tony's ninja like photography skills, we were able to capture the moment of surprise on film. Professional, friendly and committed do being the best at what he does. 

Great people, amazing service and impeccable attention to detail. Did I mention the prompt arrival, the Happy Anniversary  decals on the doors, the drivers (Maria & Tony) who double as your own personal photographers for the whole trip, the great conversation, the ability to get you into one of the hottest clubs in SB for New Years because you waited 'til the last minute, the photos on CD and SB Chauffeuring magnets made with one of our photos sent to our house within a week, the clean comfortable fleet. They know and have it all!!!

Tony & Maria...You helped me pull off an unforgettable day & evening. I hope this review captures how awesome you and your service truly are. See you next year!

Tonight I had most wonderful experience I've had in a long time. the staff was polished , prompt, professional clean and proud of their establishment. i ordered the seafood trio. the salmon was perfect in execution. crisp sear buttery in the center i never knew salmon could taste so delicious. tandori sauce for the scallops was exquisite, perfect flavor. shrimp was well seasoned yet not over done . my drink was an old fashioned spirit forward with a healthy pour just how it should be. and the most wonderful risotto. the panna cotta was divine, Alex their pastry chef is a hidden talent in this gem of a restaurant her talents are reason to go back. Walter the server was precise in his service, well done to all those who made my night. thank you thank you thank you
Best bacon I've EVER had. It's sweet, thick & delicious. Best bloody Mary's also! Highly recommend this place for breakfast.

After making a star appearance on dirty dining (and being shut down), you would think the owners would make more of an effort to provide good service and a clean environment...think again.  Tried to call for carryout, the young woman who answered the phone asked me to repeat myself six times, and then asked me if the Phoenix roll was cooked or not???  Apparently, the employees do not have responsibility for knowing the menu. Nice job management!  Your training program is clearly paying off.  I guess we'll call for delivery instead.  I wonder what restaurant is going to lease that space after Hiro's goes out of business (again) in the near future.

- Another lost customer

This place is absolutely fabulous.  The food is wonderful. Freshly cooked in a test kitchen and Dave the executive chef/manager is very knowledgeable in his craft. This place obviously takes pride in what they do and it demonstrates in the flavor and presentation. Will definitely come back and would recommend to anyone!

Let me just preface this with saying I've frequented Coopers Hawk for at least two years now, but the experience I had the other night was just especially wonderful making me feel as though I needed to leave a review. Not only was my server Michael hilarious, he was extremely helpful and informative about many of the items on the menu making the choosing process so much better. He made me feel completely welcomed making the whole evening just that much better. Best burger melt I've had in forever, seriously! 

Thank you Michael!!

It was great to meet the owners while I had my lunch with few friends. The food is excellent and great service. 

The restaurant is very close to beach. I would stop by in my next visit to enjoy the fresh again.

I'll start off by saying DO NOT get the rice pudding. Disgusting! I took one bite and did not taste at all like it was supposed to. Save your money and maybe try another dessert. 

Butter chicken was okay, again, not what it usually tastes like but still not bad. Comes with plain white rice. Vegetable samosas were the most decent thing I got, good filling and nice and crispy.

Came in for lunch about a week ago and had the daily special, Eggplant Ponchartrain.  I was such a pig, ate the whole thing (and salad)... the eggplant is breaded and fried, then served over angelhair pasta with this crawfish cream sauce that is the best.

My friend had a (huge) burger which pleased him, and I think we were out of there with tip and ice teas for about $27.

Union Jacks has the best wings in the Delaware Valley, hands down.  I'm partial to the Spicy Thai wings, for a combo of sweet and hot.  They have a tremendous selection of beers that is constantly on a rotation so you could come in every other day and see a new selection to try.
Just really good food. The employees were very friendly and would definitely go back there on my next trip to philly.

Smoked sausage had such an amazing flavor, in addition the various mustards was a tasty combination . Beer mocha stout was dark, creamy , rich . Paired nicely with the sausage. Potato pancakes were good only a slight to moist and greasy. The sour cream schnitzel was delicious. I love the crispy breading of the veal. The spatzle was bland and not worth mentioning. The potato pancakes Dipped in sour cream or applesauce is the best combination. The apple strudel capped off the meal. It was warm, comforting, and I loved the nutty flavor.
The pizza was okay, but the place was dirty (even though it was after the lunch rush) and the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. There are better pizza options in the area.
Pleasant atmosphere, great food, and fantastic beer selection! Really enjoyed the friendly waitresses, especially ours, Ashley. She made the night fun! Plan on visiting again!!!!!!

Not a bad place -- good for something different if you get tired of the usual sandwich and chips for lunch.

I've only gone here maybe three times and have always had the Chicken Shawarma -- a full portion is more than enough food for lunch. Tender, juicy, and flavorful.

Service is OK but a little on the sluggish side.

I've never eaten in but the seating area appears to be decent. There's also a special room in back with Middle Eastern-style seating.... I've only glimpsed it when waiting on my order but it might be worth trying out sometime if you're out with a group.

There appears to be seating available outside when the weather is nice, but I'm not 100% sure about that as I've only gone here in the dead of winter.

Nice change of pace -- I'll be back and will have to sample some of their other menu items.

Food was bland, and also poor customer service. 

Also, what in the world is up with your privacy notice? Information is collected and given to third parties outside of Europe? And you charge 10 (not $10 USD) as entitled "by law" if someone wants to find out what information you have on them? I think you either copy and pasted this, or you're fabricating these so-called laws.

This is straight from their website:

"The information you provide to us may be accessed by or given to third parties some of whom may be located outside the European Economic Area who act for us for the purposes set out in this policy or for other purposes approved by you. Those parties process information, fulfil and deliver orders, process credit card payments and provide support services on our behalf. We may also pass aggregate information on the usage of our website to third parties but this will not include information that can be used to identify you. 
Where you have consented when providing us with your details, we may also allow other companies in our group, to contact you occasionally about products and services which may be of interest to you. They may contact you by e-mail. If you change your mind about being contacted by these companies in the future, please let us know at sales@sparkschinachef.com. 
Finally, if our business enters into a joint venture with or is sold to or merged with another business entity, your information may be disclosed to our new business partners or owners. 
Countries outside the European Economic Area do not always have strong data protection laws. However, we will always take steps to ensure that your information is used by third parties in accordance with this policy. 
Unless required to do so by law, we will not otherwise share, sell or distribute any of the information you provide to us without your consent. 

ACCESSING AND UPDATING

You are entitled to see the information held about you and you may ask us to make any necessary changes to ensure that it is accurate and kept up to date. If you wish to do this, please contact us at sales@sparkschinachef.com. We are entitled by law to charge a fee of 10 to meet our costs in providing you with details of the information we hold about you."

I absolutely did not like it. I'm not hard to please but I kind of expected the ribs to be "fall off the bone" tender...not tough, stuck on the bone, and slathered in what tasted like ketchup. Very disappointed for what I paid.

My husband and I came to Bacar to celebrate our honeymoon! We wanted to have some fine dining so we chose Angel Oak! Let me start off by saying that the outside seating has such a great and chill ambience. It's definitely a place to get dressed up for! The server brought us some prosecco to start off our celebration, which was very sweet. We ordered the spicy tuna on crispy rice, French onion soup, Caesar salad, and NY Steak! Everything was on point and delish! The Caesar salad was made with anchovies in the dressing and even tho I don't like the taste of anchovies, the salad was light and refreshing! The creme brle dessert was the best I've ever had! Highly recommend! The one negative thing I have to add is that the water tasted like dirt. Another table complained about the same thing! If that's a ruse for us to order bottled water, it worked.

We have been going to Bloomingdale Animal Hospital for as long as we have had dogs, 10+ years, for their low prices and location convenience. But after the way they treated an emergency situation, we will NEVER go there again. I don't know if it was lack of education on their part or lack of care, but either way, I will never trust them with my animals again. We have a miniature Dachshund who is 10 years old and one morning woke up screaming crying in pain, I rushed her to the vet right away and they took blood work, exams, and gave me anti inflammatory medicine and pain killers. After paying an arm and a leg, they told me they have no idea what's wrong with her and to check back in after a week. A few days later her pain was getting worse and not better, so I rushed her back in to get re-examined. After paying another arm and a leg, they told me it could be cancer but they are not completely sure, and she might have to be put down and just upped the medication and sent me on my way. Thank goodness my Dachshund got worse over the weekend, because this place was unavailable so I rushed her to the ER Vet Blue Pearl, where within minutes they diagnosed her with a COMMON DACHSHUND DISEASE CALLED IVDD. They immediately got her on the correct medication and treatment process and within weeks my dachshund was better, happy, and healthy. BLOOMINGDALE ANIMAL HOSPITAL TOLD ME SHE MIGHT DIE- and if they would have accurately diagnosed her the first time she would have been better weeks earlier instead of sitting in unimaginable pain. They either didn't care about my dachshunds life and wanted the extra money, didn't know a common disease which worries me about their overall education, or didn't take the time to genuinely care about my dachshunds pain. DO NOT GO TO THEM, YOUR DOGS CARE IS WORTH PAYING SLIGHTLY MORE SOMEWHERE ELSE.

My son and I went here after high recommendations, and everything was absolutely outstanding. The service is impeccable, and the food is all homemade and delicious. We shared a chopped salad, margherita pizza, and tiramisu, and we were stuffed at the end and took some home with us. It was so, so good - better than we had even imagined. The manager and our waitperson treated us like royalty, and the old school ambiance was absolutely delightful. 

You do need reservations, so don't wait! Make one and go! It's that good.

I had a problem with my high efficiency boiler. It would "lockout" and I would have to manually reset it. I had had this problem since the boiler was installed. No one was ever able to fix it!  I had 6 estimates to repipe my boiler, and Filan & Conner were the only ones to not insist I get an entire new system. They also didn't call me honey, baby, or sweetie! They were fast and professional! Thank you, Tony R!!!
BEST Mexican food in Tucson!  We recently had a family gathering there, and we had privacy in the back room. It was wonderful, and everyone loved the food and the service.
Has been a family favorite for years! Service is always fast and food is fresh. Definitely don't forget to add in an iced coffee!
Good, quick burger with no real frills. If you get everything on it - which is good but sloppy... Grab some extra napkins.

Absolutely delicious!  Bought a few treats including the dark chocolate red chile bark and a piece of cinnamon crunch- both were amazing.  I'm from out of town but next time I go back I won't leave town without stopping in!  Best chocolate I have had in a very long time!

[766]

I really love the Container Store!  When I learned they were coming to our area I had to show up during the opening. 

Plenty of parking as this store is next to the King of Prussia mall (not in it)

The store is huge with tons of organization options. 

I always stop in to "look around" but always end up leaving with a few items 

I'll be back!

I have never had a disappointing trip to Chicfila until today. I understand this is a "newer" store but still then hire better team leads and managers. I was in line for 45min. And four cars behind me were served before I was. I don't mind if we have a big or difficult order but it was only two meals no special orders except for my drink.  the girl put it in as an Arnald palmer more sweet tea then lemonade heavy ice. It came out with light ice more lemonade than sweet tea. I asked for this to be fixed and sat there for another ten minutes until I got out and ask for it myself and they handed me the same drink.  I will not be going back. There are to many other chic filas in the area to go to one that doesn't know how to serve correctly.

Really great, affordable steak restaurant. I used to come here as a kid with my dad in the early 90s. I recently returned a few weeks ago. I ordered their charbroiled prime Rib(queen cut) OMG it was so amazing! Best prime rib I have ever had. I came on a Sunday so the meal was only $17.95. for affordable and great service! I look forward to going back soon.

WOW! Just wow the food was awesome tasted so fresh and delicious I got the Garlic Chicken dish with Lo Mein noodles and it was just so absolutely delicious and I also got the mango chamoy drink which reminded me of being back in southern California! The staff was also so kinda, the location is also great if you want to sit outside you might get a chance to see some ducklings running around like I did. There is a really pretty water feature that makes the ambience outside feel like you're on a vacation. I can't wait to go back!

Staff can be misleading and don't understand the value of a returning client base. In the end I never got my valentines bouquet delivered from this place as I found the attitude and customer service lacking to say the least. I'll try the new Rittenhouse florist before I never go back here again.

I had Matt change the locks a new house we just purchased. Matt was very honest, gave me all the options  but always stressed the prices and which was cheapest so I wouldn't have to spend more than I wanted to. He seems to do good quality work and explained everything. And he answers his phone! I would absolutely use him again if I needed a locksmith.

I got a great haircut here, but there is one guy there that is super homophobic and offensive. He was offering to blow my friend and just complaining about how not gay he was in front of everyone. I wasn't sure if he was gay or just really offensive. Overall good haircut.

I want to give this place a 5 so bad, but we came during an odd time (half of their location was under construction).
We had made reservations and were seated in an odd room. 
It was very spacious, but not many tables so it was an odd feeling sitting in this room. 
BUT, the service was amazing and the oysters are a MUST TRY! They were like butter. So very smooth. 

Plus, they have a great happy hour to check out when you're in the area!

We bought the membership program for plumbing, electrical and air conditioning. They would come out periodically to check, but it was only just an excuse to try to sell us new and unnecessary parts. 

After calling to cancel the $35 per month charge, I was told I had to send a written request by email or regular mail, and it would take 30 days for it to be cancelled. Of course that means they get another payment out of me. 

30 days?  Sleezeb. Look at the reviews of this company both here and at BBB. 

IN ANSWER TO YOUR COMMENT. 

When we had the condenser fan stopped due to lightening in our air conditioning, we again had to listen to a selling speel before he would replace it. This was a unit that was less than 5 yrs old because it was still under warranty for the original installation. 

High pressure sale. Greatly inflated prices 

You came out once about our heater during your annual checkup in 2016.  We were told there was a tiny gas leak which he fixed after first telling us all about the expensive systems that we should buy before fixing it. The heater is still working fine in 2018.  Plus he looked at our air intake on the heating/cooling intake. Found a birds nest, but he said he was unable to get it out, they suggested punching a hold in the side wall for a new intake system. I went to hardware store, bought a snake, and cleaned it out myself  

Take a look at the BBB reviews of this company.

We were completely in awe of the professional way our whole kitchen countertop was fabricated and installed.  We had excellent communication from start to finish.  The installers began by laying down walk tarps on our carpet. Impressive!! The attention to detail was spot on!   
Look no farther.  Get on their calendar.
It's no longer open at the Tucson Mall. Not sure if they moved locations or closed indefinitely.

Went here for lunch on a weekday.

Service: Very friendly waitress and server. Seemed slightly understaffed when more people started trickling in for lunch but were never rude and reasonably fast. 

Space:
Seems like it's in an old KFC or some other fast food place? They still have the old drive in window up although I'm still not sure if they're using it or not...small space when the rush starts coming in. About 8-9 seats at the bar max, three 4-6 person tables and around 5-6 extra seats against one of the walls. Was able to grab a table but a group behind us had to wait a while for another. They do treat it like a full service restaurant though, waiter/ess has to seat you so no going to grab a seat yourself. 

Food: I had half the fried chicken, she had the chicken po boy, also split spiced tots. Fried chicken was very fresh. Breading is thick, very interesting spicy and sweet flavor which I really liked. They have a couple table sauces which go well with the flavor. She said chicken po boy was great. Spiced tots were unique with great flavor but my mouth was a little overwhelmed by all the chicken. I had a Southern Peach. Drink was well mixed, they don't skimp on the liquor. 

Would go back again, might try some fried nugz next time.
Great food u must get hot and sour soup and the calamari. I always get the basil beef or chick. U can't go wrong with this place.

Beware !!! Bed bugs 
The worse experience of my life . My husband,children and I traveled to Philly to see family from dec 26/30 . The hotel was chosen due to the proximity to his family and the downtown conveniences.  The staff in the evening were ok , but the one in the morning splendid the breakfast unorganized but a plus . The first night we noticed bites on my husband we didn't think much of it,as the days progressed he was getting worse and I started showing symptoms ..... We consulted with a doctor and he confirmed my suspicion bed bugs .....  So I was like hmmm let me check the bed bug registry chaching  !! There it was for me to see :( next time I will check and for sure we will never stay here again . I am sadden by the experience because I really wanted to like  this place and I normally don't like leaving bad reviews .... But this is to help others out ... Think about your options before staying.

Be prepared to wait a long time... But worth it!

The best Ortho docs in the Tampa area.  It's so nice to meet a doctor who is not in a hurry to "put you under the knife",   I have arthritis in my knees, pretty badly, and they are doing everything they can to buy me time without having to do a knee replacement.  Staff is friendly and kind, and the PA and residents they train here have all been awesome.  I would highly recommend Dr.Bernasek if you are having trouble with your knees.  He's extremely kind, calm, and compassionate,  He also takes the time to talk to you and explain things, sometimes even leaving with a little hug,  And he does not order unnecessary testing

Now, this is a HUGE practice with several locations.  And for some reason always run behind time.  When I saw Dr. Bernasek in December, I waited over 2 hours.  This time I had an appointment with his PA who gives the injections "so I won't have to wait so long". Well my appointment was at 11:00am but I was not called in until after 2pm.  That is ridiculous.  The PA was very apologetic about the wait, but I still gave him "what for" about it.  How can you get 3 hours behind in the morning?  This is definitely the biggest drawback of this practice.  I  do have to say they did bring around bottles water and packets of peanut butter crackers for us, which was a nice thing, but still did not make up for such a long wait

But, I have great confidence in my PA and Dr.  They don't rush me when I'm with them and they genuinely seem to care.  When it comes to my health, I want the best, and even with these long waits, I have the best.  

Minus a star for waiting time.

If you would like to start your trip, whether on business or pleasure, with a huge HEADACHE, choose Sixt Rental Car.  It is off site and it seems as if they only have one shuttle to pick you up form the airport. After 2 phone calls upon arrival and 35 minutes of waiting at the shuttle pickup area, the driver finally showed with a van that was full of other customers. I then squeezed in and sat on the floor for the 10 minute ride. 
I don't like judging a book by its cover but upon arrival, you 2nd guess your decision right away after seeing the building and the area.  If you don't get mugged by someone on the street or 7 eleven next door, one of the guys "cleaning" the cars outside under a makeshift canapoy will do it.  

Anyways, once you get through the painfully slow line inside, the customer service was decent and the guy who checked me in was courteous and took the time to ask how our trip was going. Explained my frustrations with getting to their facility and he understood, did nothing beyond saying he was sorry about it though.

Once I finally got to the van I had rented and paid an additional $50 for a car seat, the van looked like it had been ridden hard and put away wet! There was not one panel without a dent, scratch or gauge.  This was ironic as the person who checked me in made it very clear that I should take the extra insurance coverage as I would be charged for an minor dents or dings on the vehicle. It wasn't vacuumed and the convicts "cleaning" consisted of spraying it off with a garden hose. 

Save yourself a headache when renting a vehicle @ TPA and rent form one of the companies on-site at the airport.  Any savings you think you might get form one of these 2nd rate rental car companies is not worth it, TRUST ME.

I visited this restaurant for my birthday on Wednesday with my sister and mother.  When we entered the restaurant, we waited. Although there was no line of customers to be greeted and seated.  The hosts were not at their posts and the employees assisting customers at the cheesecake case did not acknowledge us. When the hosts finally arrived to seat us. They did not welcome us and ushered us to the front of the restaurant and/or bar area.  My family is African American and the reason why I am noting this is that me and my family were greeted with cold and unwelcome stares from the Caucasian employees at the restaurant which is unacceptable behavior.  The Caucasian female initially assigned to our table acted like she did not want to serve us so her co-worker, a person of color, offered to do so.  After we were seated, we ordered lemonades. The rims of the glasses were covered in sugar although we had not ordered margaritas or alcoholic beverages. This could have been very problematic as my sister has diabetes.  I informed the server or waiter that it was my birthday and ordered a cheeseburger with fries.  When the food finally arrived, the bun on my burger was charred. The outside of the burger was burnt and the inside was raw.  The waiter apologized as he had not even bothered to ask me how I wanted my burger cooked i.e. rare, medium, well done.  He took the hamburger back while I hungrily waited for him to reappear.  He eventually returned after my sister and mother were finished with their meals with a burnt burger that was too burnt for consumption.  It felt and tasted like they had just cooked the old burger even longer.  I informed our server about the second burnt burger and he brought the manager who wanted to know if I wanted to give it a third try????  I declined the offer and ordered soft chicken tacos instead.  My sister's meal was gumbo with cheddar sauce???  Anyone familiar with this cuisine knows that it should never be made with cheese.  My experience at this establishment was horrible to say the  least. I have visited this restaurant in the past albeit years ago and the service and food had been excellent. I often referred to cheesecake factory as my favorite restaurant and so I was very disappointed and ashamed that I had recommended that we celebrate here.  Neither me nor my family or any family of color deserves to be treated as described at this chain restaurant.  All they will remember is how badly we were treated and the sub-par quality of the food.  I agree that the cheesecake is now "so so" and/or average.  We had wasted so much time at the restaurant that we decided not to proceed with our planned shopping trip and simply returned home.

Solid awesome bagels and LaColombe Coffee....pure nirvana.  Was looking for a replacement for years.  A few growing pains and hopefully the owners will realize that details coupled with speed matters.  Kiosk needs to go.  Good initiative however very slow and most don't expect to use the remote ordering in such a small store.  If they don't up their speed game and coordination this place may suffer in the short and long term.
Very impressed with the quality of meats and friendliness of staff.  The Corner Butcher is a jewel in Fenton.

The food is fine, but the wait is incredibly long, and the menu has things labeled as gluten free which, in fact, cannot be made gluten free. The kitchen is very unhelpful- which is their prerogative, but if they don't and won't cook the bacon/sausage/etc in a gluten free way, then the bacon/sausage/etc shouldn't be labeled gluten free. Waited forever for what ended up being a disappointing meal.

Did a reservation and got in at the exact time. Restaurant looks a lot bigger on the inside than the outside. I liked the temperature in the restaurant. Staff and waitress were nice. Liked that the food came out pretty fast. Price for seafood was reasonable. They didn't charge us gratuity for a party of six. My only cons were the oyster. Pricey for the quantity and quality for the oyster. Oyster's weren't soaked/rinsed long enough to get rid of all of the sand/dirt. The steamed oyster were so shrunk, they barely had any meat left. $16 for a dozen shrunk oyster is way to overpriced.

Had a lovely haircut by Bellasbeauty_18.  Enjoyed the calm environment and thorough service. She was very focused and gave my hair her 100% undivided attention. The school is no longer able to except tips on credit cards. So if you wish to tip your student take cash with you.

The worst Wendy's in the United States. The service is slow and unprofessional. The fries no matter when you go , are cold and hard. The sandwiches for some reason don't taste like they should. This place needs to be revamped. Wendy's is normally good, not this one. Just stay away

Took my somewhat older homemade gaming PC into these guys when I had a critical error and was dead in the water. My beloved PC would no longer even boot up past the BIOS. I used this PC for both Gaming, School and Work and did not want to live on my laptop until I could afford to build another PC up. 
     I found these guys online and luckily they were right next to my work. They have great pricing and the turn-around was even better. Upon pickup they took the time to review everything with me, and even help me make a few minor tweaks for quality of life. I could not be happier. I am writing this review on said PC right now and it has never worked better! Can not recommend these guys enough, thanks for everything guys! I will be telling everyone who has a computer issue where to go. Cheers!

Pizza, wings, and food was on point definitely was not expecting that great of food with a bar but the pizza and wings are something I will be getting the next time I go. Blue moon was served with oranges and the service was amazing. We stayed for about three hours had two pitchers and multiple rounds it the cage. Great place to spend some time with friends and family.
Hands down the worst wine I ever had.  The atmosphere is nice, plus there is seating outside.  But the wine....not good.  Sorry.

Oh my where do I begin? Being accosted at the front entry & grilled as to where I'm from if I live here have I been here etc, they are trying to pull pages from disneys play book but they fall abysmally short!
Now to the food-good thing they have the exquisite fish & famous fish tank to distract you. My fish tacos as well as being appetizer portion were dry fish, little cabbage, tiny amount of sauce-had to ask 2 people for extra sauce-not from our waiter who was nowhere to be seen-with only 2 other tables-the wine glass portion was 3 oz at most at $9/glass-guess they have to pay for the fish. No ketchup offered or available for the sweet potato fries that were cross cut frozen I really can't go on except to again say thank goodness for the fish tank that was definitely the star

I have been a long time patron of Ghini's  and it seems to get better with age. I can always count on Ghinis to have the freshest most delicious food that I know is always made with the utmost attention to detail. My favorite is that Caesar salad with blackened chicken. The salad is fresh and the chicken always so tender and flavorful but the dressing is like nothing else!!!! Easily my favorite restaurant in tucson and by far the best brunch spot of all time! You are missing out if you don't try it.

The traditional breakfast is always great here, but I honestly believe that one of the best Huevos Rancheros breakfasts I've EVER had is from here. The only thing I personally do not like is that they serve potatoes instead of traditional hash browns. But really, that's more of a personal preference. 

Their orange juice is not fresh squeezed, like they said it was. But only Jack, my husband, is super picky about fresh squeezed, not-from-concentrate juice. Highly recommended!

I have come here for my last 3 birthdays,  wouldn't miss another one. Love this place, really good price for the quality of sushi. One of the top 2 places in Reno to get all you can eat. 
Shout out to Riley!!!! Best server

The setting is interesting and unique. The food is okay, not great but good, with decent variety. But the service is so lackadaisical as to be almost non-existent. The only grown ups here seem to be the customers, with the staff seemingly comprised solely of unsupervised teenagers. They're not bad kids, but they haven't the faintest clue about customer service. And no one has taught them. And nobody is there to check on them. 

If this restaurant fails, they will have deserved it for not paying attention to the most important ingredients, the PEOPLE. And that includes both the customers they ignore, and the poor kids they inflict upon them.

This is our second time here. Much different experience from the first visit.  
The first time here the young man that took our orders was very attentive and the service was outstanding. The owners even came out to check to make sure everything was ok.  The food was great and very flavorful. Very good first impression of the place. 

So 2nd visit here, we were told to sit anywhere, menus were brought over and we were left sitting there for about 20-30 minutes before someone came to take our order. Other people had come in after us and were waited on before us so already customer service had dropped significantly. The table that was sitting in front of us had to remind the waitress that she hadn't taken our order yet. Once we got our orders in I'd say the time was pretty average for the food to be served. We were not checked up on again after that. The food was good but combined with the poor service we have not been back.

Having moved out here from the West Coast and having lived in the Pacific Northwest, my preference for Dungeness crab over teeny tiny blue crabs found here is a cause for sadness since they are so hard to find and can be expensive.

Then I discovered that Marco's occasionally holds $35 AYCE Dungeness crab nights!  Hold your horses, make a reservation and head on over.

First, to be honest, the atmosphere is just OK. When we first walked in, it felt like we were walking into a funeral home. It was dark and very dated.

The $35 dinner included fries and garlic bread. We told the server no fries for us please (more room for the crab!). They forgot and brought over fries anyway. They took them away. I ordered their version of an iced tea. I don't know what they brought over, but it wasn't an iced tea. Then they brought out the garlic bread, which unfortunately tasted stale and had very little flavor.  After a bite or two, we decided to pass on that too.

Finally, the crab!  You can start with a plate with 2 large crabs, cleaned and split into two. You have a choice of Old Bay, garlic or plain. I started with Old Bay for the first found, but it was too salty for me. Next two rounds were plain. All the crab was juicy and meaty and sweet - just what I was looking for.

They do provide crab crackers, but to get the most meat, I highly recommend bringing your own seafood picks and.... my secret weapon... tiny sharp scissors!  Easier to cut through the legs where the shell is thin and you can get out a perfectly unmolested lump of meat that way.

Had the World's Fair burger with sweet potato fries and ate every last bite, even though I wasn't that hungry. The fries were just the right level of crispy, and that jalapeno cheese sauce was to die for.

Also had the Tiger's Blood, which was a nice sweet treat.

The service rubbed me the wrong way initially, but our server was very attentive and apologetic when he realized one of the burgers in our group had cheddar on it when the girl who ordered it explicitly asked for it to be left off.

It is pretty cold inside, so make sure to bring a light jacket.

I can't say much about their products yet.  I haven't been able to try any since it takes 2 weeks (or never...) to get a response to email (and if any response is received, it's only hours before the tentative pick-up time).  As a result, I've missed out a few times already.  I know that on a farm, it's super busy and it may take 4-5 days to get back to someone, but that's ridiculous.  It's sad -- I had such high hopes for this place!
Delicious food that tasted fresh and house made. I order the hummus and veggies with the Spicy Chicken Wrap.  Oak and Stone have an amazing beer selection that was fun to taste and explore.

Most recent visit, I had the Braised Short Rib with Espresso Harissa BBQ Sauce, Red Onion, Cucumbers, & Hummus.  Incredible!  This should be on one of those top ten sandwiches to eat before you die list.  Really amazing!

I can not speak highly enough about My Best Friend.  We have been going there for a number of years now with our dog and cats.  I trust them like no other vets I have experienced.  We have had 3 cats in their care at all times and unfortunately all three have had illnesses.  They always take the time to answer all our questions and give very open and honest feedback.  One of our cats was diabetic and was truly a "problem child" but Dr. Sharz and Dr. Sandy never gave up on her and went above and beyond trying to treat her.  Unfortunately, she got cancer and we had to put her to sleep.  But I know they gave her another 4 great years before the cancer hit just by being so willing to work with her diabetes and educate us as a family on how to care for her.  With the 2 of our cats that had to be put sleep, they we treated with such love and compassion, as was our family.  Every member of the staff has a passion for his/her job and it shows.  I will never go to another vet and highly recommend them.  Their name is so appropriate, because they truly are "My Best Friend" for my animals and for me when it comes to their care.

At this point I probably dined in and ordered take out about 40 times at least... It never disappoints. Great food, amazingly spiced. Never had better Indian food. Keep it up Ekta 5 stars well deserved.

This review is for the true religion store. After owning several true religion jeans i purchased a pair from this store that bagged out after wearing for just over an hour and it started to lose shape. I called the store and explained the issue and advised that i removed the tags to wear the jeans but needed to return or exchange them due to them bagging out after such a short time. I was advised there is no way to return or exchange jeans once the tag is removed and i was referred to read the return policy on the receipt. I again explained i own several jeans the same size and have not had this issue before . How would i know the jeans would not fit so poorly unless I wore them? $130 is too much to not be able to return of something does not work. Another true religion store accepted the jeans and could not believe it was so stretchy.  They explained there are quality differences in jeans made for outlet locations.

I was always a Neiman Marcus fan, but after visiting this Nordstrom, I haven't used my NM card is almost a year. The vibe at Nordstrom is younger and the sales help is just wonderful. Many of the sales associates at NM just stare at you with a "can't be bothered" look on their faces. If I'm spending $500 on a dress, I'd like someone to at least show me to a dressing room! The friendliness level at Nordstrom blows Neiman Marcus out of the water. And Nordstrom has some of the same brands and many of the younger brands that NM does not. Since the redesign of the King of Prussia store, this is my favorite place to shop. Sales associates have called around the country to find dresses in a size I've needed. And they've mailed pieces to my home at no charge when it wasn't in stock at the time. They've sent "Thank you notes" to my home when I've shopped there. 

My only two complaints: They don't have a full sized spa like the Nordstrom in Chicago (which is just wonderful!) and the service in the cafe is painfully bad. The food is delicious, but the workers are neglectful and don't know how to properly serve a table. They have a bit of an attitude, as well. I actually complained to the manager at the cafe and he admitted to knowing his staff is not up to par and offered me a free lunch because of a bad experience I'd had. When I went in for the lunch, he was not in that day, but had obviously left a note about me coming. The staff was snotty and made every effort to make me uncomfortable. I don't go there for lunch anymore (although I've had great experiences at the restaurants at other Nordstrom stores). But there are plenty of places to eat in the mall (actually Neiman's restaurant is fantastic). I still go to Nordstrom for almost all of my shopping.

Good place to dance, cheap drinks, kind of a dive.  Be sure to plan your transportation accordingly as the subway stops at 12 and you'll want to stay here pretty late.  Great DJ's, cheap drinks, word.
This place is amazing. I've tried several things on the menu and have enjoyed them all. I like the spicy soup they bring you to get a taste of the flavors they use. I love the seating and vibe.

I had the worst possible experience from a hotel of my entire life and it happened to be the my wedding. I would never recommend this hotel for any bride. They messed up our rooms, lost reservations until I called with confirmation numbers, didn't have rooms ready in time (hours later) when i called to confirm the day before. Were extremely rude and unapologetic for any of the mistakes that were made. Charged us $150 to take wedding photos at stratus before it was opened and then tried to kick us out 5 minutes after being there. The bar wouldn't give my of my bridal party water. They tried to make my brother wait in Stratus's line to get to his room, which was on the 10th floor. Everything was VERY VERY VERY expensive and the amenities and service VERY poor. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone with the OMI next door. Don't fall for the fancy wall paper at the hotel monaco. Not to mention the bartenders at the red owl tavern were rude to all my guests and family members. You'll be extremely sorry you asking the people you care about to spend the money it costs to stay here for what they'll get out of it.

My go to Walmart. It has most of the thing I need in great price. I like this Walmart in three different way. Grocery, daily use, and pharmacy. This is a super Walmart. So it has more items than regular Walmart. 

Start with grocery. They have bakery, fresh produce, deli, meat and seafood, frozen section and many more. Price is acceptable. I like the Parmesan chicken wing. This is my favorite in the deli section. I like the cream pop at the frozen section. They do have Ahi tuna grade fillet. It good for seared or sushi. 

Daily product includes clothing, sport items, electronic, art and craft, bicycle, jewelry, and more. I like the most is their eye glass center, you can get good pair of glass with lesser price with insurance cover. The pant and shock is my frequent item. 

The pharmacy has the beauty product I need, it also has my daily care product like tooth paste, shampoo and mouthwash. Well. They are definitely very convenient for me.

Their service is outstanding.  They stand behind all of their products and go above and beyond every time.  They will patiently spend the time with you when you're choosing new juice.  There is always an abundance of staff to serve you and you're never waiting more than a couple minutes for an order.  I'm amazed that anyone could find a negative about dealing with them.  They set the standard for what a vape shop should be.
The store itself is great like other reviews said, but the pharmacy gas some issues. Nothing is EVER done, even if they text you and tell you it is. Frustrating.

Even better the second time. Kentrell (sp. ?) was very helpful and even remembered us from our first stay. Staff is terrific. Room was exceptionally clean. 

I missed having Louis in the elevator - please bring him back.

This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are quiet at night. 

As I achieved Gold with Marriott before our second stay, the Saint gives you breakfast buffet vouchers. The buffet was okay but they didn't have all of the food out even 10 minutes after they opened. We were on a time crunch so we weren't able to sample all of the food. I wouldn't pay for the buffet but it was great for free.
The pumpkin crunch cheesecake was awesome!!! Minis are terrific for taste of heaven for multiple treats!
I should also note that the Pink Dolphin has some of the best coffee in Philly.  You would never guess by looking, but try it out.  It is the f-ing bomb.

Joe and Danica have a homerun with MMG.  The food is awesome, they always have great specials, and their delivery is fast!  I'm a cheesesteak/pizza/wings guy, so I'm not one to sacrifice taste for anything.  But eating at MMG, I still get great food that's actually good for me.  Eating a few times a week at MMG has helped me drop over 25 lbs for this summer.  Thanks guys and keep up the great work!

We were a party of 4 and sat on the wonderful patio. Service was friendly and attentive. The food was excellent, particularly the fried chicken. West County needed this type of restaurant/bar - very reasonably priced with quality service and product. Not since having the fried chicken at Monarch have I enjoyed fried chicken. Kudos to Joey B!! You are a hit with us.
Friendly staff, clean room, free breakfast, burger was very good - side salad was bland, cheesecake was very good.

Terribly disappointing. Food was bland, no flavor. They get 1 star for the pad Thai which was just ok. Spring rolls were huge, but all lettuce and rice noodles with two half pieces of shrimp and no flavor. Fried pork rice had almost no meat in it. Special pho was a bowl of hot water and dried out weird meatballs.  Server was a nice young lady who was terribly overworked, as the only one in the dining room for dinner on a Friday night with 11 tables of people. They were 'out of all alcohol' 'out of Thai coffee' , out of all banh mi sandwiches, and had no mugs for hot drinks because they hadn't had time to do any dishes.  Really? It was sad. They won't make it if this is how they really operate. Go to sawasdee for much better Thai, or the Vietnamese restaurant in castleton for real pho.

Came here just for some cocktails. The atmosphere is really nice, good for date night. The drinks were good. We ended up getting the Banana's foster which is made table side. It's very decadent and one of the best I've had. Worth trying.
These guys are real pros! Very patient and willing to help you make the right decision. Kevin and his guys are awesome.

The absolute best Starbucks I've ever been to! I think I enjoy the baristas and the setting even more than the delicious coffees they make. I have many fond memories of this place from studying, enjoying conversations with friends and co-workers. I enjoy their clover micro brew very much!

We had heard about this place from a friend. It was a cold day, so a little difficult to really truly enjoy the outside landscape.

I had my student ID, but because it didn't specifically list "Student" on it, they did not give me the student discount. A bit bizarre, because it would be $2 off for a party of 5 people.

There looked to be a cute place to hang out, near the door, but as I said, it was a cold day when we were there.

Cool to see one time. I think I would have been more favorable had they honored their own student ID policy, so I don't see a reason to go back. Don't count on them honoring your ID, either.

5 stars for Michaya, 2 for the boutique itself. The girls at the front desk are not that inviting when you walk in the shop. They didn't greet me or asked if I needed help with anything. I had to go up there to let her know I had an appointment. They also misinformed me about the "50% off first fill" deal when I called to reschedule my 2nd appointment. I understand the policy, but then I expect them to do their research before actually confirming the deal with the client. When I asked about it while I was paying and told them it was confirmed prior to the appointment, they pretty much implied that I was lying because it was Lara who rescheduled me and she "would never say that". First of all, money isn't an issue for me so whether I pay the full price or not isn't a big deal. Just maybe next time, learn to acknowledge and apologize for the misinformation then explain the policy without making your clients feel like you are questioning their integrity. 

Anyway, booked my first appt with Michaya 2 weeks ago using Groupon. This was my first time ever getting lash extensions so I didn't really know what to expect. I liked how she asked me questions to help me decide what length and style I should go with. We decided to go with natural looking lashes, then she said we can change it up on our follow up appt if I wanted a more dramatic look. The process took an hour and the whole time I was very relaxed. The ambience in the room and her music was very soothing. She told me what to expect when we were done, which is pretty much to expect a lot of shedding. She also told me to book my follow up in 2 weeks. 

I had my follow up yesterday and by the time I got to the boutique, I felt like I only had 25% of the extensions left. She said my eyelashes are sparse so the lashes aren't holding on as much as they should be. So this time around, she used a stronger glue and we went for longer, more bolder look.  

It's been 24 hours since my appt and so far I've only shed 1 eyelash! Compared to the first time, where I lost about 10 on each eye. 

So far so good. I enjoy getting them done with Michaya. She's kind, professional, educated and she really does care about what you want.

I live local (Largo) and like to check out all the new beach places. Went here when it first opened, and liked the view. Drink prices were ok, food was limited. After going there a few times with friends, they wanted $20 to park in their mostly empty garage and or outdoor parking. I tried to explain I wanted to go up to the bar for a few drinks, but there was no talking to the "in charge" parking guy. Bottom line, won't go back. There are many other good choices with free parking, Frenchies, Palm Pavillion and Crabby Bills to name a few. All of these have better food and drink prices. Sent an email to the company but never heard back from them, not surprised. Just another overpriced  tourist joint with a view in my opinion.

Worst USO experience ever all I wanted to do was lay on the floor and get a few hours sleep. They decided the best way to serve tired service members during the holiday travel season is turn the place into a low budget back yard party. Blasting terrible 90's music and christmas songs while exhausted service members struggle to sleep. Numerous people complained staff did nothing. This was self serving and they should be ashamed of themselves

Great place to watch sports. Food is overall pretty good. I really like their cheesesteak! I've tried a burger and it was a little over cooked. Chicken tenders are great as well. The staff Is very nice and and attentive.
Great duckhorn wine pairing! Natalie our waitress was great! Potatoes were awesome and filet with bone in was killer cooked to perfection!

This is without a doubt the best Steak house and my favorite for many years. The ambiance is warm with outstanding service,
We celebrated our 52d anniversary last night, The Capital Grille made it an exceptional evening  wit its excellent service making you feel that you are with friends. We were presented with long stem roses and champagne as well as lovely deserts. 
Needless to say the stakes were perfectly cooked and tasted great. The best!

Took my car in to get a number of dents repaired including one very large dent on the front fender.  These guys are great!    When I went in for the estimate they told me that the large dent would be difficult and they would only be able to assure a 80% fix.  Well I can't see it all!
the work was done on time and for the price quoted.
I am a fan!!!

The prices are pretty great, especially the happy hour prices. The service was quick and our server was on top of making sure our drinks were refilled and our food was brought out promptly. The crab rangoons were very fresh and yummy. I got the dancing crab roll and it was amazing but my friend got the Godzilla roll and the tuna was a faded color with grayish hues. This was concerning as that is not the color red color that you would normally find with spicy tuna.
Amazing Indian fusion food! Kept true to the indian style while incorporating a mix of styles. Truly enjoyed the experience and service was great. Would definitely come back!

It's a nice establishment but the golden rule of having a quiet environment in the library does not exist here.

The library is intended for a quiet place to read and check out materials- however, if you decide to study or read at the library the staff is distracting. They tend to have loud conversations about their lunch schedules, weekends and other plans.

There is a lot of commotion as well with the traffic in and out,but that does subside once people check out or return their materials.

I'd suggest bringing head phones to block out all the extra noise.
Excellent food and service - wine is over-priced.
Ate here today with my daughter. The food and service were really good. The Cheese plate and brussel sprouts were a hit. Definitely a good spot to eat outside on a nice day.

GROSS GROSS GROSS DONT GO HERE found a hair in my burger and the floor was so dirty even the tables were filthy! Felt like I needed a shower after just walking in! Won't be going back ever!! You couldn't pay me to go back.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant! It was affordable, delicious, and every worker we met was so kind! Our waiter, Derek, I believe was his name, was so nice and funny! The decor, the view, and the food were all amazing! We recommend the lasagna and a nice glass of wine!

These are cheap studio apartments in the heart of Fat City. If you require lace doilies under your tea, these are not for you. But they have several good points:
1) Cheap
2) Convenient to shopping, Lakeside mall, the Causeway and I-10
3) Cheap... and small, about 500 sq. feet
4) Well managed. Anytime I have had a complaint, like a leaky faucet, bugs (! I hate bugs!!) or a car abandoned in the parking lot, it has been answered quickly and courteously. 
5) They rent month-to-month.

There are about 60 units in the building but the room-to-room insulation is good. Above and below, not so good. With so many tenants, one disgusting pig with dishes in the sink can attract roaches, who will roam the building looking for other opportunities. I sealed all the water pipe and electrical openings, then reported the problem. DA exterminating came by the very next day, no problems since then.  
Free water, laundry room on the lowest floor. Many but not all of the apartments have a wall or baffle with built-in bookshelves. So your bed is behind the wall and it's a little more like a real apartment.
A nice feature for those of us who survived Katrina is that the building is on stilts, it is raised with parking underneath. 
All in all you get what you pay for. I resisted bringing my girlfriend over for the longest time because I was not real proud of the place. But thanks to the Summit, I have money in the bank and plans to play in the stock market. (If I am still living here in a few years, you will know how well that worked out.)
