Going in during holiday time may be a harrowing experience but Ed made my visit...dare I say....enjoyable? Thank you, Ed, for your positive and upbeat attitude and willingness to help. Great customer service!

This place automatically deserves a 3+ star for opening AND DELIVERING 24/7.  

This is a unique place; they serve everything from dinner food (pizza, burgers, steaks, wings, etc) to breakfast food (breakfast sandwiches, omelets, toast, etc.)  I live in the university area and usually the latest open restaurants are pizza shops that close around 2am, so to have a joint open all night long is a jewel.

We actually ordered two omelets in the morning because we were having a lazy morning, and it turned out to be a great first experience.  The omelets are very customizable, and they are quite large.  It came with a side of toast, and a choice of fruit, home fries, or french fries (??).  It was around $6-7  The delivery guy appeared to be college age and was very friendly to be delivering food in the morning when everyone else was just waking up.

Definitely a place worth trying especially if you're a student who's got a long night ahead of you.

Terrible since they have purchased my property I have had many issues with moisture, little bugs like crickets, now they are failing to pay the IPL bill. The entryway lights have been out for five  days now. When I called the emergency hotline the man laughed at me and said it was not an emergency, I reached out to the president of PMI Mark, he says we will handle this and it is still pitch black in my apartment entryway. The photo attached is literally my door that I cannot see unless I have my own light to unlock it. UPDATE: I put in a maintenance request 10/29/19 that was just "completed" today 1/20/20.

I leave the right to change this after they contact me because I hope that this will be corrected.  Below is part of my original comment where it was left on hold for over an hour. However I do want to correct what I wrote in saying that I was called within five minutes of making my comment it was explained to me that somebody had accidentally stayed logged into the phone, and it's simple human error was the mistake. They more than compensated for my hour on the phone took my order right away, said he will be in contact if I have any questions and gave me ways to contact him in case I had any problems in the future. I always leave my original post.  That being said they more than compensated and I'm feeling the red carpet service. 
Original post:
I work at a call center, all calls are taken care of that came in before closing.  Not here.  I called In at 11 after 7.  They close at 6 on Fridays, but yelp says they close at 10pm, no where on there mobile site do they post their hours and you don't know their office is closed until you give up and leave a voicemail.  I would have left a voicemail 5 min into the call if they started with they were currently closed.  Additionally the message never changed, still told me I could continue to hold.  I am not feeling the red carpet service.  I hope that we can move on from this and I get the service that everyone raves about.  But for today they are at a one  star

Second time here today. My first time was really pleasant with the employees being super friendly and I got a mani pedi. Pedi was great it was done by odry, manicure was sub par & I didn't receive a massage or hand cap as other regular mani pedi customers did. However the place is clean and the employees were so pleasant I decided to make this my new go to spot for pedicures.

Came back today for my second one. I don't think the employees knew I could understand what they were saying. I was a walk in and they were pleasant about it. However I asked if they had any special spa pedicures which most nail salons have. The employees at other salons usually try to upsell you to a spa as well. However I was met with looks as if I was crazy, they also initially said they had 2 different kinds of spa pedicures then changed it to a single special spa pedicure. They also stated that it would get "complicated" if I started picking and choosing in another langu

I stayed for my pedicure because I was heading home anyways and my experience before was good regarding my pedi. Odry was my pedicurist again today and she did a good job again today, 

However regarding the spa pedicure incident and feeling as if my patronage is not appreciated I will not be returning.

There are one too many nail salons in sj to put up with sub par service and basically staff trying to fly you out the door when you want a longer or upgraded service.
Who wouldn't love it here? The menu is awesome, and they even have gluten-free options! You can't beat sitting so close to the ocean. The vibe is killer. A definite MUST when you're in the area.

Came in here for a late dinner on Friday night. We sat at the bar, feeling like it would offer a spicier ambiance. The bartender was attentive although seemingly wanted to get outta there. After reading some reviews, I was convinced to go with the Lemon Basil Mojito..pitcher. At $34 - you get a large pitcher of this cocktail. 
We started off with the bacon-wrapped bleu cheese stuffed dates as I have an addiction to a version of these that I make with manchego and prosciutto - my version blows these away....way away. Mojo must deep fry their version as the crispiness of the bacon really turned me off. We also got the edamame curried hummus with some lavash crackers. This was simple but tasted really nice - lacked enough crackers to finish off the hummus. 
We got a flatbread pizza and a trio of sliders (Korean BBQ, lamb, black bean) for our next course. The flatbread pizza was forgettable and the best slider was the black bean for sure. The Korean BBQ had a really strange tasting slaw that needed some spice and salt. The bread pudding for dessert was the all-star of the meal and almost got Mojo four stars. Mojo offered good tasting food and solid drink, but doesn't warrant the price.

Very, very solid first experience here...... I've been hearing a lot about different italian shops on 'the hill" for a longtime. And I've never ate in the neighborhood so I started here...
This has the feel of a family-owned small restaurant with cool, old-decor.  I'd drop by here again anytime for "the Special" sandwitch on the crusty french bread. All the toppings & meats were fresh-cut, I cannot wait to try everything else! Smell like a bakery!

The location of this hotel is convenient, and the room was spacious & the beds weren't terribly uncomfortable. That's about all the good stuff. As for the not so great, the staff at the front desk, the two times I interacted with them, were both pretty surly. A smile & thank you are pretty standard in customer service, I didn't get that either time. The area by the elevator had duct tape covering something on the wall. TACKY! As for our room, the floor in the kitchenette was sticky & there was an odd odor.  The room was scheduled for some light housekeeping while we were out ( which we weren't charged for, apparently it's scheduled every so often :/ ) and we didn't receive new towels and the trash bag was taken but not replaced. I felt like a lot of the staff were just phoning it in. It'd be nice if the place's give-a-damn meter worked because this place could be halfway decent if they tried harder.

Smoked to perfection. No other way to describe it. The rub + slow and low over pecan wood creates a sweet and sightly kickin' flavor that penetrates the meat and creates a skin on the Thunder Thighs that's worth fighting over. The wings bring a little more heat to the party and I'm glad there is a never ending supply of amazing craft brews a few steps away! Love it. Will be making this a regular destination.

This was the first time visiting the general area. I personally think this place is a must- but the band that played tonight covered a lot of metal/rock (which is my absolute fav). Definitely a fun bar. I loved the band that was playing tonight.

Dr Sean Crocker made a follow up phone call several days after treating the family dog. A few days later I called back and he advised, listened , gave great help. Thank you so much dr Crocker for you caring , concern and professional help. Greatful !

After having immunization shots at Petco clinic offered by River Road Pet Clinic & Dr. Crocker we returned with urgent dog / family pet concern. They were book but saw the dog as it was 109 degrees and hard to be outside with pets. Greatful to Corey at desk Chris the tech  and Dr Crocker whom we trust and was very patient and professional . Thank yo


We attended a pet vaccination clinic at Petco in same shopping area . It was very professional with a doctor and two assistants. They offer it once a month through Petco .

Honestly it's a little flavorless. I suppose if you are vegan, gluten free, and trying to avoid sugar it's the only option but the flavor was really lacking without sugar. I bought a few cupcakes because I can't eat gluten, and didn't finish one of them.

I would say just make your own and leave out the ingredients that you don't want.

This pains me. After a long day of running around, my husband and I just wanted to grab a quick bite before going home. I make it a point to patronize local businesses and we chose Coach's. That was apparently our first mistake and it only got worse. We came in the side door to see a busy bar area; the bartender looked at us, said nothing and went back to her bar customers. Apparently, a server had to be called in, but after 15 minutes of being totally ignored, we were getting ready to walk out. When the new server finally made her way over to us, she was friendly but didn't apologize for the lousy service. She took our drink orders before dashing away again, and came back with them 10 minutes later. At that time, we ordered. I got wings and my husband a patty melt or something along those lines. During the 45 minutes, yes 45, we waited for our food, my husbands beer had been gone to 25 with no offer of refill. When the food arrived, it wasn't worth bothering with. Sloppily thrown together and not at all hot. The wings I got were of very poor quality. Many broken bones, and had an old taste to them. Sauce was flavorless. The blue cheese dressing was good tho. After we had been served, a couple of nice looking guys came in and sat next to us. The bartender (female) who had completely ignored us made a beeline for them. Was so friendly and chatty with them, but never once looked our way. I guess we aren't the "right" clientele. I guess Coach's 2 has enough business that they don't need ours, because we won't be back.

Terrible service, we were asked multiple times to move and ended up at a high top even though they claim you can sit where you like. Drinks went empty multiple times. The Pulled pork looked and tasted like it was just scooped out of a can. The onion rings were fantastic though and as usual the music was top notch

lots o' dirty dykes upstairs on a saturday night.

good tunes to dance your sweaty arse to.

tight like a swollen foot stomping about all day in a leather boot.

Only one size coffee.  I don't drink the fancy drinks, just coffee, and i like a large cup.  It's the tiniest cup of coffee and I wasn't impressed with the flavor either.  The lighting is dull and so is the decor.  I probably won't ever go back.   There's so many other places to choose from. 
The guy working behind the counter was super nice, good service!  He saved my my rating from a one star to 3 stars.  Good job guy!

Summer was amazing as a bartender and it was Spring! She was attentive and  fast paced. She took care of me and my friend as well as everyone at the bar. She accommodated everyone's requests for TV channels. 10/10 would Come back if Summer was the bartender.

The foot is unique and affordable. Yatz is one of the most culturally unique places in Indianapolis. The food is simple incredible. I've probably eatten there over 30 times total; I have to say the crawfish etouffee and the white chicken chili are their best eats.

I really enjoyed Noboru a lot as they had some things I never had before both for sushi and some of the other specialties liked hot pot and shabu shabu which were great. Like Minado, it is not for everyone but it is nice to have this one even closer to home to satisfy my sushi fix!

Best Puertorrican food in Tampa. Very authentic. 5 stars are for the food. However, the service can be very slow at times. I highly recommend "mofongo de biftec."  It is fantastic. The red snapper "chillo" is excellent as well. For churrasco I would go else where.

Amazing!!!!  Great pizza done right. It is true deep dish. A fun selection of craft beers in cans and on draft. I highly suggest this place. Just keep in mind that a proper deep dish takes 45 minutes to cook. Eric the bartender is great.

Big selection of fresh food and healthy vitamin products that are hard to find in other places. Parking is easy and the staff members are very helpful - the prices are obviously much higher than other places. My guess is since it's part quality part wanting a higher middle class folks as their clientele.

After losing our local German food restaurant we searched for another and Brummis was the answer!!! Very friendly service, delicious food, it was all that we wanted and more. If the owner offers advice, take it. She was spot on. Super sausages, speatzle, German potato salad, sauerbraten. Our family will return, worth the drive to SB!

The staff of this Hotel is extremely arrogant. My room was not ready on time they told me they would call me, they never did. They seem happy to have transient business ,rather than repeat customers. My reservations at the the buffet were not honored as well. It was a  very  poor experience. I will not return to this establishment!

This is perhaps less to do with the general decor as with the premise of the place itself (pun intended). It looks a little bit rundown, but the staff are absolutely lovely, the people seem happy there, and you can get lost for hours (for a flat rate! yes! it's real!) in hard to find, unique board games. This place just makes me really really happy. Come here if you want to be happy.

The cruise was so stressful from a week to sailing and it continued up to the very end. Lots of miscommunication and misleading information given. The customer service representative was rude after spending hours upon hours trying to get things fixed and be able to relax. To go to the keyos and then check the hub app to find out what you just thought you have fixed and took hours of waiting in line to NOT be fixed was very upsetting.

My last time using this location! Ordered at 5:54pm and my order was suppose to be delivered at 6:24pm. By 6:30pm I was concerned but was still trying to be patient. By 6:45pm I started calling but they never answered the phone. When they did answer the phone they never said hello but laid the phone down and I could hear all going on in the store including the man stating he called but no one answered and then placed his order. I received my order at 7:20pm. The delivery guy didn't thank me, give a reason why it took so long or give me a copy of my receipt. Both pizzas were barely warm and the wings were cold and I had to warm them. I truly do not recommend this location. It seems the employees don't care about quality and the company is not concerned with improving this location. The Bridgeton location is much better.

Had a wonderful time at the Country music hall of fame. Got to see 2 Floors of memorabilia from the famous country stars. We also took a ride to the recording studio that Elvis recorded in. It was a wonderful experience for us since we are not a country couple but enjoy the musical experience

I usually hate chains. I usually make fun of people who frequent chains-with the exception of Maggiano's (and PF Changs). The food is good, I hate to admit it. It's not THE best Italian I've ever had, but it's pretty darn good. I've never, ever had a bad meal here, and I've eaten at many Maggiano's-Philly, Atlanta, DC. Sometimes it's loud, and sometimes you have to wait for a table, but the food is solid.

I've been coming here since the day it opened in 2012 and mostly loved it because it was quality food delivered fast. Usually the Crispy Chicken sandwich is a perfectly sized chicken breast although lately I've been receiving a pounded out thin chicken patty instead.  Either the crispy chicken sandwich is getting smaller or there's more of an inconsistency with it.  Wish I would've taken a pic of the 1/8" pounded out patty with 1/4" of breading. So is PDQ becoming just another fast food restaurant? Hope not but will give it one more try before making my way back to Chick-fil-a.

This place is awesome!!!! There are consoles set up for free game play to break up the spending on machines. Most games are 25 cents! Felt like a kid again- except for the part where I was drinking really awesome craft beers! Great beer selection. Cool people. Awesome bar Staff!!!

This is an amazing place to stay. Literally right on Frenchmen street for nightly live music and partying. The rooms are very large and comfortable with TV's in both the living room and bedroom. I still cannot believe how quiet the toilet is flushing, lol. We had room 406 with 4 air conditioners right outside the bedroom window, no problem with noise. The parking situation is the best kept secret in NOLA. $20 a day with unlimited access and exit. The staff was exceptional and helpful with any questions about the local area and shops. If we ever come back down we will definitely stay here again. The main hotel is gorgeous but I cannot give any info on the rooms there. P.S. try the duck sausage at Dat Dogs down on the corner.

Was recommended this place by a hotel employee while visiting Philly on my last day of the trip.  First thing I noticed was how quiet it was.  There were a few others dining there but the music was very low, which kind of made the vibe uncomfortable.  Our waiter (I think his name was David) hovered way too much for my liking as if we were a nuisance.  I ordered the lamb sliders and mac and cheese.  They were both delicious and cooked to perfection.  Once the bill arrived it was combined for me friend and I.  (why do restaurants assume to female friends who are dining wouldnt be paying separately?)  Anywho, I asked, can you separate the bills.  To which David replied I can do it myself and itemize the bill and list which card was paying for which, this REALLY ticked me off.  So as I sat there trying to separate each of our orders, drinks and taxes he literally stood over my should, not to offer any assistance but to rush me.  We felt like we were intruding just by dining there.  Plus side, is there were great picture ops on the deck.IF I return when visiting Philly again, I'd definitely ask for a different waiter.

I called in a phone order, pepper roasted turkey sandwich, (no extras)and small Greek salad. Lots of confusion ordering on the phone. My bill was $20. I was  expecting alot,  I'm a big  eater and I  was very  hungry. Very disappointing after eating my sandwich, not full. The salad was so light and small, I grilled up my own  shrimp and threw it in. I looked at my receipt and gave them a call thinking their must have  been  a mistake.  The woman on the  phone  said yes,  she was sorry they did over charge me. She said next time  I come, ask for her and she  will  make  up for it. I have no idea who she was. There is nothing organic and they are not gmo conscious. Very pricey for what you get. I will never go back and I live right  down  the street.

Had the grouper with veggie sauce and itwas one of the best fish dishes I have ever had. The ceviche was fresh and a unique presentation I would go back just for that. The margaritas were top shelf and a problem, good enough my wife drove us home
Love this place! Great options for those watching what they eat and those who don't need to.
Stopped in to get some sandwiches for our day at the lake. Fair service and the sandwiches were a bit "skimpy". Probably give one more chance.

Moved to this side of town from the SW side. Was very happy to discover Kona Gold has excellent coffee and reasonably priced  tasty meals. Breakfast is served all day. I've been in several times and it's been consistently good. Parking is plentiful.
I had the crab rangoon , Tom kha and vegetable stir fry all were amazing and the online ordering was very user friendly will definitely be ordering again!

Strolling down Walnut & Rittenhouse, I ventured in here. Wow what a decor!!!  windows and decor great, stripes & a flash of pink. Very preppy, but little cute with colors & sharp defined cuts in blazers & coats.
     The Women 's were located like 2 flights of steps!! Holy moly!! Don't have knee problems, or issues. Won't be able to go up or down. Love some of the pieces, like polka dot formal dress, & blazers. Shirts to lingerie were very nice. Though i didn't purchase anything . Loved the decor, near the top floor, had a tub with legs sticking out, long socks on mannequins legs, I thought great idea as a display. Sorry, come from Fashion & Visual display background!!.

Definitely come back get couple pieces here & there. Good quality.

Hands down my favorite pub! great bartenders, amazing beers every time, great atmosphere, shuffleboard, and an awesome location. Plus right next door to Reef sushi and Campo which are two other favorites of mine.

What initially was a pleasant experience turned out to be a horrible revealing of a scam!

I am moving out with my girlfriend and this was our first mattress buying experience. We were a little nervous and didn't know what to expect. 

Our sales associate was named Joe.

He was helpful in letting us try different beds and we found one that was "On sale". It was a Simmons Recharge mattress. Sensing how green we were, Joe talked us up and threw in a "free" basic bed frame and charged an additional $50 for a mattress protector. Not knowing what to expect, we thought we were getting a good deal. BOY WE WERE WRONG!

The Product:
The full sized mattress "On Sale" was $950.00 but only worth about $500 online.
The mattress protector was $50 but only worth about $20 online.
The box spring was given "free" but is of poor quality. The center leg is loose and the frame is not sturdy. The weak frame makes noise with the slightest movement on the bed.
Basic box frame.
The delivery charge was $99.00 and was a whole other story in itself.

Delivery:
The delivery guys came at the end of a 4 hour window. If we would have known this, we wouldn't have to wait around for half a day wasting our time. 
Once they came, they didn't show any form of identification. The only reason we assumed they worked for Sleepy's was becuase of the Sleepy's truck. We were reluctant to let them enter our home, however what choice do we have while waiting for our $1,000 bed?!
Without saying much, the delivery men promptly setup the mattress, box frame, and bed frame.
We asked if we could thoroughly inspect everything before they left. This is an IMPORANT step becuase any little tear or stain will VOID the proclaimed "worry free warranty". The delivery men were confused and didn't understand our request. They eventually said "okay" but made us feel like we were wasting their time.

The delivery men also gave us the cheap mattress liner Joe up sold us on. As they delivery men were leaving, my girlfriend promptly puts the liner in the washing machine thinking we were done with the ordeal. 10 minutes later, we get a phone call from the delivery men. They told us they gave us the WRONG mattress liner! We told them we already opened and put it into the washing machine. Their response was "Why didn't you check before opening it? Can you quickly put it in the dryer? We will be back". Dumbfounded and insulted by their response, we angrily put it in the dryer. The men came back in 20 minutes but the mattress cover was not yet dry. The delivery men gave us an attitude as if this was OUR fault. We told them to come back in 30 minutes. They had no choice and said "okay". We called them in 30 minutes and they told US TO WAIT FOR THEM! We already waited all day for the mattress! What the Hell were these guys thinking?! They insisted they were on the way back however, they didn't arrive for another HOUR! Once they arrived they gave us the mattress liner and put the other one back in the BAG! No apology and no compensation was given for our wasted time. I feel sorry for the next customer who they delivered that too, as the product is no longer NEW. The delivery was a nightmare and THEY COMPLETELY wasted our time.

Disgusted with the experience so far, We went to a local sleepy's were we returned the mattress liner and got our $50.00 back, or so we thought.

Joe gave us a follow up call later that evening. We explained our experience and he stated that he would issue a refund for the delivery. We also told him we returned the mattress liner. As a promise of good faith, Joe said he would send us one for free because he "wanted us to have one".

Fast forward 1 week, and have have no refund and no mattress liner. We called Joe back and he said the refund was NEVER Processed. We were FURIOUS! We could not understand why it was not immediately refunded when we returned the merchandise at the sleepy's store! Joe had a heated argument with my girlfriend and said "You are getting upset over $50.00". We have every right to be upset even if it was over 1 cent! 2 days later, the refunds were processed however, no mattress liner was ever sent. We don't expect Joe to ever send one now.

Sleepy's is a rip off company with scam sales associates that treat you like they are selling used cars. The delivery service is completely unprofessional. They DO NOT process returns in a timely manner even when you give them their merchandise back. God forbid we ever have to call them again for warranty concerns or other issues. We will NEVER DO business with them again, and I will make sure everyone and the internet knows not to as well.

Cafe at the back.  Really good tacos.  They have adobo, chorizo, lengua and even intestine which is really good but your breath will be awlful (so not good for date or business lunch haha).  Cheaper than even the taco truck but better quality.

Also, oxtails and Flankencut shortribs (think Korean bbq cut rather than stewed shortrib cut) here are about a dollar less per pound than other places like Fred Meyers but equally as good.

One more thing, there is a guy out front who sells homemade tamales 1.25 each (6 or more for 1.00 each) [ pork, chicken or cheese].  Really good. Great for lunches.
Visiting NOLA and needed my yoga. Great place, friendly, good space and ambiance. Will return!

Great location, I felt secure staying here by myself. At some point in the night they lock the front doors so the receptionist has to let you in. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. Breakfast is included which after a night rocking at a concert is perfect.

Amazing prices, and the best part is all the money goes to the horses which are all rescued! So the tour guides work for tips. We had josh and he was awesome. Super friendly, talkative and made sure everyone was having fun. 
  My husband and I came here on our honeymoon and we had two more strangers go with us on our tour. One of them was a little girl and they made sure she felt super comfortable too. Recommend for kids! :)

This was a very informational tour. I would recommend  taking this tour at the beginning of your vacation to get an idea what you want to visit in New Orleans. We had Lee as our tour guIde. He was very knowledgeable and excellent historian. The tour company was very accommodating and a great deal.

My oil tank was at half so I figured I'd get it topped off before the winter season kicks off. I called on a Friday night and the woman on the phone said probably Monday for a delivery. I told her no big deal whenever they get a chance. I'm lying in bed watching TV and I hear a truck coming up the street, and its my oil delivery at 10:30 pm. Even though some may see this as not a big deal I see it as a huge deal as they deal with their customers and deliver when they say they will. Great job guys! Great service!!

Car: 97 Geo Prizm  130,000 

Tim was an awesome guy and he truly made me feel comfortable as far as customer service gos. They had hot coffee and a good sitting area.  Plus they take you home if you dont want to wait it out. 

As for the price in maintenance service, I think it's still a little steep.  Had a valve gasket replaced and a simple diagnostic check (engine light came on) for a whopping $275. Most of that which was cost in labor.  Went home kicking myself knowing I could have done the work at home for a hell of a lot cheaper.  Of course after watching a few YouTube videos for difficulty level. They also recommended a Tune-up for a cost of $363.90.  Ugh no thank you.  Found all my part on Rockauto for $54.00.  Doing this one myself. Oh well, you live and you learn I guess.

$30 an hour is highway robbery
Won't be back till they get their prices under control

The Deli Manager; Annette Whyte is Terrible.  She refused to make me (A Customer) a Sub, while she was working at the Sub-area, Twice.  First time she made a Racist remark; I am white and Male, and she isn't, then after I complained, I came in the 2nd time after a Month, and asked again; and once again she refused to do her job.
When I complained to the Store Mgr; Jennifer Kras; she basically went into Denial; and tried every excuse in the Book to not discipline her employee. 
I went online and read the Complaints at Consumer Affairs Website; and there are 196 Complaints about Publix Super Markets.
To me that is way too much, and a lot were like mine; I guess Mgt doesn't mind if their Employees Discriminate against Customers.
There Prices are way TOO HIGH anyway, I can SPEND My Money where I am Appreciated as a Customer.

I wanted to like Ahi Sushi Bar, I really did!  A friend of mine is a server here and always boasts about how great it is.  I was excited but skeptical at the idea of sushi in Idaho so I told her I'd give it a try the next time I am in town.  

I went in today for lunch.  We were the only ones there at first and then the stampede showed up!  The one waitress working had to juggle ten tables by the time we were finished with our meal.

We had edamame for a starter.  It was very good but had a lot of salt on it.  Not a good choice for those watching their salt intake.  I ordered a California roll fried and my co-diner had a Winding Creek Roll.  I was a little bummed that mine didn't have any sauce on it and I kept using the sauce off the Winding Creek roll.  The food was alright overall, but not the best I've had.

The reason I'm giving this such a low rating is because I got food poisoning.  About 20 minutes after eating there, I started getting symptoms of food poisoning.  Fortunately the illness only lasted about 5 hours, but let me just say that the Cali roll didn't taste that great the second time around.  I didn't even have sashimi, so I'm not sure what caused this.

In on business so I stopped in cause it's near by. Walked an was confused on where to go and what to do no one was there to greet me so I sat at the bar. It is Monday night, but there wasn't really anyone there and a couple of dirty tables that were never cleaned, even before I left. Food was adequate, could be much better if the chef cared about the plates before they went out of the kitchen. Wont be going back. Waitress/ bartender was very nice.

This was an awesome dinning experience!  Great entertainment, great drinks, great food excellent server Georgette (Gigi). Beautiful sunset!  Fun and a lot of energy, great vibe. We will be back!
Also, the best Reservation system!

Bike shop is simple the best! 
Always have the parts I need!

The best authentic local tacos I've had in the area. I've been searching far and wide. I tried this place on recommendation from a friend after moving form the city to within 15 mins or so and it did not disappoint. The search is over. If you want great authentic tacos, come here. 

Los mejores tacos locales autnticos que he tenido en la zona. He estado buscando por todas partes. Prob este lugar por recomendacin de un amigo despus de mudarme de la ciudad a 15 minutos o as y no me decepcion. La busqueda se acab. Si quieres tacos autnticos geniales, ven aqu.

My wife and I recently were in New Orleans looking for a vegan restaurant for lunch.  Found Sweet Soulfood on Yelp, and were very impressed by the 110 reviews, all of which gave five out of five stars.  Could this place be that good?

It was.  A daily-changing menu, served cafeteria-style of some of the best-tasting, nutritious selections we have ever found.  And you can get four entrees, generous portions, for only $11.95.  We will definitely return next time we're in New Orleans.

It's literally hard to believe how good this place is. The wait for a table will tell you because it's not short, but the hostess manages it with skill.  The service alone is worth five stars and I will tell you why. We encountered a rude bartender who was openly upset, declaring he was aggravated that they were so busy.  He was rude to my sister in law who's birthday we were celebrating.  A problem seems to bring the best out of these people, the manager and the owner were the most engaged and professional we have ever seen. My brother is a chef at a resort (we will not name here) and he was the most impressed in our party.  But on par with the incredible service was the food. Everything our table received was exceptional. The omelettes are perfect. We had one of each between us. The savory breakfast bowl was very impressive, a great combination of ingredients and well executed. We will be back. And we will be sending a lot of people in the meantime, you can count on both.

Warning, I am all over the place with my review of Pub and Kitchen. I have to say we had wonderful service but it was an extremely loud restaurant and at times impossible to communicate with her.  We made a mistake by bringing my mother who is in her mid 70's for dinner.  What was I thinking?! In my defense, the last time I had been to P&K was over an early weekend lunch and it was really quiet. If there is a next time I'll sit in the back room and perhaps leave her at home.  
     As far as the food my review is mixed. The menu didn't seem to offer enough standard pub fare or traditional dinner plates. Our server was friendly and upbeat and pretty darn quick considering that the restaurant was jam packed this early Saturday evening. Our table shared very creamy yummy deviled eggs. The eggs were fairly standard but didn't last long to really mull over their merits.  I had AMISH CHICKEN with a savoy cabbage roll and butternut squash.  I was really looking forward to it because it was highly recommended on other reviews. Unfortunately this was not a wow dish for me. Our server said that it was a half of a chicken but it just didn't seem to pan out The piece of chicken was underwhelming what. The stuffed cabbage was odd and all in all the plate was one dimensional. The menu for dinner was fairly limited and I wish they had a few more items to choose from Igather that The kitchen must be small. I will say, one of my dinner partners had the cheese and charcuterie platter. That looked  delicious. The onion dip by standard, the waffle chips were addictive! 
So in conclusion if you're bringing granny out perhaps choose a different spot for dinner.  I personally would recommend sticking to the pub like food... snacks, chicken wings, dips and for sure the  waffle chips! If you are adverse to loud restaurant dinners just go for drinks.

I ordered takeout pho, curry chicken, and pad kee mao. Everything was delicious, packaged nicely, and food came out pretty quickly. Prices were reasonable as well. Will definitely visit and dine in next time.

Yes, I would say as good as it gets. I just got my new pair of glasses. They're actually working nicely. I saw Optometrist inside COSTCO and got glasses from COSTCO vision. I say that because last time when I got glasses from COSTCO in WA, the pair gave me headache so I couldn't wear them at all. Dr Joseph LaPlaca was excellent, patient, honest and nice. All staff at vision center were great like Alex and Jason.

Check out stand staffs were fun to make small talk and very friendly. The store is clean and well maintained. 
For the price? Well, when most of the items are great price and cheaper than any other place, some are more expensive than Meijer or Walmart. So you do your homework before shopping at COSTCO, but overall 5 star for this COSTCO!

The food here is absolutely delicious. I've never had a bad dish. However, I struggle with returning here because of the continued rudeness of some of the staff. The fact that they no longer accept credit cards is also a reason to try to find another establishment to patronize.

The food is always great.  I don't live in Indianapolis any more but I used to try to make visiting a priority.  


BUT 

For every second you'll enjoy eating delicious food,  you will spend FREEZING your behind off.  And I know what you're thinking, "just wear a jacket."  Nah bruh.  This is cold-cold.  It's summer outside but dead of winter inside.  

I'm still going to come back but even if it's 90 outside, I'm going to be wearing a hoodie and some jeans.

Outstanding authentic Puerto Rican food. They recently opened this location and like with any other business has had some bumps. Service can be a bit slow. But if you're patient you'll enjoy the ambiance, the live music and the excellent food. I'll be back.

If you like having to argue for some basic amenities at a restaurant, in this case food, then this place is for you. If like the rest of us, you enjoy timely, courteous, judgement free service, take your business elsewhere. 

1. We ordered four orders of the feta dip (which to their credit was actually divine) for a group of 14 and were given a total of FIVE tiny pita pockets. When we asked our waitress for more pita, we were told to peel  the pita in half for more. Lady, we know what a godamn pita pocket is. We aren't rationing for a flood or in prison. Bring us more pita. After initial reluctance, the wait staff brought us only TWO more pieces of pita for a table of FOURTEEN. We again requested more so there could be enough for everyone at the table but we were asked why we needed more since we were still ordering entrees. Is there a pita shortage in Nashville that I wasn't aware of? Is there a reason why a "Yes we can bring you enough but it might charge extra?" was so hard to do? AND THEN, at the end of our meal when we declined dessert, the waitress responded with "I figured you were full from all that pita." Long story short, if you want to save yourself the investigation by the wait staff about why you would like enough food for everyone, bring your own pita. 

2. Service was excruciatingly slow. If you want ketchup with your burger and fries, then too bad because you'll only get it after you've eaten all your food. You also may be asked to provide a PHD caliber defense for why you need extra ketchup. 

3. The waitress explained that everything on the menu was meant to be shared. We found this strange considering everything on the brunch menu was mostly sandwiches, but figured we would wait and see. When the chicken biscuit came out in a portion fit for a developing fetus, we really had to wonder if this was a restaurant or a fat camp. 

4. We had to put down a deposit of $10 per person for the reservation. The restaurant charged us anyway even though we all arrived on time and when asked to apply this charged portion to the final bill, it took two conversations with the inapprpriate, winking manager to settle the dispute. 

Bottom line, don't bother coming here unless you want to be volunteered as tribute into the real life hunger games.

Cool spot.  Upstairs makes a concerted effort to have music every night, and there were many fly couples of all ages/orientation cutting it up on dance floor.  My pork chops was the ish.  I'd go again homie.

In town for a convention... this place was close to the hotel.
This place has a smoky atmosphere, it's that simple. Choose wisely.....

Wife had a mushroom/Swiss burger .... nothing special just a burger .... 

I had the patty melt... was pretty good... good rye bread it was on ... 

Got fried pickles... sent them back ... way to salty... our waitress ( Keisha ) who was terrific. said she would get the kitchen to try again. She did warn us that they are prepackaged so the outcome was probably going to be the same. 
Some other waitress brought them out and told us that since they had bread everything in the back.... that she had them wash all the pickles and rebread them .( now I'm confused) 
Pickles were just as bad the second time. 
My guess is Keisha was right ... 
so with a full basket of pickles still on the table .... they brought the check with the pickles still on it and the drinks taken off..... 
Keisha if your reading this .... you are way better than this place ... run away .... go to a classier place ... 
it gets a 2 star for the rye bread and iced tea

This place is very unique to the area. For every holiday they are decorated to the tenth degree and it always looks great. They have a lot of cool and unique merchandise, aside from the plants and flowers they sell. Around Halloween they have a mini petting zoo on their grounds, again which you would never see anywhere else in this area. Even if you don't buy anything check this place out.

First time. In Missouri to watch our son play college baseball. Here from California where there is plenty of bbq. We've been to KC and other places in STL. Bogarts is by far the best. Great service. Fast and friendly. Everything was great. Ribs and burnt ends the best. Deviled egg salad, beans, pickles, cole slaw and brisket. All of it outstanding. We had a perfect day to sit outside but there was seating inside. But we would go again if we had to sit in the car. A must go if in town. Thanks

The hand made tortillas were enough to make me love this place. The menu is a little disorienting at first but it breaks down into plain meat tacos, meat and cheese quesadilla, and tamales. The meat was wonderful. The steak was super tender and flavorful. The pork was a little fatty, bit worth I for the flavor. My favorite was the melted cheese. It was more sharp than a traditional queso fresco, an really made them stand out above the plain tacos. There are definitely no frills at this place. Old school, but being done right.

This is the most delightful place to get a handcrafted work of art. Hands down, every time I'm here the staff is engaging and the quality is superb. Their nitro cold brew is my favorite, you have to go early on the weekends to get some though. If you're in the area you must stop in!

As good as it gets for a 10$ mexican street food dinner
Try the shrimp quesadilla!!!
And they serve Pacifico any time
A must do in Sta Barbara for Mexican foodies

Yes, they're in a mall foodcourt, but they're friggin' delicious!

I tried a sample and as a result the sample guy gave me a coupon. It was for a Chicken California with fries and a drink for $5.99. I jumped right on it.

They cook the meat right in front of you and still manage to get sandwiches out quick. My Chicken California was so good I actually made sure to eat it slowly and enjoy it. Chicken, provolone cheese, ranch, and other fixin's... I'm drooling just recalling the memory.

I saved almost 70% for lunch that day (I had been on my way to another restaurant for a $15.00 entree...must've been thinking with my stomach)!

Food and drink was amazing! Only took off a star because it took a little while to get my food.  Ate the breakfast sandwich and it was very good. Rosemary sourdough bread was delicious! I'll definitely be back but just be prepared to wait a couple minutes for food. Nothing crazy but don't be in too much of a hurry.
Dr Nguyen is very down to earth and intelligent.  He was patient and answered all of  my questions. The staff and the nurse is very kind and accommodating.  I was able to be seen in a timely manner.

Let me preface this review by saying The Grill has always been one of my favorite Reno restaurants. Good food, nice atmosphere, and( usually) friendly, helpful service. Scott, the bartender that served us on Aug 4th has changed  the latter part of that statement. Never, ever have I experienced such rude, almost threatening behavior from any server, anywhere. He was obnoxious the minute we sat down, made rude remarks under his breath and generally treated us as if we were a HUGE inconvience just by being there.He actually became very aggressive when I had the audacity to ask for the bill. Sam Frankovich needs to remove this guy promptly before he has a lawsuit on his hands. So no matter how good the food is, if I ever see this guy behind the bar (or anywhere else) I will leave.

Very cool new men's clothing that's hard to find everywhere else. If I were a dude I would shop here. I didn't buy anything. Wasn't impressed with selection of women's clothing. Lots of things that look like they were bought from local artists like jewelry, and such but nothing cool enough to make me spend the money, I liked their upcycled Louis Vuitton bags which I've seen on eBay...they have no vintage clothing which was what I was looking for. Cool looking shop and great store for gifts. It's like an upscale urban outfitters almost, and actually located next to one.

Nice place. Lots of TVs to see the games. Can be loud at times but it's a sports bar. The boneless wings are excellent. The Post its are good. We had the pepperoni post its. Basically a pepperoni and cheese quesadilla using thin pizza dough (I think). Big beer selection.

Finally, a new vegetarian with a vegan tendency....  I am not vegetarian, but dating one.  I went there on a date and had a good time.  Food was good and creative, service friendly; love their juice with a kick of ginger, gives it a nice aftertaste.  The chocolate cake was a little too good; I never want to order that again because I finished it.
Hope they keep it up when it gets crowded.

When I'm in Santa Barbara, this is my favorite place to let happy hour roll right into evening.  My friends and I go sit around the fire pit on the patio in the afternoon, drink 2 for 1 margaritas and eat the half off appetizers during happy hour.  I recommend the sampler platter, it never gets old!  Before we know it, it's always later than we think and sometimes there's live music or else a DJ and dance music gets going.  The club scene has never really been my thing, but at Sandbar I seem to always have a great time.  There's always fun people to meet and you can have a great time whether or not you like to dance.  I couple times I've been when they had a mechanical bull, we've got some hilarious stories from bull nights!  I wish they would have that bull more often...

I love to start my day with a good breakfast! I've been following these guys on Instagram and they make me so hungry with their photos! My husband I am we're close to them so we decided to have a quick breakfast. 

The Place:
They are located in front of David's Bridal, in a cute little building. It looks really traditional and old school. Yet really adorable and you had the feeling of comfort food. 

The Food:
Food was traditional breakfast and lunches, with great selection of Mimosas, unfortunately it was a week day so no fun Brunch, just breakfast :(
I got some coffee and water while looking at the menu. 
I ordered some "Traditional pancakes" and a side of scramble eggs- they were really yummy and fluffy. The eggs were amazing! They had a great taste, like if they just pick them up from the farm earlier in the morning (seriously!)
My husband got the "Eggs Benedicts" with hash browns- i stole half of his hash browns and they were so yummy! 

The Service:
The service was great, the food came out fast and we had breakfast in like 30 minutes which was what we were looking for. 

Overall: 4 Stars (Salmita's Scale) I still want to come back and eat with more time, try more meals and their mimosas of course! ;-)
A larger store than expected and in a central location at the mall (though parking can be a challenge at times).  Good selection and helpful staff (typical for most RH stores).
This place has great food. Been for both brunch and dinner. Cool atmosphere as well. A little bit pricey but worth it from time to time.

We came here after we didn't find a table at Asuka, and boy, I'm so glad we stopped by. Compared to h long lines at Asuka, this one was rather empty for a Friday night. We were a little concerned, but it was short lived: the service was friendly, and the food excellent. We ordered some miso soup and chicken satay as appetizers and three of their "raw" rolls (I wish I remembered the names). My husband doesn't eat tobico, so they served it on the side. The best roll of the night was a baked roll with scallops. Can't wait to visit again.

I don't even know where to begin this meal was so good.

I will start off with the calamari since it was the first item I tasted. By far it was the best I have ever had. Often times I am disappointed with calamari because it's just fried nothing. This was the complete opposite.

For my main course I had a special which was an 18 oz. Delmonico cut ribeye. It was life changing. I didn't speak to anyone while eating it because I was savoring it so intensely. 

The service was top notch. I will be back soon.
Great upscale food with downscale prices in a quaint Italian Market location.  Have to try some of the cocktails next time we are there which I hope will be very soon.

The service here was very poor. The woman at the register was rude, and the order was incorrect.  I visited 2 different times, and had the same bad service. The two guys that prepared the food were great though.  Would go elsewhere next time.

This place was outrageous in the best way possible. The cinnamon roll French toast.... lord help me. Definitely do get it with the whipped cream. The eggs in a pan is enough to split with another person. Awesome dish. Great place!

The tour guide was great! He has been a local to the area all of his life. He had nicknames for the gators, and knew the best spots to find them. He was very knowledgeable about the animals in the area as well as the plants. I learned a lot, but not in a boring way! Also, he shared a couple photo albums with us showing all his catches throughout the course of his lifetime. So cool to look at and felt very personal as well. Definitely recommend! But consider bringing a jacket as it can get chilly out on the water!

I go thru the drive thru every morning to get a cup of coffee... when i got to the window,  the cashier asked if i wanted decaf... i said no.... she shut the window and i watched another employee fill the cup with decaf and then top off with the last bit of regular... she brought me the cup and i asked why it was decaf... she said it wasn't.. i told her i saw the other employee.. she said...oh... i demanded my money back... she took the cup back and brought me my money... i will never go there again,  for any reason.
Upscale with relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Delicious cocktails and bar snacks.  Returned several times while visiting New Orleans.
My family and I went to Jack's on Friday morning and we enjoyed it for our first time! But later my husband's stomach didn't like his French toast meal! But everyone else loved it

Salon 3 East is the best in the business. Tiffany has been coloring and cutting my hair for over 10 years and I won't go anywhere else!! I recently moved to NYC and travel back monthly so she can work her magic. She's consistent, nice and an awesome person to talk to. HIGHLY recommend.

Definitely a cool spot! Service was great and my food came out quick. I got the Chicken Satay salad. It was fair. I think this place is better for sandwiches. The didn't seem fresh and there wasn't enough dressing on the salad. It also tasted like they used bottled peanut sauce on the chicken. I am definitely going to return to this place because it was extremely busy, so I know the menu has good items. Gonna stick to the sandwiches next time though.

I picked Fonda Nails today because of all great reviews here. I am happy to say I was not disappointed! I was a walk in and they were able to accommodate me as Fonda has hired a couple of technicians she is training. (I would probably call next time to make sure they can take me) Alex, the nail artist who started my Premier Pedicure, first offered me something to drink and then started my pedicure. He was very thorough with getting my toes cleaned up, scrubbing and massaging. Fonda took over and put on the color and cleaned up a little more. I appreciate that it is her name above the door and she wants to make sure everything is done to her specifications. I LOVE the outcome and the color (Terra Cotta and I think number 425)
This salon is extremely clean and has a huge assortment of colors to choose from. I feel they are fairly priced and there is still free parking on that part of Central Ave so that's always a good thing. 
I also enjoyed talking to Danny who was there lending support and customer interaction. :) 
A very enjoyable experience and I will definitely be a repeat customer!
I ordered cupcakes for my daughter at UCSB!  Fantastic cupcakes and great delivery!

I am not one to write reviews, but I felt compelled due to the excellent work that was done on my bag. Small shop but very professional with EXCELLENT work. I took my Louis Vuitton bag here for repair as my strap broke. The work was superb I can't even tell which side he repaired and where the repair was done. The straps look identical. The cost was also reasonable. HIGHLY Recommend if you need work done on your bags or shoes. Will be back in the future even though Iive 30 minutes away, worth the drive.

Went here when we were in the area looking for a place I haven't been to.  A good stop it was.  It was a late lunchtime on a weekday so it was empty but that fared well for us because service was a-one.

Many interesting items on the menu you don't normally see.  Surprisingly, there were a house special wings that I have never heard of.  Mambo wings.  Had to have them.  Not glad I did.  I liken them to crack or heroin.  If you never try it, you won't ever crave it.  I am a pushover for wing recipes I haven't had and I never heard of Mambo wings so I had to get them.  Now, I crave them daily.  

Waiter said they got the recipe from D.C.  Now I research them and they have been around a long time there although more often called Mumbo wings.  Mumbo sauce is apparently common in chinese take out joints in D.C. but has a large wing following.  Enough that there are Mumbo wing restaurants.  I have been a wing-head ever since they first came to this area with Hooters, Melons, Mugs N' Jugs and mostly because I lived across the street from Knockers (where the original Winghouse is now).  That was around 1989.  27 years of wings and I have not heard of Mumbo wings.  Damn you to hell 1933 Pub & Grill.

Not sold in Walmart.  Not in Publix.  Not in Winn-Dixie.  I must make the trek to 1933 or suffer the consequences of $15 per bottle on Amazon or Walmart.com.  This may be my last review as I may be broke soon due to the scarcity of Mumbo sauce in this area.

My home church in the heart of downtown Tampa.  I love Sacred Heart so much and yes, I'm biased because this is where my husband and I attend mass and where I had my confirmation and where we got married. So many memories here and hopefully many more in the future. 

I'll start by just how beautiful this church is which really goes without saying to anyone who's visited. I feel at peace and so welcome here by the staff and fellow parishioners. I could stare at the ambiance all day. The stained glass windows and the gold trimming details , the marble pillars, I feel like I'm in a huge cathedral. Oh and the musicians and choir are outstanding. 

I have to give a special shout out to my Fav Friar, Fr. Zachary Elliott, OFM. He is so wonderful! He worked with me during my confirmation and also with all of the steps I needed to take before getting married. He is extremely kind, caring, and he made the process fun! I received so many praises about him after my wedding ceremony and he even was so kind to attend our reception and deliver our prayer before dinner.

This place is now called Dany's Diner, Bar, and Grill.  It looks the same inside as before.  The sign has now changed.  But the food quality has plunged dramatically.  

I had the breakfast wrap my last trip there.  Absolutely no flavor in the eggs and veggies, no cheese which is a cardinal sin in my book, soggy tortilla wrap, and too much grease in the hash browns.  

New owners, this place needs serious work!  You just went from OK to BLEECH!

I would write more, but "BLEECH" seems to be so much more effective.

The food was great! In town visiting from Houston and Me and the family was looking for somewhere to eat.  We stopped in and tasted the Jerk Chicken and had to get a plate.  The food tasted like your Grandma made it!
Thank you for the amazing cake, my mom was thrilled and really liked how elegant it came out. The German chocolate was delicious.

Due to my extensive travel history, I have built a very strong and picky tongue for authenticity. That being said, I can tell you Casablanca is the real damn deal. I'm about to tell you why. 

The entire menu at Casablanca is filled with what you'd find at a typical restaurant in Havana. I recognized many dishes that I've dined on and they were all delicious, so it was hard for me to make a decision. During my first visit I bellied up to the world-famous Sandwich Cubano (roasted pork, ham, pickles, Swiss cheese and mustard on a Cuban style bread). Man, I tell you, it was SPOT ON. Reminded me of my trip years ago when I had my first one. The meat was roasted to perfection, delivered a dynamite of flavor and was too damn good to stop eating! If you try one thing here, this is it!

On another occasion I was served the Ropa Vieja (shredded beef in Cuban Creole sauce with onions and peppers. Served with white rice, black beans and sweet ripe plantains (maduros)). This also happens to be Cuba's national dish! Again, each bite took me back to Havana. Sweet, delicate and tender beef paired with fresh cooked rice and beans. The taste was outstanding. Boise lacks so many authentic cuisine but Casablanca reminds me that true food is there if you seek it. 

On another note, I absolutely loved our waiter both times. He was very kindhearted and humorous, took time to inform us of what each dish consisted of, which was super helpful for my very Americanized husband (nothing wrong with that - he just doesn't have the palate for authentic food like I do!). 

In a heartbeat, I recommend this to anyone who is tired of over-sweetened, sodium packed eateries that boast but fail to deliver genuine cuisine. Also, if you've never had Cuban food you are missing out on so much!!! And it's here, in little Boise so HEAD OVER AND SUPPORT THIS LOCAL BUSINESS that I love so dearly!
Totally professional and didn't attempt any unnecessary up sells. Wait time was minimal while I sat in the comfort of my vehicle. I'll definitely be back!

I searched online to find a place close to my Hotel since the Hotel restaurant were all closed due to low guess count on this visit (covid-19). 
I decided to sit in the bar area since I was alone. The restaurant was not full about 10 table occupied.
I waited sometime 15min before someone acknowledged me to let me know they would be back soon.
I ordered a glass of wine finally after the waitress came over to take my drink order.
Another 15 min and I had to get up to ask another waitress to get my waitress because I was ready to order my food, the waitress I spoke to took my order and told me they would tell my waitress.
After getting my salad and the meal "fish and chip" the fries were soggy and cold, it took another 15 min before I saw my waitress when I had to flag her down to get a glass of water.
Conclusion not a good experience and I could never eat here again, if it had not have been raining, I would not have stop at this establish again.  I know that we are deal with trying times, but that is no reason for customer service to decline.
I love the food. Service was great!! 100 % Mexican food. I feel like in Mexico. The concept it's nice!!

I love the fact that restaurants are still opening and thriving in this dreary time. We were looking forward to trying this place for weeks and finally got ready to try it on a Friday but we were hit by a thunderstorm. We were determined to Atleast get take take out so got to the place and the rain had almost stopped. They were nice enough to partially dry up a table and we decided to get a couple of drinks and an app and get the rest to go! We tried the jalapeo cheesesteak spring rolls, a Red Bull froze and a whisky drink. Absolutely delicious! 
To go order- bulgogi cheesesteak sliders, wings and shrimp tempura tacos. 
It was about time we got some fresh take on comfort food! Love love love this place. The indoors looked quite Instagram worthy so I can't wait to go back.

This place is ok food wise, customer service they absolutely suck!!!!  Order food for delivery and got sweet and sour pork.  Got my order and I did not get the sweet and sour sauce.  Called back and they ensured me it was in the bag, which it was not.  After telling them 4 times it was not in the bag, they gave me the option to refund me 1.00 for the sauce or come and get it.  I ordered delivery so not sure why I would be asked to come and get it.  The people there screamed at me and called me a liar and told me they didn't mess up and hung up on me.  Calling the BBB now, just want to get this heard on every forum I can because that was the worst service I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!!!!  IF YOU GET DELIVERY, IT IS NEVER THE CUSTOMERS FAULT IF SOMETHING IS MISSING!!!!

I don't even want to give this place one star!!!!!

The food was bland and the service was awful my friends drink stayed empty for 30 minuted till I finally flagged down the waiter and asked for a refill typically I would totally understand this if they were super busy but they weren't then I left my Togo order setting on the table (my mistake) went back 20 minutes later and the manager told me the food had been thrown out I said "so you threw away $40 worth of food" he said "hold on" after waiting 15 minutes he came back and said "I checked all the trash cans it wasn't in any of them" I said "so the person that busted down the table took it" he said " nothing I can do about it" will not be back

How can we give this restaurant a10!!!! Went here for our first time, ate outside and Alfonzo was our waiter. The evening couldn't have been better! Celebrating my husband's birthday we had a wonderful evening and even treated to a beautiful sunset. Crab cakes best I ever had and lobster bisque was amazing! You won't be disappointed!!!!!!

Honestly I would give them zero stars if I could. I reached out to them shortly after finding out I was moving to Nashville and immediately got a phone call from Ben. Initially it seemed very promising and like a great way to go about finding an apartment but it went downhill REALLY fast. He advised that because of the number of people moving to Nashville on a daily basis it would be hard for him to help me at that time since I did not want to go sight unseen and because I wouldn't be down for 2 weeks. He told me when i knew what day I would be in Nashville to email him to set up an appointment. I emailed him 3 days later to set up an appointment and heard nothing. I followed up a couple days after that and nothing. I then attempted to start over from the beginning with a new request on this website and heard nothing. I submitted another request on the website just before I left New Jersey and heard nothing. Luckily I ended up finding a place on my own quickly but I was extremely disappointed in the lack of response from an otherwise promising company. I don't know if it was just straight up unprofessionalism or if it was because I didn't have the budget to rent in a fancy luxury apartment where they probably would have made more money. Suggestion to the company if you want to stay in the good graces of potential clients, respond to them even if it's just to say you can't help them. Ignoring messages is a great way to lose a potential future customer and I promise I would never in a million years recommend this company to anyone.
Great customer service, very knowledgeable staff. It was a refreshing spa day for my daughter & I.

The food, ambience, service, and drinks here are amazing!! We got take out the first time and then had a Valentine's Day brunch a few months later. 

The Valentine's Day special (strawberry scones with lavender cream) were so good we inhaled them before we remembered to take a picture. 

I didn't try the cocktails but the coffees were great. My latte was rich and flavorful. 

Our server (can't remember his name but he had a man bun) was super nice. He went above and beyond to ensure we had a good time.

The collision repair shop taints the Maher name. The owner and his employees treat their customers poorly and do shotty work on their vehicles. They contacted me to let me know my vehicle was ready and when I get there to pick it up the signal lights do not work! Mind you the lights worked just fine when I dropped it off for repairs. Not to mention the manager yells at customers when they voice their concerns about the work done on their vehicle and the discrepancies in their service prices. The owner flat out told me he would not provide me a written statement of the increase charges and I would just have to pay the difference or not receive my vehicle. The manager does not listen to his employees and belittles his customers. I would stay far away from this collision center!

Last week I drove to STL and was listening to an audio book that talked a lot about donuts. After about 2 hours of donut talk, I NEEDED donuts (yeah, like my butt did but whatever). My brother and I ran over to the St. Louis Hills donut shop (at Donovan & Chippewa) and it was closed! On a Sunday! Okay, granted it was 3p.

So we drove over to Donut House which I haven't been to since like Nerinx days. Ken and I were ecstatic over the selection and the cashier asked us if we had been there before and if we lived nearby. I told her she could tell her customers we drove all the way from Kansas for these donuts. The next thing you know I'm chatting up the old folks about  scrubby dutch, Thomas coffee, the old Goodwill--good South City fodder. I left wishing I had a donut shop like that down the street. Well, except my butt didn't wish that.

Today I took my 87 year old grandmother to see Dr. Wayne at Cadence Hearing.  My grandmother was terrified to go to this appointment; her hearing has been declining in a serious way. Dr. Wayne was so wonderful with her, so nurturing, kind and caring. She took the time to talk to my grandmother about anything she wanted to bring up (from her time in the navy to attending the Blind Association). Dr. Wayne was compassionate, sensitive, and engaging. I would recommend the services of Cadence Hearing to anyone who needs an amazing audiologist. Thanks again for your professionalism and great sense of how to treat people with dignity and class, Dr. Wayne.

So finally someone called and I was able to resolve my issues turn out the leave and close for lunch and she was on the property cleaning other storage spaces.

Over all the representatives was very pleasant and was able to resolve my issue over the phone

Changed star review to 4 star

Phenomenal experience when I had my four wisdom teeth removed. Dr. Kramer was great and the assistants were equally wonderful.  Entire process was incredibly easy apart from the post-op pain, but that's to be expected.  However, the pain has been minimal thus far and I am very pleased with the stitching and minimal cutting he had to use.

Great little place to check out for noodles or dumplings! Place is on the smaller side. There are benches outside along the Main Street to sit as well. Dumplings are only sold in groups of 5 unless you head over on Wednesday when they have $1 dumplings. Typically you can not mix Sweet and savory but the counter guy was feeling friendly and allowed me to do so. My friend and I ordered a cheesesteak noodles and a 5 pack of dumplings. Taco, buffalo chicken, cheesesteak, apple pie and cheesecake. There are sauces on the table are great for dipping. As a condiment lover, enjoyed them greatly! The dumplings were packed with flavor. The cheesesteak was my favorite savory And the cheesecake my favorite sweet. Apparently cheese is the key to my happiness! I might have ordered another if they available individually.

The noodles were fresh. Ramen style but fancier. They were tossed in a white super gooey delicious cheese sauce with large pieces of cheesesteak and perfectly cut scallions. 

Looking forward to hearing back to try some more. Hopefully my next trip will be on a Wednesday where you can buy as many or as few as you would like!

I am always up for trying pulled pork bbq at a place I have never been before. For $9.95 you get 6 oz of pork and 1 side.  (Higher than Pappy's or Adam's). I chose the white mac n cheese. Excellent. The first few bites of the pork were somewhat smokey tasting, but a little dry and I had to keep adding 1 of their 7 sauces. That's the most sauces I have seen anywhere.  They also offer burgers, lots of side choices and desserts.  A nice enough place with plenty of seating and a few tv's.  So 3.5 seems about right.

Cafeteria style serving line with excellent food and very generous portions. Two of us had plenty of good food for about $15. I had ropa vieja with rice and black beans, and it was all good. My wife had roasted pork, which was good but a bit heavy on the salt. The plantains were good. We're here for a few more days but this place is worth a second trip.

When I saw Pho Burrito and Pho omelette on the menu, I was thinking what the Pho?  It is a small cozy restaurant, the layout is like a Chinese takeout.  They do have table service and also you can just have your takeout eats there.  It is a mom and pop shop,  so if you want real authentic big menu, this isn't the place.  Also, because of the location, they probably altered the menu for their local clientele. It works, did see a few takeout orders when I was there.  The food portion is generous, the taste is lighter and healthier.  Just keep an opened mind and should be fine.

Chris was the perfect DJ. He really took the time to understand the vibe we were going for with our wedding. We weren't the Cha Cha Slide kind of crew, but we did want people out on the dance floor all night. He created the perfect sound track to get us through all aspects of the night: cocktail hour, dinner, dancing. He was also a great emcee--he kept us on schedule and knew how to keep the party going at the same time. All of our guests commented on how fun the night was. I cannot recommend Chris enough! Thank you, Chris!

I believe I have finally found my coffee shop! Cue the heavenly light and angels...AWWWWWWWWE!

Off the bat, it smells amazing. Not that coffee shops don't smell okay, the slight hint of tea leaves in the air is so refreshing here.

They still have everything I love from the other Mojos including the nifty chalkboard, local art, but more of it, including the postcards and flyers lining a step right under the bar. I called for a Milky Way and forgot to request it cold. Nonetheless, it was DELICIOUS and beautiful to boot. 

Though there are no couches for that homey sort of feel, I love all the tables because 1. They're big enough for all my shenanigans I bring to the coffee shop. 
2. There is no lack of plugs. 
3. They're spread out enough that everyone's biz is their own.
4. This is a weird one. I love seeing people I know, but sometimes it can be distracting when trying to knock something out. There are enough tables that you don't have to be by the front door where you'd constantly be looking up when someone comes in and possibly seeing someone you know with the obligation to chat. And there is a back door that you can escape out of. 

My only problem is the chairs are a little tough on my boney butt, but I think that's a personal problem. Next time I'll just bring one of those blow up cushions, and be the cool kid. Will definitely be returning!!!

Cold beer, great food, outside seating, friendly staff, what more could you want?  Only the James Brown poboy!!  BBQ beef, fried shrimp, and pepper jack cheese!!!!  Truly magical.  If you're coming to visit NOLA, make this a mandatory stop.  If you're a local, this should already be part of your eating pattern.

This place shocked me. The parking is horrible but the food is fantastic!  Ending our wedding weekend and sending our daughter back to vet school; I was just ready to go home. My hubby got the Bloody Mary which came with unlimited refills... OMG. So delicious. The roast beef poboy was amazing and my party was impressed!!  I understand there are many locations...don't be fooled by "chains "!!

When you've had to much fun Saturday night, there's nothing better than brunch! Even if you're not feeling the effects of your previous night, brunch is never a bad idea! Now you could do the fancy brunch buffets, or pick the perfect patio to while away the day, or you could get right down to business and cure what ails ya with some serious food, like the brunch slice at Noble Pie! 

This piece of pizza is nothing to muck with! They top a large slice with their creamy and garlicky bianco Base, a light layer of mozz, prosciutto, sun-dried tomato, asparagus, and red onion, and then top it with spicy hollandaise and... wait for it... a FARM FRESH EGG! As soon as it arrives you've gotta slather that ooey gooey egg yolk all over the slice and enjoy. The flavor combo is dy-no-mite and it's the perfect piece to put that hangover out to pasture! 

On top of that beauty, Noble also rocks a full brunch menu with calzomelettes, sourdough toasts with eggs, cheese, and fresh veggies, a BYO Blood Mary and Bottomless Mimosas, and a full cocktail menu, all served up in a chillaxed atmosphere! Oh yeah, they also have gluten free crust and are happy to accommodate any special requests you might have.

Noble is an awesome addition to downtown Reno and a stop worth making for brunch, lunch or dinner. See you there!

I used to be a CarShare member for about a year - until they started screwing things up royally!
#1 - Charging for estimated mileage. Just because I rent a car for over 24 hours, doesn't mean I'm actually going to go over the mileage limit! How can they just ASSUME these things? Very unfair.. And after they charge you for the milage that you NEVER drove, it's a pain in the butt to have to call them to get your money refunded. 

#2 - Gas cards being taken out of the cars..Which means you have to pay out of pocket for gas! Isn't the whole purpose of opting for this program to save money and NOT have to pay for gas? Why don't they issue personal gas cards to all of their members, that pull from the same gas account?

#3 - Smarmy e-mails telling me that it's not recommended to rent a car for weekend trips, and that it's not really "car sharing"..and now I have to pay more. WTF!!! That email is what really put me over the edge! I don't NEED a damn car to buy groceries or things for the house..that's what SHIPPING is for..I just use the cars to leave the city every once in the while.. is that soo bad??

I am now a proud ZipCar member and happy that I made the shift!  :)

#

I don't know how to review this place. Is it a restaurant? Is it fast food? Its a weird mix of both. I think they should pick one and stick with it. You order and pay as you walk in, then get your drinks and seat yourself. Your food is then served to you. We weren't halfway through our appetizers of lettuce wraps and two crab wontons when our food was served. We had the Honey Crispy Chicken with white rice and the Pei Wei Spicy Chicken. We loved the lettuce wraps. The rest was good but nothing special.

Don't let the word "diner" fool you. Good food but pricey. For $32 we could have gotten more bang for our buck at our local chinese restaurant.
Finally! Delicious Italian on Main Street! Keep up the quality of food and add a little music on the patio and we'll be back once a week!!
Great family place.   Kids eat free on Tuesday's.  All you can eat cornbread.     Wish they offered a breakfast bar or special breakfast options on Weekends.

What can I say?  Except, YUM!  Sweet Eats was recommended 5 years ago for a cake for my baby shower.  My friends and family have been hooked ever since.  We use them for every birthday and every occassion.  My girlfriend even drives from Richland to Voorhees just to get their cakes.

My first time at Healthy Tans was on 5/25 and I had a 10:30 am apt. I was greeted right when I came in and taken back. Meg made me feel comfortable and thoroughly went over directions and aftercare. I got so many compliments about my spray tan and it looks natural! I will be returning

First off I realize it's spelled "PHO" but it is pronounced "FU" as in without the "CK" ending.  This place was not so great overall.  It smelled a little off, especially in the back.  I got the curry chicken and the wife got Fried wonton & seafood soup.

The curry chicken was totally bland and also basically lacking one thing, chicken.  I was really let down by it overall.  The soup, which I did try, was okay but still not as good as our usual place, PHO 21.  We also got pork egg rolls for an appetizer which again, were okay but nothing great.

It was also about $6 bucks more for the same amount of food as compared to our usual spot as well.  They did have a wide variety of things to choose from on the menu but with what we had tonight being so poor I doubt we will be back to try much else.  The other thing I didn't really care for was our waitress.  She left me feeling like we were a nuisance to her overall because we had the audacity to come into the establishment and order food.

With so many Vietnamese places in Reno you can surely find one better than this place.  I highly recommend PHO 21 just off McCarran next to the Flowing Tide Pub, much better.
Omg. Anyone that goes to New Orleans has to go here. And when you do it's a sin if you don't try the grilled oysters the best in the world.
Its not bad but I wasnt that impressed. Id eat here again. I just cant give it more than 2 stars.

I had a good experience, and the food was good enough to make it our go to local pizza shop. You get a ton of food on the cheap, but yes, the service is a touch slow. I contribute it to cultural perspectives, but if I get a lot of good, cheap food- I'm cool to wait.

Yucky people hang around there cause I guess they do sports betting.  Not my type of atmosphere.
