I went to this place because it was where I needed to meet a friend.  I had a burger and fries lunch special.  The burger was cold.  I am guessing it was precooked frozen meat maybe.  I was there to talk so I didn't even bother telling the waitress.  The fries were plentiful and good.

The waitress was excellent.  I just can't give it more then one star due to the clientele and my cold burger.  I will not go to this place ever again.  I doubt I will try another location either.

Bacchanal takes no reservations so make sure that you show up early.  If you arrive past eight as we did, you too might find yourself anxiously scouting for tables, grateful to discover even a sticky mesa far away from the stage.  You'll order bottles of wine from the front cash register (you can use plastic) but when you order your small plates be sure to have plenty of cash. The inconvenience is worth it as the food was terrific.  Tatiana raved about the bacon wrapped dates, but I loved the shaved brussel sprout salad over the smoked potato and the drum fish ceviche.  Don't even think about passing up the olive oil drizzled chocolate bark; this desert delighted me so much that I stole into the kitchen to kidnap chef Joaquin Rodas for an introduction to my posse. This was our best, though by no means our "fanciest" meal.
Chicken Alfredo was alright, a bit oily. My friend had the huevos rancheros (far left) and liked it though.

The coffee is amazing and good fuel for a busy day-food and baked goods are good and worth a try- I would give 5 stars but on busy days it's hard to find parking. We use the buddy system- one drives around the block while the other gets coffee- worth it

This is not eating out, this is a dining experience.  Rich French cuisine that will make you happy you skipped lunch to enjoy each morsel to the fullest.

Parking is plentiful around the design center and once you arrive at the Bistro, you could be overlooking the Seine and not the Schuykill.

Service was friendly, present, timely, and on point in every way.  Drinks were strong, food was decadent with a great variety.  Everything is made fresh so almost any dietary restriction can be honored (as I overheard a waiter say).

The small bread balls were hot and fresh, through the escargot with cream and mushrooms and the fresh salad with beet and pickle chunks next to a sublime pork belly as an appetizer.  Everything on each plate was cooked to perfection in texture and flavor.

It will definitely be a special place to go versus a regular hangout.  But if you're tired of fighting traffic, crowds, and noise and want to treat yourself to a memorable pleasureable night out, this is definitely the way to go.

Overall my experience at El Camino Real was pleasant, and I would recommend you try it out if you're in the neighborhood.  Nice selection of food, between the BBQ and Mexican.  I had the pork sandwich on texas toast, for 9 bucks I think, and it was very tasty, and the fries were really good as well.  Do beware of the BBQ sauce, they only had a choice of sweet or spicy, and choosing spicy was a mistake.  It literally burnt my mouth off, the hottest thing I have ever eaten.  I suggest to the chefs to offer more BBQ sauce selections.  Other than that it was a cute restaurant, with a fun atmosphere.

Me and the lady frequent this spot. We live fairly close and it's her favorite brunch place. I always get the Cubano sandwich and it's delicious pretty much every time. 

All of the staff are super courteous and last time we went we had Ryan as our waiter. By far the best dude there, and he even offered to give me some salsa in a to-go container after raving that I really enjoyed the taste.(Made in-house) 

It can get busy after 10:30ish am so just be prepared to wait if you aren't an early morning person. 

It's also pretty nice that the bar-top is first come first serve. Easy for 2 people to squeeze in quick if there is a long wait. 

Highly recommended

Woohoo is right! Hubby and I found this great place on our fifth day in this lovely city. I settled in at a nice table by the window and he ordered for the both of us.You order and pay at the counter, which is cool. He knows what I like for breakfast and that makes me happy. I got the egg breakfast with bacon and perfect over easy eggs. No toast but the best homemade biscuit ever.   Hubby is not a big fan of biscuits but kept sneaking bites of mine and said it was the best he ever tasted(bold statement). He ordered the Envie which is eggs,brie and ham on a fresh croissant. I'm telling you, we were both so happy after eating, it was sinful. The cook  (Steven I think), delivers your food  which is a great touch. Hubbys'  food was delicious and mine was very tasty. We both had the cafe au lait , which was nice and hot and creamy, I added cinnamon to mine. I love this place and will be back every time we come to this fine city. If you're tired of the touristy breakfast places in the Quarter, try this hidden gem just off Bourbon Street, by the river, in one of the oldest areas of the city. If you don't like cool, funky coffee shops with awesome open air seating, great food, and quirky but very cool staff, then I would suggest hitting a Starbucks for a $4 latte and a stale muffin, don't worry we won't miss you.

I tried the cinnamon roll French toast and it was delicious. My friend ordered the crab cake omelette with potatoes. Another excellent choice. Waiter was friendly and helpful. This is my new favorite breakfast spot on Clearwater Beach.

Fort Harrison State Park is the perfect place to spend a Saturday! I had such an amazing one hiking with my son, snapping beautiful photos and unplugging from the world. I cannot wait to go back and try horseback riding, and I've already started exploring an annual pass. Highly recommend takin a blanket and picnic lunch, and staying a while!
Nothing that really made me say WOW! It's just your typical department store. I do like the clothes here though cause they are good material for the most part. Plus they have pretty great sales

I was expecting to be let down by visiting a "name" restaurant with a long history. Given a poor performance at R'evolution the night before, and this was only lunch I was not expecting much. Thankfully, Emeril's surpassed my expectations and merits a repeat visit on future visits to NO. We were a party of 11 celebrating my niece's college graduation and we were given a private room. 
A three member staff were very attentive to our every need. Water, iced tea and soda glasses were constantly replenished. Any shared dishes were split by the kitchen staff and given equal attention to presentation. Seemed like the entire wait staff organized to bring in the entrees to the table at the same time. Nice touch.
The food was delicious. Crispy calamari and barbecued shrimp were delicious. Chicken and sausage gumbo had great flavor and the spice level was just right. I wasn't very adventurous with my double creole burger and fries, but it came out cooked to order and was a delicious burger. Everyone else was equally pleased with their entrees. The group compares all banana cream pie to the matriarch's version and they devoured the Emeril's version. And the peanut butter pie was just as good.
We had a great meal for a fair price. The city has a ton of great dining and Emeril's earned itself a stay at the top.
Two words.......crab claws.......every time we are here we come to Royal House and have to get an order. Do yourself a favor and do the same.
Food was below par for New Orleans. We had a fish po boy and shrimp and grits.  Both were disappointing. The hush puppies were nice. Service was quick, but I don't recommend.

1 star for the very rude manager and 4 stars for the food and service. I called and made reservations yesterday afternoon for dinner tonight. But of course they couldn't find the reservation. The host was very nice and said it was not a problem and they would still be able to seat us. Then the manager came over to tell us that we did not call yesterday and that maybe we had called a Kotos in California or a Jotos, or some other steakhouse. I stated that I had definitely called the correct location and he insisted that he is the only one to answer the phone and he never spoke to me. And that people lie all the time. Normally we would have left, but we were there for a special occasion for my child. It definitely put a bad mood on the beginning of our evening. Luckily the food and the rest of the service was good, but from now on we'll be going to the other steakhouses in Brandon.

The beer selection may be the best in the south. The food is also that good. And less expensive than it should be. 

I recommend a nice import craft beer and the dunder von bomb sandwich. It is huge and unbelievably good. Also, look for swinehakzen... Probably not spelled correctly by yours truly, it's a pork knuckle. Or order whatever, the beer and food will all be good.

Blech!  Ridiculous wait just to place an order.  Got their southwest wrap & threw most of it away. Really wish the Philly airport had more options since I always seem to be flying back at dinner time.

I've been to a lot of Mexican Restaurants in my life (yes, I am mexican - surprise) and Tequila's is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been to. To start with, the chipotle, almond guacamole is hands down the best guacamole I have ever tasted (sorry, mom). It was perfect size and perfect taste. I tried looking for it on the menu but I didn't see it so I hope they didn't do away with it - if you are there ask about it! You won't regret it. 

For the main course, I had the molcajete de carne which was delicious and a BIG portion. I didnt share it but it might be good to share. If you plan on having your traditional mexican beers at this place forget it. They don't sell XX or any other mexican beers that you have tried in the past. They sell what they call "an authentic" mexican beer which is good. My date had a margarita that she thought was good. 

The restaurant has a pretty good feel to it - dim with traditional mexican decorations. I didn't really like our table as we were off to the side and it was kind of small. We were in the walkway so it was a bit uncomfortable. 

The waiter was knowledgeable, funny and attentive. He even taught my date a few spanish phrases which was cool. 

Overall great experience at tequila's a def must go if you are looking for mexican food in Philly.
The owner is so sweet she makes you feel right at home food is very quick very easy and very fresh thank you again for my beautiful meal
One of my "go to places". I always get the Shrimp and grits with an IPA. I should probably try something new but that dish is so good.

This is the second place I found on Yelp in Tampa that I've loved. The lava sushi was delicious and the mango mojito tasty. The short walk from the convention center was definitely a huge plus. My friend had the lobster bisque and a California roll, which she said were both good. Despite how busy it was, we still got in and out within an hour and our waiter was great. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone. Really great atmosphere.
The place was pretty much empty and I could not get anyone to assist me. I guess Amazon will be getting my business.
Saw this place on tv and came down to try the Pork sandwich. It was fantastic!!  The cheese star looks great but I can't pull myself away from the pork to try it. Get it with spinach and provolone...
Service was fast and the food (pho) was good enough for a lunch outing. Would definitely come here if Miss Saigon ever burns down.

A close friend and I dined here on Black Friday and it was amazing. From the door to us taking our seats, we felt like we were the only guests in the restaurant. Everyone was so attentive and accommodating. I had the pan roasted chicken and she had the Delmonico and they both were to die for! The asparagus was simply asparagus but the stuffed hash browns were delicious! Id go back ANYTIME.
Who gives ketchup and mayo packets when you are dining in... low brow... and, what is in the packet tastes distinctly different than what is on my plate. Don't bother. Worth a walk to anywhere else.

Ate here for the first time on a Tuesday night. It was really good.

Food: Excellent. Everyone was happy. 
Atmosphere: It was Tuesday so it was quiet. No games were on TV.  No wait. Very few people were in the restaurant. 
Service: Very good. They forgot to bring us silverware and ketchup, but other than that it was great.
Price: Prices were higher than they should be for this type of restaurant.

What we had:
Nachos - delicious. Piled high with lots of cheese. Included guacamole.
Onion rings - loved. Though for $10 it didn't come with many.
Kid's grilled cheese - good. Especially the fries. 
Pesto Pizza - very good.
Chicken Pot Pie - very large and very good! Wished it would have included more veggies in it.

Came I here with no prior knowledge of ratings or word of mouth. Just exploring Magazine street and stopped in. Anyway, I was greeting promptly by the bar lady and offered to sit anywhere. I sat at the bar. They do not play traditional Mexican music, but rather they played Sheryl Crow, Tracey Chapman and my favorite THE SPICE GIRLS!!! 
Anyway the food was pretty good. I ordered the chicken enchiladas. Usually I do not like the beans and rice but they were really good here, as well as the enchiladas. They do not serve chips and salsa for free. I ordered a modelo de negro and a house margarita after that. I got more buzz from the beer. 
I'd return here. Especially for happy hour with 1/2 off tacos, M-F 3-7pm.

Raymond James Stadium conducts stadium tours. You get to see the inner working under the stadium that you normally get to see. The tour is about $10.00 a person and you get the walk around the box seats, locker rooms, and other area's you also get to walk onto the field and lots of photo opportunities.

I have been in Tampa for two weeks for work and heard good things about this place. Well my service was absolutely terrible. I ordered a drink which was ok, but I also ordered a burger which took nearly an hour to come out and my order was then incorrect. The server didn't even ask to correct the order, so I just left out. Every server is different I hope everyone else has a better experience.

Not bad. Good pasta dish but lots of shells so be careful! Decent service enjoyable atmosphere. I'd come back. Pricey drinks but how often do I get to this coast? Not often so splurge. $85 plus tip for two people for dinner and drinks.

Probably my favorite broccoli Rabe hoagie anywhere, anytime-If they had a whole wheat sesame rolls, I would give them six stars! Primos has nothing on this place, with selections of smoked provolone and various roasted peppers, fruity tasting olive oil and plenty of garlic.  I wish they would open one up on South Street so I can eat them every day!
They have updated and now accept the app. Staff takes their time to get to know you. Drinks are always spot on. See you soon...

Yeah my trip to Blue Dog recently was less than spectacular. Where to begin, the burger I had was cold and the fries were even colder. The bar was filled with a lot of snotty nosed 21 year-olds acting like it was their first time in a bar, prime example was the fist fight that broke out between two of them. If I would have wanted to go to a frat party, i would have joined one during college. Some of us want to hang with friends and talk over a few beers, not in this atmosphere, family tavern my eye!

I cannot recommend this studio enough. Thank you for providing a challenging, encouraging, and inspiring workout. I end each class feeling like a Wonder Woman: strong, capable, and beautiful. Big shout out to Kaci, who pushes me every Tuesday morning to go for that extra inch or pulse, showing me the potential I have! Love, love, love it!

My Wife and I got about 6 donuts for ourselves and the kids. While they are small they are delicious. You can either select from their already made flavorings. You can create your own unique donut mixings. (e.g.) cotton candy donut, fruity pebbles donut on lemon cake icing definitely stop here if you're in the st Pete area

Lyra has taken amazing Middle Eastern food and switched out key ingredients to more hipster appealing ingredients, completely changing the original dish. It doesn't taste authentic at all, it's very Americanized. It's like the Taco Bell version of Middle Eastern food at a very high price. 

Also none of their staff knew how to pronounce properly anything on the menu. I would train my staff to know how to read the menu first! How embarrassing. 

If you want a nice high end atmosphere go to Lyra. If you want real Middle Eastern food, don't!

Incredible service, fun, family friendly atmosphere and great food. Although busy, the staff, especially hostesses, couldn't have been friendlier or more attentive. We have 2 toddlers that loved the playground. The pizza was great. Excellent experience all the way around, it is now one of our favorite places to go as a family.

I just ordered from Amber Cafe & Restaurant through Doordash for the first time and I am so glad I did. Best chicken I have had in this city! Perfectly cooked with charbroiled skin and the mushroom sauce is to die for! Add to that Salardaise potatoes (cooked in duck fat) and a delicious fresh roquette salad and I am in heaven! This will definitely become one of my go-to ordering place and I look forward to trying other items on the menu and to going in to dine in person too.
Damn it. Wanted them to succeed.

Service was slow very slow. It took an hour to get an order of 10 boneless wings and when they came I asked for an extra blue cheese and didn't get it until I was done my wings and the table was cleared. Now I know why I only go if I have a gift certificate.

I wish I could give these awesome guys more than a mere 5 stars. I had a heinous experience at a vape shop in Center City and I needed some serious guidance. These guys made sure I understood everything before I left. Actual customer service! Plus they have low prices and a cool hang out area. I will be back and I reccommend anyone looking for a new shop or thinking about starting to vape to come here. You won't regret it.

The first Fresh Market in Philadelphia has opened this week in Chestnut Hill.  It seems like most of Chestnut Hill has stopped in to take a look and of course do some food shopping....especially after the blizzard on the weekend.  Like the other Fresh Markets I have been in, this is an extremely attractive store. The food exhibits are very well done....everything looks so fresh and new.  The store is on the smallish side for a supermarket these days but it is of course much larger than a specialty food shop.  Right now there are a lot of tasting stations throughout the store.  I don't think most of these will continue after the grand opening weeks ... but they do add a friendly touch.  There is one big drawback here and that is the prices.  They are def very high.  Maybe these prices will fit in perfectly with many shoppers from well-heeled Chestnut Hill ... but I can't see a lot of other people using this market for more than the occasional specialty item and continuing to do their regular grocery shopping elsewhere.

Li'l Dizzy's Cafe es un lugar distinto para comer en New Orleans. Ubicado en el barrio Treme, este restaurante tiene la particularidad de ser uno de aquellos sitios a los que generalmente va a comer la gente local, lo que hace que el ambiente sea diferente y la experiencia muy amena.

Este es de esos lugares para ir a comer bien y abundante, onda ofrecen un amplio buffet que funciona como autoservicio y uno puede comer todo lo que quiera. 

La onda de este restaurante es toda comida cajun y debo decir que los distintos pollos que tienen son sper ricos, como las ensaladas, postres y todos lo dems qu ofrecen. Los precios son accesibles y la verdad que recontra vale la pena vivir la experiencia de venir a comer a este lugar, ya sea por lo rico de la comida, la muy buena atencin o lo pintoresco del lugar.

Ughh so mediocre! I don't even get the appeal. Was almost forced to go here and never again. Overpriced to say the least. 
Drinks overpriced and mediocre.  Food is a hit or miss. Our calamari salad had maybe 5 pieces of ridiculously over salted calamari. Almost inedible. Mac and cheese with velveeta cheese sauce, seriously?! For the price I definitely expected better. 
My brisket sandwich was really good. Spot on actually. Pulled pork was too salty. Mom had a burger and it was very average. 
Service is what truly pissed me off. We sat at the table for 15 min before anyone even approached. 
Isn't this like a Starr place? The only thing that matches are the high prices.

I go here for my break for work to get a nice slice of pizza. 

This place by far has the best gourmet pan pizza in Tucson. I have tried so many of the types they have i usually can never choose which one i want to eat when there. I would say though everyone needs to try out the buffalo wing and the potato pizza.
The guys who work here are awesome! They always make convo with me and usually know what i want to eat just by what im looking at and throw it in the oven for me. 
When you get inline you get to walk past the case of fresh pizza's and point out which one you want. They take a slice of that and toss it into the nice oven and get it out to you ASAP. 
The seating is First Come First Serve. Great place to go to watch the game with friends and have a pizza and beer.  You can definitly hawk/vulture tables till it becomes empty. Great college place to be at. They have a full bar in there too so you can go inside and sit. All of the restaurant seating is outside though. They have game day deals soo look this place up.

My boyfriend and I live right down the road so this an excellent place for us to have dinner! Sushi is always good, Mexican Roll, Super Las Vegas Roll, and the Plum Paste Roll are just some of our favorites! Love the green ice tea! We will be bring friends to eat here! The sushi has more personality than Sushi Garden's cookie cut rolls, and the sauces are yummy!!

Love it!!

We made reservations for dinner Friday night and the place was packed!  We had a few appetizers, which were absolutely amazing!  I had one of the specials that day which was salmon with a mushroom risotto and smoked beets. AMAZING!!  Everyone at my table had a really good Chianti which smelled amazing...wish I could drink right now...I love a good Chianti!  The service was great, the atmosphere was relaxing and I can't wait to go back!  
I noticed that yelp says the dress code is "dressy"... I have to disagree. I would lean towards business casual. I saw some people dressed up a little, some in jeans and a nice shirt and some in regular clothes. As long as you don't look like a slob...  :)

This location is super, super busy -- but Shannon was so helpful and quick to get me set! I would say the big issue I saw was a lack of car inventory on the day I came. Monday mornings are pretty busy -- so this could have been just a temporary problem. 

If you get Shannon, you'll be in good hands!

Excellent Chinese food. The staff is always friendly and the meals are usually ready for pickup in less than fifteen minutes. The lunch specials are an excellent value and the dinner specials are well-priced, as well.

The pizza is very fresh and you can tell because they have the pizza kitchen at the front of the restaurant so you can see them make the pizzas. For a couple extra bucks it's worth going here instead of other pizza places in the area. Might not be the place to go for large orders because the pizzas are not huge, but the sizes work for small family dinners. Not quite a "service with a smile" kind of place, but the pizza is quite good so it makes up for it.

Best.Pedicure.Ever.  Long, luxurious massage comes with the deluxe pedicure which was worth every penny of the $35 I paid. I found this place on Yelp and recommend it highly to other folks. I also got a good deal on a leg waxing! Friendly, professional staff.

It was good but would I stand in line for hours or fly in from some far away place - heck NO!!!

Just too much hype and they are one lucky place because of it. 

I don't eat meat so there was not a lot of choices for me. But even if I did, I don't see what the big deal is about. 

One thing I do give them credit for that they only take cash. These cash only places usually have people lining up like Tito's Tacos in LA. It's not a law that businesses can't take cash only!

And yes, there are much better Mexican places in the area.

I haven't been here in a while as the wait is usually long and their slow service isn't worth it, but today was different. They served us quickly and efficiently. The waiter was friendly and got us the sides we asked for. Usually when we ask for an extra sauce they won't come back but today they did. I went at about 1 which is one of there times when I usually see a line but there was no line today.

Overpriced. Undercooked eggs. Bland aesthetic. Confusing menu items with fake names. Manager listened to us complain about the food for 20 minutes then walked over just to tell us that he heard us. Said he was "sorry it didn't live up to your expectations". Rude. He comped our food but then followed us out of the restaurant to tell us we offended him. More like #fakebrunch

Been here a couple times. Nice people and inviting dinning area. I had my order mixed up a little both times but they were quick to fix it. I just don't care for the coffee or food too much, food was super salty both times.

I love this little place.

I started off with a frustrated taste in my mouth. It was no fault of their own, though. Google had listed them as being open during their transition from a coffee truck to a storefront and I arrived before actually having opened.

Several months later I finally got the chance to go back to an *open* Kaffeine Coffee. It quickly became my favorite spot downtown to work and caffeinate. 

The decor is a cool warehousey feel. The ambience is chill. The drinks I've had thus far--a Chemex with South American beans (Mexico, I think) and an Americano--were perfectly delicious. The staff are much more helpful than most baristas I've run into, particularly in the context of local, artisan type shops. 

If you're downtown and want some brew, don't miss the chance to get the best of the best here at Kaffeine.

A few friends and I purchased a groupon for the Brewsline. We ended up being the only people booked for that tour so they had us reschedule. They didn't hold us to any of the groupon restrictions and gave us a coupon code for our friends. We filled the bus for the next booking! 

We had an excellent time. The breweries we visited were Books & Brews, Bier, Triton, and Redemption. Each brewery knew we were coming and had samples set up for us. They also took time to tell us about the beer. The Brewsline is more than transportation between the breweries, they make sure that you have a good time and that you learn about the beers and breweries that you're experiencing. Our driver also told us which places served food and if it would take a long time for the food to come (we were on a schedule).

This was a great experience and I would certainly go again.

I've been going here from month to month(even after three months one time) since last summer and it's always been great, I think that Vu is the lady's name that's been recently doing my eyebrows, she's absolutely fantastic and listens to what I want and is wonderful. They're also very professional and try their best to make it as painless as they can possibly can, what can I say? I love that place:)
Call me crazy but I am scared of the car wash, so this one is my go to--- they drive the car thru for you! And they aren't joking, your car will be sparkling inside and out when they are done.

Recent trip to NOLA for mardi gras and we hit this  bad boy up twice. food was soo bomb. I recommend the seafood benedict and the shrimp and grits. The fried green tomatoes were a hit too. I will say when we went Thursday after mardi gras they were a little short staff. ( the hostess was serving tables, passing water, and hosting) it was a little annoying but after seeing her move I was impressed. Not to mention the food was not skimped over at all. This is why they still get 5 stars from me.

We had a surgery with Dr. Parry for my 17 month old. We were really nervous but the staff there was amazing. They were through and very sensitive to us worried parents. Janina was our pre op nurse and she was wonderful. My daughter loved her and easily went with her. It really help put us at ease. Volunteers brought in blankets for the babies to keep warm since it's fairly cold in the pre op area and to take home with them. They called us back as soon as she started stirring and I was with her before she opened her eyes. Dr. Parry was great. In his office and at surgery, I would recommend him and the surgery center to anyone with kids.

Well, I must say I have probably been to every single cosi in Philadelphia. I've been here billions of times it's my favorite/only place to grab quick affordable food. I have had... Pesto chicken bowl , pesto chicken melt 2 million times, adobo bowl once, BBQ chicken flat bread pizza, chicken Caesar salad, Shanghai chicken salad, chicken noodle soup, tomato basil soup which I love, turkey light with spicy honey mustard. And the best white chocolate and pecan cookie you'll ever have in your life. Good quick food. Fresh ingredients my favorite place.

Lovely surroundings, thoughtful staff and a through massage will definitely be back!
Tiphani Ross did an excellent job of destressing my neck n back.

Let me start out by saying Edward Josimov Director of operations with Lex is Awesome. I celebrated my 36th birthday here in VIP and it was a memorable night. Everything was Perfect. The staff is very attentive and nice. The ladies are on top of Everything. If you have a special occasion Definitely consider Lex VIP. I Promise you won't be sorry. We are regular patrons here and we are looking forward to continuing enjoy this beautiful adult club. Thanks for Everything.
The Davis's
Very friendly staff, delicious coffee cake and pretty good latte! Loved the vibe inside, have yet to try the coffee by itself but am definitely excited to. Will be back!

Great event space!  I've been to 2 events here and I think the flow is perfect, the art is fun to look at and the bathrooms have to be the best in St. Louis, well I mean the prettiest.

I have attended third Fridays a few times, I do enjoy watching the glass blowing, but it seems to only capture my attention for a few minutes, then I start to wander around and look at the art for sale.

I waited 35 minutes, and Gina never showed up for my appointment. The receptionist was unable to contact her, and said she was also a no-show earlier that day. I hope Gina is okay and don't want to make any harsh judgments, but I wasted my time and money regardless. Hoping to get a refund :/

Based on 4 bowls of the Pho Tai, we were not impressed.

The broth was ok, not as layered and flavorful as I'm used to.  

The side plates with lime were good except for the lime on two plates: the end pieces with less juice than needed, and the bitter liquid from the rind squeezed out too.

But most disappointing was the "rare steak."  It was very tough and chewy, not pleasant to eat. Two of our party left most of it in their bowls.  One of our party kept casually listing all the pho places she knows that are better, not intentionally slandering this place, but saying what she preferred about other places, which turned out to be everything...

Except the egg rolls, which she liked a lot.

The Thai tea was good. 

Best about the experience was the service. All of the girls working there were great, kind and helpful.

I'm not going to have the pho again, but will likely come back to try the banh mi.

I bought a Groupon for a Brazilian wax and that is how I discovered this place! It's located on Main St, in Manayunk which is an excellent location so you can go get some drinks and food afterwards! (Although they have complimentary wine and chocolates!) When walking in the spa it's amazingly decorated, and the staff at the front desk are there to greet you!

This was my FIRST wax so naturally I was nervous, didn't know what to expect, etc etc! My waxer made me feel very comfortable. The whole process took about 20 minutes or so. I originally purchased the sugar wax on Groupon but was told that wasn't recommended for someone who has never been waxed before so I stuck with the regular wax. As a previous Yelper stated the wax was very hot, but I didn't find that to be painful! All in all, the experience was wonderful from beginning to end! I can't wait to return back for another wax! :)

Bubble tea! Philly does it well and Mr. Wish is one of the best! It's a very clean and bright shop along South Street. The moment you walk in, the servers are more than willing to serve you. They have a large menu of bubble teas, but I recommend their milk tea with bubbles. It's very creamy and tasty. 

Note: Most of their drinks have caffeine in them.

I have to say we had the nicest waitress, but I was just throughly under impressed with the food. Went with my buddy after passing on a quick slice at Gianfranco. Tried three things: the Gigi sampler, my favorite was the beer battered shrimp but very me too; spinach + feta empanada we both took one bite and put it down; chicken was dry; ravioli wasn't bad but his fav (I'll accept for an Irishman since they don't know ravioli); cheesesteak empanada again me too not special like Good Dog does it with truffled cheddar cheese and a bourbon infused rogue chocolate stout sauce for dipping. Tuna + lobster tempura roll was just aweful. This sounded so good when we ordered it but a disappointment...very heavy seaweed paper taste drowned out under seasoned and plain crab and lobster. Gigi's pressed cuban sliders, elementary at best but better than most of the stuff.

I love this place and it is easily my favorite sushi place in reno. Me and my boyfriend come here every time we are craving sushi. However I'm only giving it 4 stars because I'm not pleased with some of the changes the new owners have made. The potstickers no longer come with sause and the mochi ice cream is now covered in chocolate sause which is quite unpleasant in my opinion. I miss the little salad bar as I use to grab a bowl of edamame beans to snack on while I waited for my first order. Now they do still have the beans but they serve them warm which is gross. They no longer carry everything to make Sherly temples my favorite drink of all time which is quite upsetting. But overall I love the staff and the food. This place has the best redsnapper I've ever had outside of Japan which is saying something. The sushi chefs are always friendly and attentive and really know their stuff. Over all if not for the changes the new management made it would have gotten 5 stars.

My boyfriend and I were walking downtown trying to find a nice place to eat dinner. We came across this restaurant which was conveniently located by the parking garage. We took a quick look at the menu and decided to give it a try.

The server was friendly although extremely slow! I ordered the beer sampler which gave a taste of their 6 different beers while my boyfriend ordered a mojito. The mojito was horrible and tasted like pure soda water. We were able to switch it out for a sangria which was pretty bad but we didn't want to complain again. For dinner, my boyfriend ordered the smoked half chicken which came out extremely dry and flavorless. I ordered the margherita pizza which was the worst thing I ever ate! It was pure garlic throughout the entire pizza. I even got sick within 10 minutes of leaving because of how much garlic the chef put into it. 

Thankfully, the server was friendly and took the pizza off the bill even though we never even interacted with a manager. The ONLY reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because of how nice the server was. This place definitely looked promising from the outside but was a complete waste of time. We will never be back again!

This was a very professional, clean and fun Hitel to stay at for 4 days. They have a great breakfast buffet and free happy hour. All he staff smiled and greater you. It also had a nice friendly, southern like vibe in the lobby. I am staying here next time in the area.

Nice enough, this very clean and newly-updated* old place was priced right. Maybe too right. Hint: stay downstairs in the old carriage house if you want to relive that college experience of when the upstairs booze hounds return to traipse around every square foot of their spacious, thin-floored apartment at 3 a.m. Then again this is NOLA. Sleep is a commodity. You get what you invest in. Weekdays, a downstairs room is okay. Weekends, be upstairs only, and try to be considerate of others. If this hotel could control it's guests, I suppose it'd receive a better review. But since it can't control others' behavior, more of a buffer (insulation) between floors during their remodel would have been nice. This is more an indictment against the 20-something generation, I suppose. But Lamothe House is in the guest services business. Perhaps some signs in the rooms to control unruly guests? Right. 3-1/2 stars, on the positive side. 

* modern room and decor, very nice...over an old, charming skeleton...leaves one wanting, sometimes.
Just ate here for my first time and got a complicated order and they hooked it UP. It was such a good burrito. I dream to one day come across such a life changing burrito again

I have been here a handful of times and I was never really "wowed." Their food is pretty good but it is also rather expensive. I guess in my mind, British pub food just shouldn't cost more than $10. They are always very busy (which is good for them) but it can take awhile to get seated. Their service can be hit or miss. (One time, we had a great server who was very helpful. Another time we had another server who we didn't have such a great experience with [my husband ordered beer for himself and when he switched seats b/c the sun was in his eyes, she assumed that he was giving me his beer and yelled at me and demanded for my ID (I was not going to have any beer, my husband was just sliding the beer across the table to his new seat!). Also, we paid via credit card but tipped with cash. We put down a bill and she just picked it up, never brought us change or asked if we wanted any. I guess she thought she deserved a 23% tip!) 

We haven't been here in awhile and I don't see us going in the near future. I think it gets a lot of hype b/c it's on Beach Drive. It's not bad, but it's also not that fabulous.

I hate writing negative reviews. I really do. But I had a really bad experience at this establishment. I called ahead to get pricing before I went for the first time. And the girl who picked up said 35$ and then went into how it's not just a hair cut. You also get a shampoo wash, a hot towel facial massage and an arm and shoulder massage. Plus a style. I didn't get any of those things. He cut my hair and that was it. He didn't even put any product in my hair when he was done. He was more concerned about taking pictures of my hair. I wouldn't have written this review for just that. But he also didn't cut my hair the way that I asked him to. That's why I am mad. I'm a guy with medium normal hair. I asked for a part in the side. He completely shaved off the part that I had there. Even when I had specifically asked for a part. Now I look like a Russian pop star. I didn't realize what het was doing until it was too late. 
They were all very nice there and I feel bad saying anything. But now I have to wait a month or two for my hair to grow back on the side. Even if I had paid half of what I did, it still would've been a bad experience. Maybe I'm the only one who slipped through the cracks of good customer service. But for that price range you need to be on your game.
Pizza was fair the first time and just ok the second time was meh.....parking for pickup is dicey at best.....

Great place, everything home made .so testy and great Turkish pastries.i always go for pickup and I drive 45min and I still get it home hot . The lahmajoun is amazingly testy ,the pide is good as well .honestly all I tried there was not a disappointment . Worth the drive
Awesome food! Amazing service! Bartender was fabulous! Will def be back! Try the Brussels sprouts and French onion soup, out of this world!

Please check out this link that describes one of the kennels where Monster Pets purchases its dogs -  the inspectors had to wear masks because they couldn't breathe in the kennels where the dogs live 24/7
http://www.philly.com/philly/blogs/pets/Problem-kennel-given-last-chance-to-clean-up-act_dot_html
Great drinks, banging food.... do not miss brunch- their Bloody Marys are to die for & the eggs benedict was the best I have ever had.

Wonderful little museum with modern exhibits and great staff.  Learn about the city through objects old and new. Inexpensive entry and easy to see all in about an hour and a half. 

Don't miss the map room surrounded by pictures. 

Recommended.

They know their pulled pork at Hoods. And judging from the length of the menu, they know how to cook just about anything. I enjoyed my omelette. But, as far as favorites go, I think it's between their burgers and pork.

First experience was not bad. We liked the food a lot but do wish we had a better explanation for the dim sum carts. When we asked, we kept getting a rundown of what they had rather than explaining how the pricing/ordering worked. We hardly saw our server. I still wanted to give it another shot since I enjoyed the food.

Second experience was way better! Food was just as good, if not, better. We had a fantastic waitress, Shelly. She was incredibly attentive and provided excellent service. We will absolutely be back! 

Black pepper beef is my favorite so far especially in the udon noodle dish. I also tried orange chicken, which was pretty good. My husband ordered the kung pao chicken, which he claimed wasn't spicy enough. It was perfectly spicy in my opinion. To each his own.

Dim sum is the best I've had in Tampa. Honey BBQ pork buns are pretty tasty. My favorite off the carts is the egg tart. If you see the special egg tart with cream - it's so worth the extra $1! So tasty!

DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!
This is the worst airport parking facility I have ever seen. I called them a week in advance to get a price quote for parking for three days. I gave them the dates that I would be parking and I asked them if I needed a reservation. The employee told me numerous times that reservations are not necessary because they do not anticipate on being full. I then called them the night before my trip to ensure that everything was OK, and they informed me that it was.

We arrived to the parking lot on the day of our travel, and were told that we can't park there because we need a reservation!! I tried explaining that I called twice and was told reservations are not necessary. The attendant told me there was nothing he could do!

This kind of stress is exactly what I was trying to avoid on a day that there was a scheduled flight leaving. This place took absolutely no responsibility and did not even acknowledge that it could've been possible that they made a mistake! They were trying to blame me! They left us high and dry with no place to park. These people absolutely cannot be counted on.

As soon as I started asking for a supervisor, I kept getting wishy-washy answers like oh they're not here today, oh I don't know when they will be back. Sounds like someone was trying to avoid getting in trouble!
Highly recommend this place. Food was great and didn't take long at all to get. The chorizo queso was amazing! Margarita was perfectly made & tasty!!
Good suhi.  Reasonably priced.  Good and polite service.  Ample parking.  The building is not very pretty, but not a problem if you're looking for good sushi.

I absolutely love Sunshine! The store is always very well organized. The items are organized by department and then by size but past that it's a bit of a free for all. I can come in with a general idea of what I'm looking for and find a wide selection of things that will do. The quality of the items I find are always very good. I rarely see anything with even the slightest rips or tears. The pricing is always very fair for the pieces and every day something is on sale. Every day there are certain color tags that are half off so the price you see may not be the price you pay.

Came for hookah.  Left with little money.

Hookah, $24.  We had 8 people, with 2 people not doing it - they made us get 3 hookahs.  

They tacked on the service charge without telling us or putting it on the menu (not cool).  Tipped extra.  Not happy about paying extra for subpar stuff.  Oh well.  Live, learn.  The people were nice though.

I hadn't heard of Capdeville until Jessica R. held a CMYE here the other night. And I've been missing out. 
The concept is a bit odd--it's basically a bar with an awesome kitchen and limited table service. We had to order everything at the bar while we were there, but that didn't really bother me. The truffled mac and cheese is AMAZING. Poutine is tasty, as are the chorizo and manchego fries. The cucumber salad is, oddly enough, kind of spicy, but very yummy. For dessert, I had the flourless chocolate cake, which comes with a blackberry-ginger sauce.

Overall, I'm a fan. Capdeville gives me yummy food and good beer in a nice atmosphere. It is rather noisy, but I can forgive that.

This place definitely deserves some more business. It's authentic Ethiopian (sambusa or ful anyone?) and that's DEFINITELY a good thing. This is the type of place I'd expect to find in NYC... it's thrilling to see Nashville sport that sort of variety.

I had a pure avocado smoothie, and the barista/chef recommended I squeeze fresh lime on it, which completed the flavor profile perfectly. Not too bitter, not too sweet. The actual coffee is rich and dark, as I'd expect from Ethiopian, Turkish, and other eastern beans.

Now I have another reason to visit East Nashville!

APPARENTLY ... THEY HAVE CLOSED. Ha!

Good food.  Okay service.  Tight quarters.  Doesn't look easy to maneuver around with a wheelchair.

Love their Scallops & Asparagus.

Lunch is busy.  If you go, get there early.

We made our second purchase today since we finished the first delicious  order. Pick up your phone, place your order, answer your door, cook the meat and enjoy the product. Love it!  Thank you Butcher's Choice.

We love Joey B's. The atmosphere is clean & pleasant with a large awesome outdoor eating area; complete with fire pits, a bar and plenty of comfortable seating. Food is delicious every time we've gone. It's one of our favorites, but don't make the mistake we made thinking that all locations of Joey B's are the same! We recommended, and met friends at the JB's on The Hill and were disappointed in lack of atmosphere, crowded seating and loud, loud music! It's a completely different atmosphere, and we weren't expecting that.

DO NOT GO TO BALDWIN LOCK AND KEY!!!!! WORST BUSINESS IN BOISE!!!!

In my entire life, no business has ever treated me so rudely. I called ahead to find out their hours and was told "8-6 Monday through Friday". I arrived at 8:15 and although the closed sign was up, all the lights were on  and there were two people inside laughing and drinking coffee. The only sign referencing their hours says "24 hour service". This is a lie. I waved at one to let him know I was there and he looked right at me then kept talking to his buddy. I then knocked and without moving a muscle the guy yells from across the room "8:30!!" and goes back to chating with his friend. It was about 26 degrees outside where I was left to stand for 15 minutes while these two jokers got to catch up on office gossip. When they did finally let me in they were immediately confrontational. Long story short, I left and will never ever darken their doorstep again. 

There are so many quality professional locksmiths in the Treasure Valley, do not give your money to these losers. I went to A-1 Lock and Safe and was treated very well and paid WAAAAY less than the original price quoted to me by Baldwin. Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

Great view, pretty darn good food!  Great place to start off my 50th celebration!  Special thanks to waitress Tasia who helped this lost Chinese guy from Cali to start his Big Easy 50th BDay off right!
Best Breakfast I have had in Nashville! I had the biscuit egg and cheese with a side of home fries for only $9! Make sure to add on one of their homemade pop tarts to complete your breakfast

Worst customer service I've experienced in a long time. Dropped our car off after they said they had our windshield in stock. Returned six hours later and was told they didn't have it after all. Never apologized for wasting our time, and never called during that six hour period to tell us the windshield wasn't in.  Instead said they'd call when it came in. They never called once, instead I had to call monthly just to be told it still wasn't in. They continued to say they'd call with updates, never did. Called them yesterday to find out the windshield came in a month earlier. Never apologized for not calling. Then said the price they quoted several months earlier has changed and was now over $100 more , couldn't give good explanation why.  The girl answering the phone could not have been ruder or less apologetic.  Needless to say found another local place (clear vision glass) that was cheaper and came to my house that day and did a great job. Wish I discovered them 6 months earlier.
Great service great people great environment best bartender ever was Dana   i've been at this location one time and it didn't let me down

If you love historic buildings and yummy appetizers this is your spot... entrees not so much! But it's ok because they have a large selection of drinks! The bourbon honey fritters were GAS. My bulgogi entree was mediocre at best and I ended up trading my husband for his scallops. I haven't had any issues with scallops until then. They tasted great, presentation was ok (there's only so much you can do about scallops on a bed of white rice atop a metal tray... lol), but hours later I was not alright. I will definitely come back here and only order appetizers and drinks. Love the history behind the building and I'm sure it's a popular spot in the summer... absolutely beautiful and very clean inside! The bathrooms could use more attendance at night though, there was so much water on the wide counters that my shirt got soaked while I was trying to reach for the faucet handles lol. Be aware if you are going there as a couple they put smaller tables between 6-tops so we were sandwiched between two very loud groups. We ended up spending most of our dinner either texting each other or rolling our eyes at the inappropriate conversations coming from next to us lol!

My wife and I moved here from Chicagoland last August. From the first time  we walked into the office we were treated like family. We didn't know the are so we looked at nearly 30 apartment complexes in 3 days. We chose Carmel Center for 1) Beacon Hill floor plan 2) Location to everything in Carmel 3) Staff is truly amazing 4) Residents are very friendly.  Having been here for almost a year, we made a great choice. There are social events constantly - Wine, Sushi, cookouts, movie nights, food trucks (coffee trucks), pool parties. They do not spare expenses to treat the residents to all kinds of awesome events. They even rented out Matt the Miller's for us in December for a big dinner party. Maintenance is spot on and they keep the place clean and manicured year round. I can't say enough about this place. If you're looking to rent in Carmel, stop by and check it out. You be glad you did.

MIMOSAS!!! 

We came here for start our day because of the mimosas. I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes and a pancake. Typical tasting everything. It was good enough for us to go back. My best friend got the shrimp and grits. Not what we expected at all. It was a grit cake. Weird but when you ate everything together it tasted just like it should. Service was quick and efficient.

Not bad for for a McDonald's but not great by far. The amenities are relatively but there is a lot of noise and Pickering from back in the kitchen. Otherwise this is basically your standard McDonald's maybe a little small.
I come all the time since it's opened. Got all my people coming to. For $18 you get an unlimited pass you can't beat that.

For a huge selection of *really* sweet treats that'll "wow" the touristy crowd. You'll get an eye-full of beautifully presented treats served from behind a bustling counter. Next, you'll pay the high tourist prices for your *very* sweet selections.

After visiting the out-of-the-way National Bakery down Athens Blvd., my parents wanted to return to Hellas Bakery to show me; they'd recently visited it once before on a weekend when it was crawling with people. Upon that first visit, they thought it was great.

My parents selected a few different items from the beautifully presented offerings so that we could eat them later at home.

One item was a chocolate tiramisu. I thought it was just okay, and way too heavy and sweet for my tastes. Another item was a slice of Key lime pie (or was it cheesecake?). It was pretty good overall.

This is a place that I remember for two reasons: the first reason is because this is the first Italian place I went to as a child with my father on one of his business trips and I wasn't afraid to try so many different items on the menu. My brother and I always talk about this special memory with my father and how good the food was. The other memory I have with this place is when me and my fianc first started dating we took a trip to Tucson to do some hiking and sightseeing and had a great time and enjoyed everything Tucson had to offer especially this place. We love the lights in the gardens and the food was great. I would never called this place the best Italian food I've ever had but it was excellent because the food was savory and the ambience is relaxing and the customer service was superb. My fianc left her purse there after hours and they were kind enough to open up well over two hours after we left the restaurant just so she can get her purse and everything was perfect. I would highly recommend this place plus it's close to college so the area is pretty cool. Don't expect to have the greatest Italian food ever but expect a great experience with some savory food items.

This place never disappoints me. I enjoy the atmosphere and the food. I've had a variety of menu items and they're all great. I favor the chicken wings. I'm from Buffalo believe these are better than a lot of places back home. I travel in and out of Philly for work and always make this spot my number one food choice.

Great experience.  Just walking around Main Street and decided to try The Black Pearl because of great Yelp reviews.  We were under dressed but they were great!  Service was top notch.  Wait staff courteous and helpful.   We tried the Pork Belly - yum, meat candy!  Lobster Risotto was the best I've had this side of the Amalfi coast.  Pate and  Bisque were excellent, as well.  We were happy foodies!

We were sad to see blue belly close, although we didn't eat there too many times. 
But we love square pie! All pizzas are fantastic, but the porchetta is amazing. My husband only eats red sauce- traditional pizza and he loved this one. 
The salad is awesome for a starter/side.

Decided to try this place out on a Sunday, and let me start off by telling you, HANDS down the closest to authentic Jamaican cuisine you'll get around here. The wings are my absolute favorite. I've been raving about this place ever since my first visit! Can't wait to come back! Owners are super sweet

Great place with tons of choices.  Had a fantastic spicy shrimp appetizer.  It was great as was my pbj mahi.  Wife and I both did some beer flats.  Huge selection of beer to choose from.  Wish we would have tried the bacon appetizer.

When you walk in to Toucan Charlie's buffet you are immediately surrounded by what looks like a tropical garden. Then the aroma of the food will begin to start your mouth salivating to say the least. The options available to you on any given day are amazing. I opted for the salad bar first, which I must say is impressive. The average salad to the most delectable of fruit and vegetable pre-made salads are wonderful. The choices are endless. The soups remind me of something your grandmother would have made when you were visiting, fabulous. On to the entrees, where you can have your fill of many different cultures. There are American, Mexican, Chinese, Mongolian etc... Seafood options are endless as well. Shrimp, Crab, Oysters, Fish (baked and/or fried) Prime rib that will send you on your merry way to heaven. It is tender and flavorful. On to the dessert: Cookies, cakes, ice cream, pie, cookie bars, donuts etc... I have to say my favorites are all of it. However they do have this coconut raspberry cookie bar that I have to have everytime I visit. Oh and the chocolate layer cake, blueberry pie. So I guess I really love dessert or they are just amazing at what they do. Needless to say, it is all fabulous, and I can't wait for my next adventure into food there.

My wife and I had seen some negative reviews for this place on Yelp, but we believe in forming our own opinions so we gave it a try.  We found nothing wrong here.  The food was good and reasonably priced.  The service was friendly, courteous, and delivered our order in a reasonable amount of time.  Our server explained that the previous reviews came right after they opened and they now have an all new staff.  We enjoyed our meal here and will definitely return.  We had pizza and Parmesan garlic bread this time.  Next time we'll try the calzones and mac 'n' cheese.  The only downside to this place is that the marinara dip is served cold and the drinks are served in cans (even for dine-in).  They would change this if they could, but their franchise overlords will not permit it.  This did not detract significantly from our experience.

This was my first visit to get some stirfry and a bite to eat in a hurry. OMG. I will definitely keep this on my list of favs.  The menu was extensive but not complicated - and had lots of my favorites at very reasonable prices.

I ordered the fresh spring rolls and some curry chicken, no rice. The spring rolls were super fresh and delicious, and they didn't skimp on the pork and other goodies inside. The curry chicken was awesome - and the portions were large.

The service was super fast, and several times we were asked how our meal was and how we were doing. Very unusual for a "fast food" type place. They were efficient, polite, and interested in what we had to say!

All in all, very impressed. It may not look like much - but this little place is a gem!
All they say about it is true. I had a nail in the tire of my brand new car, 2 days before a trip to Tahoe. They set me up in 15 minutes. Bam! And I'm home safe.

Our friday night go-to, best pizza around, and you're treated like FAMILY.

Cheesteaks are huge, rolls are fresh as can be, never a bad meal in 15 years!

These guys did an outstanding job at building my pool. From my initial phone call through to the finished product they were great partners to work with.  I had several companies give me quotes and these guys came in on budget, while everyone else quoted me about 20K over my budget. The design they created is unique and now that it is done looks amazing. Love the infinity edge. Their detail to quality is superb and their workmanship outstanding. Now the pool is complete they are doing a great job keeping it clean with weekly service.  This is my third pool I have had built over the past 12 years and the best experience I have had.

The Lower Garden tour was a waste of money. Our tour guide focused only on celebrity house locations. Very surface-y, no insight or interesting takeaways. I contacted the company afterwards to complain about the tour guide's lack of knowledge about the area and never received a return call or email. This company is terrible and our guide was subpar at best.

Eddie is exactly the type of guy I imagine my great-great-grandfather would have enlisted for help after his stopwatch died. He reads as very trusting and family oriented, and a true Tucson native.

Exactly the type of person who consistently earns my business.

I had never heard about his establishment before stopping in. I found that he had a listing on Yelp... but he didn't have any reviews or photos or tips. Steep risk, I thought, but there was absolutely no way I was going to set foot in a mall or visit a big-name jeweler. 

I'm glad I took the chance.

Eddie has a very small, nondescript and antique-y type of shop. He offers watch and jewelry repair, and works with gold, silver, etc. He also does custom work. He will also resize rings and remount. Inspection and cleaning services are free here.

I am not certain how long he has been at this particular location, which is at the very back of what looks like apartments converted into small businesses. Protip: Do not park in that tiny lot off of Broadway Boulevard. Go to the back and you will find ample parking. 


Apparently, Eddie has been in the business for more than three decades. He was born and raised here, and also trained in his craft in Tucson by his father! Pretty cool. And there were a couple of things in there that I imagined hadn't been touched or moved since they had been placed.

I arrived with my Citizen watch, one that I've had for 10 years. This watch is very dear and quite special to me. Of all of my possessions, it is among my most protected, actually because it was such a special gift.

I had to leave it with Eddie because it has a highly specialized battery, which he had to track down. Turns out he ended up having it shipped directly from Japan. He and I had never met, and I didn't want to leave the watch. 

But I could tell from his eyes and energy that I could trust him. It was automatic. I rarely feel this way about a person on a first meeting, so I left the watch behind.

The watch was ready after a week. Took a bit longer than expected, but Eddie was very communicative, sending me text messages along the way to let me know about the progress. I appreciated that. He even buttered me up a couple of days before I picked up the watch, telling me that it was ready and "beautiful."

I was shocked when I saw it! It looks almost brand new! It felt like I was receiving it for the first time again. Except for a couple of deep scratches it's endured over it's decade, the watch is pristine. He also cleaned the interior and exterior and replaced the faceplate, or crystal, which gives the impression that the watch is nearly right off the factory line.

If I had a mound of broken watches and jewelry, I would take the entire lot to Eddie. 

He's earned my trust.

It's so sad because the food is so good, but the customer service has steadily gotten worse and worse since they opened. Tonight, a huge line, one person working the register. At least twice, the phone rang and was picked up and immediately put back down. As in a customer got hung up on. "They'll call back". Door dash delivery drivers waiting forever to even get attention. "Just bs patient" was growled at one unlucky online orderer.  Step it up, Joellas, or we will not be back.

The store located at 17 11th street. We went there yesterday ordered the jumbo lobster roll and trios. I think they were smaller than what I had previously( not in the philly tho). The taste is great, the only complaint is they put a lot of lobster claw meat in the bread

Had a great experience at this mega athletic store. Excellent customer service that is attentive without being pushy. High praise to the men's athletic shoe department with a special shout out to Nicholas (?). He helped serval customers at once and has the can do attitude of success so desirable in sales positions. He helped get me fitted with new orthotics and a new pair of track shoes. Thanks again for helping me. Good job!

Interesting that they are celebrating their 50th anniversary because my family has been going here for at least 45 years.  My 49 year old son was a toddler when we started. Drive up the central drive straight to the top of the hill where the Jonathan Apple trees were to be found. Those trees are old and gnarly and mostly gone. 
As are we. 

An autumn tradition.  Lunch at Grays.  Even the grandkids are getting too old and scattered.

I know most people would not bother reviewing a fast food place, but I have to say that this A & W has the friendliest staff and quickest service of any A and W I have been to and they are consistently providing this kind of service.  They have an attitude towards their customers that I wish every fast joint had.  Of course, the food is good and comparable to many other A & W's.

Great spot that was Channelside and now Sparkman Wharf. A nice spot to hang before Lightning game or just go to watch sunset and take in variety of eateries. Bowling available there. Cornhole and such. Lots of condos nearby to buy and you can call us to help 813.507.8348

This isn't just your typical hair salon where your shoved in and out in twenty minutes. My stylist was Heather and she was very courteous and interested in how I wanted my hair done. The pricing was excellent for the quality hair style I was given, and the salon was clean and neat. I can see from my experience here that the stylists and owner really care about the customers. Will be coming back here for sure.

Great service, meal had effort put into it, moroccan chicken on my salad was great, and best of all, free wifi. Best signal was in the back corner with all the booths. 

However, like any downtown upscale american joint, the prices were a bit high. Not only a little high, which i can deal with, but if you want a side or a starter it's gonna hit you even harder. But, the atmosphere was very good for a date and money is less important in that scenario.

This is my first negative review and I feel bad for the restaurant but I rely on honest reviews for a good meal. I created my own stir fry first with red curry. The flavor was so odd and after trying to eat a few bits it just became worse and inedible. They were very nice though and made me the same order with the sesame garlic sauce. Again weird taste but it was lighter so I tried to eat it, but it had a dirt taste. I couldn't do it. Down the trash it went. I'm from California and love dining on my travels. Tomorrow I'll be in downtown Philly with hopes of better food experiences there.

this place is pretty gross. one of the elevators reeked of vomit the entire three days i was there. the others only smelled like feet. tell me, why would you put carpet in an elevator? 

our room was ok, not too smelly, although there was a faint odor i couldn't place, it didn't completely sicken me. the bathroom was clean enough. but everything was a bit old and run down feeling. the decor is awful. i heard a rumor that the 2 top floors are actually really nice. maybe request these if you decide to stay here. the price is pretty good and it is close to bourbon street and everything in the quarter. so there's that. but there are plenty of other mid-range hotels that feel a lot more taken care of.
Tampa dive bar.  Fabulous. Friendly staff makes all the difference.  The sandwiches are huge.
Service and food was very good. The tables are too close together. Did not have to wait to get in which is a plus. Ask for a booth next time.

It's a Friday night, you just got home from a long work week, and you don't want to cook.
Order the meatsa pizza. The BEST pizza in Edmonton.

I live here and the place is a dump. Garbage takes over the parking garage. The security gates never work. I've complained many times and management basically tells us technology is not their problem. Yesterday morning there was a homeless man sleeping in the stairwell when I walked my dog at 7 am. Complained to the management and the next day door is still broken. Do not live here.
Good iced coffee, great music and fresh, warm beignets piled hi with powdered sugar.....great treat after a big dinner.

I fell in love with this little tea place! They have an enormous variety of tea and the staff is extremely helpful and patient. The decor is super cute they have tea cups and tea sets on display and for sale as well. There isn't a lot of room inside to sit and study or hang out but they have outdoor seating. They also have fans outside so it isn't too bad to sit and catch up outside. I would not be able to study or get work done there though. The tea was really good. I was able to mix two different teas together. I hate when I go to tea places and they tell me they can't mix x  tea and y tea bcuz the steeping time is different .... duh obviously you won't be able to steep it the same way but you can steep it separately and then mix them together -_- .... this place was more than happy to mix teas so I loved them just for that.

I totally went to this........And I totally loved it.

So much food! And it's all relatively pretty well priced. For less than twenty dollars I got one of the best pulled pork sandwiches I have ever hard in my life... the tastiest, juciest roasted corn [omg]... some greasy,but frikkin' good Texas Style Potato Chips, and an oh-so-satisfying Funnel Cake smothered with Fresh Strawberries. Yum Yum Yum. There are vendors from all over the nation at this thing.

It's not year round - which sucks, but if you're ever in Reno around Labor Day - you must - YOU MUST check this food festival out. Admission is Free, food is not. - Don't forget to check out all the mullets!

So I thought the point of a reservation was so you DIDN'T have to wait 30 minutes to be seated.  Also, how the hell do you not have air conditioning in 90 degree weather? They were out the tofu scramble,  chicken and biscuits, chicken and waffles, and cured salmon. That's 1/3 of their menu.  After my friend was asked to repick his entree for a third time, we left for a restaurant run by people who knew what they were doing. I am shocked this place has not closed down yet as it seems these are all ongoing issues that have yet to be rectified.

I've worked maybe 2 shifts and watched a bunch of movies here while it was still the Ritz (I left way before the Landmark takeover). I love Joe and Maurice (2 workers, one is now a manager). The workers do their job and do them well. I haven't had serious issues with projection or sound (not that I can remember). The theater layout is strange and the floor in the lobby I have heard is uneven and makes you feel like you have vertigo.

The number one issue with this theater is how small the ladies room is. I haven't been into the men's room. The ladies room is really tight but I've heard rumors about expansion. I have never worked their concession but it's pretty small back there. I sucked at the cafe but as a customer, I've had no complaints. Oh, and in one of the theaters is a closet and at one point someone went in there which disturbed my movie watching experience (note: She doesn't work there anymore). This is rare that it happens, though. Also, I think the ushers do a good job of theater checks and cleaning up. Very consistent.

As for parking, go to the Olde City Garage, entrance on 2nd. Show your ticket to the person at the door or box office at the Ritz Five and they will give you a validation card. You now pay $6.50 for parking! Easy and convenient. Too bad they raised the rates, it used to be only $5 for parking.

Overall, a great theater. I love the Ritz movie theaters.

Trashy exterior, lowlife type people walking around, pretty sure we heard gunshots, wife very fearful. Exposed wiring in the room, mold on the shower curtain, lamp fixtures Halfway Broken. Thank God we came in late one night and left the next day....

This is a difficult place to review. On the one hand, murderously good beer: after drinking Sun King's by-no-means-un-delicious Velvet Fog (a Belgian quadrupel style) at Flatwater, I walked over to Brugge for a Tripel de Ripple nightcap. The TdR was, on this night, bready and yeasty (pear-y and apple-y) and rich and wide and deep on the palate and just plain superior to the beer I'd tasted earlier.

The experience reconfirmed my long-held opinion that Brugge Brasserie produces the finest Belgians brewed 'round these parts.

On the other hand. The food here is not quite equal to its liquid counterpart. The frites + sauces are to die for, but the sandwiches and dinner crepes are, without qualification, inferior to [less expensive{!!}] Goose the Market and Three Days in Paris, respectively. In the new order of Good Food, where "how' counts more than "what", Brugge is noticeably behind. The prominently featured mussels are fairly good and unique in Indy (I think), though they too somehow seem to deliver more of a rote satiety than an exciting dose of culinary fulfillment.

Basically, 5-6 star beer (I must mention that the guest tap list is limited but irreproachably inspired), 5 star fries, 2-3 star other food. It's near the ideal experience, but not quite touching.

This is an interesting place because there is the main Virago (the restaurant part, which I did not get to go to), an exclusive event space called Citizen, and a rooftop patio space. I went with some friends to an event in the Citizen area, which was really well decorated. The ambiance was awesome, and the food was actually really good (I had a couple rolls of sushi) although pricey. Drinks were pretty good though.

I have to agree with my fellow yelpers, this is a great place for brunch. Classic diner fare with a southwest twist.  We had Jonathan's famous fiery scrambler with homemade sausage and gravy on the biscuits along the new mexican breakfast burrito.  The sausage had a good flavor but was cooked into a hockey puck, so if you get it (and I do recommend you do) maybe get it in one of their dishes instead of on the side.  The fiery scramble has great flavor and I highly recommend it.  The potatoes were deep fried which is not the way I prefer my breakfast potatoes cooked, so they were just alright.  The burrito is huge, so plan for left overs.  You can add the optional green chili on top; we didn't and regret that decision.  Will have to come back and try it again.  The place is crowded, so plan for it.  The bus outside offers a place to grab drinks while you wait, so that is a plus.  Will definitely have to give it another try.  So many good things on the menu.

My husband and I came here for the first time last Friday. The food was very good! We had crab cakes, bruschetta, Mac and cheese, clams, meatballs, and one of the specials which was duck breast with duck fat shoestring fries, and chocolate decadence for dessert. The duck was amazing, perfectly cooked and the sauce that came with it was great. The only minor issue, if you could even call it that, is that the drinks were a bit slow to come out but they were packed and there is only one bartender so it makes complete sense, we just ordered our second drink before we had finished the first one and it came right when we expected. We were there probably 2 hours and didn't feel rushed at all to finish which I really appreciated. There's a lot more on the menu that I want to try so I'll for sure be back.
This place is the place to go for smoothies in Santa Barbara. I highly recommend the red mango smoothie.

I still can't believe how great their food is. They have an eating area for eating in. Their portions are fantastic. The most tender beef I've gotten from any Chinese places EVER! I use beef fried rice and beef and broccoli as test dishes. They're both FANTASTIC! Can't wait to try many more of their dishes.
They put magic in their food.  It is impossible to wake up with a hangover when your night ends at David's Mai Lai Wah.

Service and cleanliness 5 stars but the food was just ok. We are huge fans of Ryaki but they do not have indoor dining right now and the takeout isn't up to par, so we gave Kokoro a shot. Really wanted to love it but the noodles felt more like spaghetti than the chewy wavy textures were accustom to. Lemon water was a nice touch. Pork buns were toasted which seemed odd but still good. Presentation was was well executed. Hope to give it another shot.

Who knew this existed?! 

They recently changed locations (the Yelp page is updated) and are located in a little house on Rangeline, just north of Carmel's Main Street. 

The owner, Kim, is very friendly and kind. She puts no pressure on you to purchase anything, but helps you try on any of the wedding dresses. 

They sell wedding dresses (have about 20 racks) of sizes 0-18 ish. There's a nice selection and prices also range from $90-$1500, which is refreshing compared to most bridal stores. There were several quality brands in the store and the dresses were in great condition. 

They also have veils and bridal accessories.  It's a small shop which makes the experience less stressful!

This place.. oh this place. Note in photo no donuts! Her food is amazing and the owner will lOVE you! We bought some things for an office birthday party and she even gave us a candle. The owner is so kind and lovely! Coming here will warm your heart...and clog your arteries.

This rallies is terrible I waited 20 minutes on the online pickup side and no one answered so I went to the order side and no one answered either after another 20 minutes past but they are supposed to close at 4am it is 1:22 all of the employees were outside laughing and messing around and someone from the inside turned the drive thru lights off while I'm still currently waiting and there are three more cars waiting as well with no one saying anything. I spoke with two people outside they continue to ignore me and not give me my order

Absolutely the best Vet (and crew) in the New Orleans metro area - Dr. Salles always shows patience and care to our crazy Catahoula. His team is always engaging, friendly and fun. These are good people. Very thankful to have them near!

Glad this location is getting its long awaited face lift... But what it really needs is a renovation of its employees. Visited this location and received a McChicken without the chicken patty. This is the last straw for me - too much money wasted on food I never received and terrible customer service. I will not return to this store and will advise others to do the same.

I have been to this tea room twice now. So much fun! I got the High Tea both times - I was a little afraid that it wouldn't be enough food to fill me up. Boy, was I wrong! I was full - very good - loved the cucumber dill tea sandwich. My favorite part was not being rushed:) I will be back soon:)

Delicious Gyro! The best I've had in NOLA. Go try it ! A distinct tzaziki sauce with fresh red onion and tomatoes and lettuce.  Served nicely wrap in a fresh and warm pita.  Generous size portion too !

Go try !

Northeast Auto Service is the best auto repair "shop" my wife and I have used in the past 15 years!
