We found Northeast on Yelp after getting an estimate on our brakes from a local repair shop that we thought was overly expensive.  The local shop (only 2 miles from our home) gave us an estimate of over $1300 to replace both the front and rear brake pads and rotors on our van (or $1000 for just the rear).  That shop also told us we needed new calipers and hoses.

We contacted Northeast within a few hours of getting that estimate.  Brian told us that he could do front and rear brake pads and rotors for "less than $900".  We took our van to Northeast the next day.  Brian called us in a timely manner and told us that we did not need new calipers and that our final bill (for front and rear brake pads and rotors) would be under $600...

Brian is awesome to work with...very friendly, very knowledgeable, very experienced...

We got the work we needed done on our van for less than half what the "other shop" wanted to charge us!  We highly recommend Northeast Auto Service to anyone in the Indianapolis area!

Great shop and amazing products. However unfortunately at this shop I had a reading with a woman named Kat Reade, my reading at the shop was so great I reached out to the woman again for another tarot reading. I sent the woman the money for the tarot reading and she has dodged me for about 3 months now no reading and no refund. I hate that the reflects on the store however I want to warn future patrons of this store about this reader so they don't get their money stolen too.

Came here to only drink on a Friday night with a couple of friends. It was packed but there is a lot space outside so it was still nice. We grabbed a couple of seats and it was very nice to just chill and drink with friends. I will definitely be back!

Went here for late lunch prior to a movie. Looking at seafood, which a friend had suggested, but salad bar looked so good we decided to go lighter. We did opt for the shrimp fondue appetizer which was excellent but a bit greasy.

Salad bar was fantastic with many options. Lettuce, spinach, beets, onions, carrots, peas & wasabi peas, garbanzos, cucumber slices, zucchini slices (!), grape tomatoes, sliced mushrooms and more. Even pickled artichokes! Rarely see that. Plus potato salad, broccoli salad, carrot salad, pasta salad and apple salad. And peaches, grapes and cottage cheese, plus more.

And for another pleasant surprise, my Raspberry iced tea was delicious! When I was finishing my first glass I found crushed raspberries in it. Who does that? Great!

Woodlands is a great restaurant located on the West side of Nashville. It is close to the Parthenon and service is great. The food is authentic and tasty. They have a wide variety of options - cuisine from the North and South of India. The restaurant can get a little busy during lunch hours, but that is a good sign that the food is great and tasty. I recommend this location to anyone wanting to try great Indian cuisine in the greater Nashville area.

I have been going to INails regularly since November of 2019. I get a gel manicure each time that's lasts not a day shy of 3, sometimes 4, weeks. No chipping, no peeling, no breaking. The owner and his wife are very professional and ensure that you are satisfied at the end of each visit. All staff are family and work great as a team to accommodate short wait times. Prices are extremely reasonable and worth the quality of work.

This is my go-to place when I want something to eat when I'm in St. Louis. Fast, fresh, healthy, and affordable. I'm a fan of the ahi tuna poke bowl, and the holy shiitake roll and bowl. I'm sure I'll like just about anything there, but I've loved these two so much that I haven't gotten myself to try anything else...yet. And, oh yeah, the wonton chips are addictive.

When was the last time you called a store and someone who actually knew what they were talking about answered the phone? This place is awesome. The lady who helped us was so friendly and knowledgeable, we think she might be a professional chef. We needed a specific item for a special dish, and it was New Year's Eve. No time to waste! So we called ahead to make sure they had it. The staffer who answered the phone knew exactly what we needed and knew how many the store had in stock. We hightailed it over to make our purchase, and she even gave us some cooking tips! Thanks, Kitchen Kapers!

Worst steak and shake I've ever been to. All workers are playing and talking and not paying attention to customers. Took long to be seated and checked out. They'll look at you and notice your there but ignore you. Waitress would just throw things on table. So many things wrong. Won't be back.
Beer is alright, pizza is meah. Service is even worse then pizza. Skip this place if possible.

After reading all of the positive reviews, a friend and I decided to give it a try. It wasn't bad but the other reviews made it sound awesome so we were disappointed more than anything else. 

It's a very small place but service is spotty. Our entrees arrived about 5 minutes apart. The veggie platter was very disappointing: the falafel was dry (overcooked and burnt on one side) plus they only give you three and a tiny bit of sauce on top. The hummus was bland and the salad was nondescript (and they didn't give you the option of getting something other than the garden salad; my friend would have gladly paid extra to get the tabbouleh salad instead). 

I had the beef kabob platter. There was nothing very kabob-like about this as it was more of a long, thin meatloaf that, like the hummus, lacked any spice. The platter had a choice of rice OR pita. Given that the platter is served with hummus, BOTH would have been a reasonable thing to include especially since it was $10. I'm pretty sure tossing in a piece of pita bread wouldn't have put them out of business. 

The restaurant was quite busy so obviously people enjoyed the food but we found it to be overpriced and bland. It wasn't bad but I expected something better than the Olive Garden of Middle Eastern cuisine.
Love the Toy Drop ! Owners and staff are super nice and stock all the best stuff!  A great place to visit for toys and LEGO resale shop partnered next door ! Woo hoo!!!

This is my favorite of the Reginelli's locations. They are very friendly, prompt and consistent. I never leave disappointed. The manger on duty, Matt, was always checking on tables and making sure everyone was taken care of.  My favorites are the Chicken Salad and the tomato basil soup.
My first time ever having cheesy grits and I fell in love! Yummmm... when I come back to NOLA Willa Jean will most definitely be on my list to visit again!

Ok so I had to clear the hype & tried the CBO's! Yes! They are amazing! I had a simple combo platter of shrimp/catfish. Really good & portions are huge! Almost everyone at our table enjoyed their meal & the one who didn't is a picky eater & disliked a particular spice. Great ambiance & Ana was a fantastic server! Also, if you park in the Hilton garage, bring your parking stub & your server will validate it for you for discounted parking! Not too shabby!

I'd have to agree strongly with the review by Bixley on 12/3. Went there yesterday evening (New Year's Day) and figured that maybe the inadequate service and medium burgers coming out charred was just on account of being there on a bad day. I mean, who really wants to work on 1/1 anyways?

I went there with a fairly large group considering the space, my party was seven people - all of which ordered a burger aside from one po'boy sandwich. And of those 6 burgers, 3 of them were the Kelly's Burger - and I'm pretty sure they were all requested as medium. Not sure what part a charred-tasting extra-well done patty is considered medium, but mine was most definitely not medium. The fries that accompanied it also appeared to have been diced, perhaps I just got the shaft with bottom of the bag crumbs or something. The fries were also seasoned, which was great but probably bad for some as I don't think I saw any indication that they'd be as such on the menu.

The food not living up to my expectations could have been forgivable if the service had been better. Our waitress ran back and forth without so much even asking out of courtesy as my group of friends grew thirsty with empty water glasses. It's not like the place is huge or anything either. There's what, 6 or 7 tables max?

Willing to give the place another shot on account of having a good beer selection and the hopeful promise that if done right, their burger could quite possibly be one of the best. But for now, 3 stars is probably too generous and forgiving.

First off, I must give props where props are deserved. This restaurant had a great atmosphere. Unfortunately, that's all I have to say good about this place (hey, I needed a reason for one star instead of zero.) When my friend and I were promptly sat, our drink and food order was taken. It took about 45 minutes to get our sushi. One would assume a food you don't cook shouldn't take more time than a well-done steak. Mind you, as we were waiting for our order, people who had sat down 20 minutes after we did had their dinner before us. The food was mediocre. Honestly, I get better sushi at Dierburgs. Long story short, if you are hungry, don't come here unless you can mask the hunger pains eating Sweet & Low like I did.
Can I just say PANCAKES, PANCAKES, PANCAKES! Yummy! I dream about their breakfast. Staff are nice and my order has always been correct.

Nobody delivers to my area so cant speak on that service but I do carry out time to time after leaving the gym next door. Food is good and 1 plate is enough to last 2 days only downside everytime I order it takes over 45 mins for them to prepare my food so order wayyyy ahead of time. Also dont eat here on your lunch break even if you get 1 hour breaks because youll still be late for work.

I have a medium-long beard and I have tried to trim it up at home with *some* success but I tried this place and Matt took my beard seriously and trimmed it to perfection. I have been back several times to see him and have never been disappointed. Worth the $10 for a professional beard-trimming. Two thumbs way up.

I stopped in on this place to meet a client on a bit of a whim and I am glad I did. 

This place is located across the street from two major chains of sandwich makers. I suggest you give this place a shot. They have a couple unique aspects to sandwiches, like pretzel bread..mmmmm. 

A previous post had mentioned the line and lack of seating, i experienced the same deal.....waited a long time to have my order taken but not very long to get my sandwich. 

Really close to a four. maybe next visit will call for a 4star rating!

My beau used to live NOLA and I've visited once before. We both like a good oyster po'boy. Patrick's isn't too far from home, so we made a trip over for a late lunch. We each ordered an Oyster Po'Boy: beau got a large with a side of chips and I got a half with touffe. Be warned, the full sandwich is HUGE. My husband ordered it with the intention of taking the other half home. 

The Po'Boy is one of the best I've had in awhile. The oysters are fresh, had a great flavor, and were crispy. The seasoning has a good kick, but not too much (I'm a wuss when it comes to spicy foods). Beau loves spicy food, so he added some hot sauce to his. The bread, which really makes the po'boy sandwich unique, is crusty on the outside, soft on the inside, just like it's supposed to be. 

The chips are thick-cut but super crunchy with some heavy seasoning on them. The seasoning isn't hot--kinda garlicky with paprika, maybe. 

The touffe is thick and flavorful--a crawfish gravy over fluffy rice. 

Service was pretty good. Ordering the food at the counter was easy. For lunch, there's no silverware, napkins, salt + pepper, etc. on the table, so you have to get it yourself or have someone bring it to you with your food. Once you order at the counter, you are given your drink (soda, tea, beer, or wine), and sit at a table. The food is brought out to you. 

We will definitely try this place again. Maybe for dinner next time. Now we gotta get some bread pudding to go. ;-)
Since I've moved out of Philly, there are few things I miss as much as Red Hook's breakfast sandwiches. So. Damn. Good.

I've been coming here to get Dr. Grossman facials and eyelash tints for years! My skin and eyes are very sensitive, so usually after a peel or a tint, I'm all pink and gross. However, whatever they're using here is super mild but effective! Lashes always looked lovely without pink eyes and there is no irritation on my sensitive skin after a peel. Now that I moved away I still come here when I'm in town. 

The space is phenomenally beautiful and the owner is always there being adorable and helpful and super welcoming/friendly. She proud of her salon and her leadership shines through in her personnel and space. I could hang in here for hours - and I have! Once I was just chilling sipping on champagne (they'll hook you up it's great) and they offered me a pedicure (not free but they were like "Want to get your toes done?"). Oh baby! They pedicure spot is so cute and they did a great job. 

Now, I was here last week and needed a New Year's Eve bikini wax. I went with Cydney who is sweet, hilarious, smart, and on that cool girl stuff. I've had so many bikini waxes in my life I can't tell you how hair even grows there still. This was the best. The hard wax they use is thin and the ripping-your-hair-out part was PAINLESS, painless honey! Well if you're new to waxing you might hurt but I was like, "Hmmm usually painless means not working," but I haven't had a single ingrown hair or red spot, and my bikini looked fresh that night (or so I was told, if you know what I mean-what I'm saying is I got laid people!). She also waxed my legs - painless. 

Support local CBD business! Support women who are business owners and independent money makers! Support Cydney she's amazing, especially if you need a wax. You'll love Buff's prices, people, parking options (some meters but some free spots around), and the space itself. 

Take it from me, folks: I spent a lot of time and money in salons (yes I'm broke whatever) and this is my favorite in New Orleans and THE WORLD!

I recommend an appt on the weekend/in the evening so CBD parking is easier.

Nice little English pub in East Nashville; tasty hops and really good mules (liquor drinks) their shtick, sandwiches made using pretzel halves instead of bread. I had the black bean sandwich with melted cheddar and carmelized onions and a couple of cold frothy Country Boy ipa (Lexington). Not too bad, maybe a little pricey. The outdoor patio was also a nice place to sit and people watch.

I've heard about the St. Pete location for a couple years now so was super excited when I heard one was coming to Wesley Chapel. Went there with my wife and two young children. We ordered a meatball pizza, the salmon dish, a house salad and a small Mac and cheese. Everything was fantastic. Probably the best Salmon dish we've ever had. The Mac and cheese was incredible as well, not your typical restaurant Mac and cheese. The meatballs on the pizza were great, as well as the fresh mozzarella, basil and caramelized onions. Highly recommend Noble Crust. We can't wait to go back and try other menu items.

This is the worst pharmacy. They can never fill a prescription right, without taking forever and asking for your first born child. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt after going here for 5+ years. But I'm done, my last 10 experiences here have been horrible. Horrible customer service.

The help was so helpful and friendly and the milkshakes were great but the place looked and felt dirty. The floor was so slippery all in our party felt like we would slip and fall. The bathrooms needed attention too.
Yes they food is good but the service is very slow and the drive thru takes way too long sometimes I want chic fil a before I got to work but they take too long and I won't get to work on time
I've only been there once so all I know at this point is that the Dan Dan Noodle and potstickers are OUTSTANDING. The noodles are to die for. I am definitely going back and trying some other things!

Best hamburgers in Philly!
I've tried lots of places in city center, and nobody comes close, the meat is delicious, love the Kobe burger.
Definitely the most tasty burgers in town

The "Big Blue" as it is lovingly called, is one of the best in the Midwest.  Everything is great about this hotel.  The staff's hospitality is as impressive as this magnifcient structure.  The concierge and the restaurants inside the hotel give lodgers plenty of dining options.  The rooms are the best I've seen.

Dadeo's was a very friendly! We all had Po Boys and they were very tasty, good bang for your buck! Best sweet potatoe fries I've ever had hands down! I would definitely go back. The only weird thing is that it is 18+ and from the outside it looks pretty family friendly.

Hit or miss
Had good luck but sometimes the food is bland.
From Chicago and other places are closer to good Chicago style food.

I had a massage today by Amanda at The French Pharmacie.  She did a superb job.  She listened when I told her my problem areas.  She noticed when there were trouble spots and took extra care to relieve the area.  I would say that Amanda by far gave me the best massage I've ever had.

My brother's wedding is in 3 days and I just realized I have a terrible farmers tan and my dress is strapless!  EEK!

A friend of mine had used MysticTan a few years ago with some success, but I didn't trust myself to turn around in the machine and get even coverage without falling over or hurting myself.  I did a quick google search and found Air-Tan.

Air-Tan is great.  A person airbrushes the tanning solution on your body so you get even coverage and no drips!  

I am pretty awkward about my body, but my airbrush artist, Megan, explained the whole process and made sure that I was comfortable throughout.

I opted to not go too dark because I didn't want to look weird.  It evened out my farmers tan and gave me a nice glow, but I don't look too different.

Also, I was astonished at how cheap it is - only $30.  TOTALLY WORTH IT.

Second time in a month I've been here and I am solidly impressed. Every staff member is friendly, professional, and prompt. They had my tire replaced and rotated in about 30 minutes from dropoff. They didn't push unnecessary upsells, made the customer happy and I'll definitely refer business to this location. Mark? The manager has his team on point.

I probably had the best jerk chicken I've ever had in my life so far last night! Timothy who's the owner is the one who takes care of all the cooking and he's a wonderful man who's very passionate about his business which reflects on the food quality! Will be back again and again!

The folks at Franklin did a great job repairing the rear gate on my Subaru.  Everyone there was extremely courteous and made the process both simple and pleasant.  They also detailed my car for free, which was a welcome surprise when I picked it up!!

I have never had issues in the 17 years I've lived here. The airport is small but nicely remodeled and well-maintained. Fun to gamble a bit before you leave on a flight. Security usually takes less than 20 minutes.

Love their spinach pie. Very clean kitchen area you can see when you order. Dining area also very clean as well. Enjoyed all the food we had here and the people working are also very nice. too. Used to go to Greek City but prefer this place now!!!

The following is the text of an email I sent to SEPTA Customer Service.
The following occurred Friday 7/24/2015 at 1:40pm.

Men's and Women's lavatories were closed for a period of 45 minutes.  This was and is unacceptable.  No one of the staff seemed to have a key to open them.  The  man that eventually opened them up may or may not been watching from the upper walkway according to a conversation I overheard from another irate customer.

The young man at the customer service counter, I didn't get his name, was very sympathetic to the situation and made two calls to customer service, one of which I overheard.

Our first stop before the johns pass seafood festival.  Their Sunday special $3.00 Bloody Mary.  The bartender is a little older maybe in her 50's. Therefore she was a bit slower..(example:) she asked what we wanted ... grabbed 3 cold bars glasses n walked away.... she never actually took our order.  On to the bloody Mary bar, some Sundays it's great with lots of variety and others its just a handful of things that run out and take a little bit to replenish.  For $3.00 you get a decent pour of well vodka with a good view and a relaxed atmosphere. I have not ordered much here except the fish spread (Amazing) and the Cuban sandwiches are decent.  I would deff come back and give more of the menu a try and always for the Bloody Marys!
Stopped by after a long week of camping, and missing desi food. We were not disappointed. Spicy murg vindaloo, fresh naan, hot samosas. Service was good. Recommended.

We just moved to the Philadelphia area and we had a few large ticket items that we could just not get without some help. We called Helping Hands Movers and received a very fast response. Two very nice gentlemen showed up right on time! They unloaded our Uhaul very fast and carried the items up two flights of VERY narrow stairs. The service was fast and professional. I would definitely use Helping Hands Movers again!

We have two dogs, a Shih-Tzu and a Corgi Terrier, who have been getting groomed at A Touch Of Class for almost a year.  The prices are reasonable and we have always been very happy with the services.  I would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a good groomer!

Here's the scoop on Becker's. Becker's is a casual dress, pub grub type of establishment, not haute cuisine. The wait staff is friendly, beer selection teriffic, the burger are great and the sandwiches are very good as well.  If casual laid back friendly service and good pub grub food is what you are looking for, you will find it at Becker's. 

The owners also appear to take an interest in their customers as well. If you sign up for their mailing list, and provide the month and day of your birth,  you will receive a birthday gift in the form of a coupon for a free appetizer and dessert.. Nice touch.
Coffee is watered down and some of the staff are rude.  Would avoid this Dunkin'.

Perfect, authentic food AND the service was amazing. The waitress was extremely helpful and attentive. Definitely ranks among the best ramen in the Northeast. Plus they take cards, unlike most ramen joints.

The food is good, especially for late night fare. My biggest problem with this spot is the service. Speed of service in particular, I waited an hour for a po boy and fries on an early Saturday afternoon.
Three visits, each with great service and great food.  The men's room has great tile work, but was in need of a bit of a freshening up on my most recent visit.

I've been here a few times. 2 brunches and 2 dinners. The brunch meals I have ordered were amazing and this is definitely a good brunch place. For dinner, I once just had a cup of their vegetarian chili which was amazing! Definitely will get a Bowl the next time. However, I was not so thrilled about their salmon burger. It was mashed up salmon with other ingredients. I thought it was going to be a piece of grilled salmon in a bun. Whatever was mixed with the salmon and the sauce that was drizzled on top of the patty did not go well together. The salmon burger lacked some flavor.

I'll have to find something else on their menu for a dinner option.
A favorite restaurant of my wife and I! Good food!
Inside Woody's. Pretty dead and nothing special. Music was fun. The decor was a cross between 90's gangsta rap and Fox's hit series 'Empire'.
I have been working out for more than 40 years and these clowns are the worse I have ever run across.  Do not let them lie to you and take your money because that is what they are all about.

**movie trailer guy voice** In a world filled with fast food and bad pizza joints...

This place is quite literally a breath of fresh air. It's the only place where a quick, inexpensive meal that's made with real food can be purchased as far as the eye can see. Think of it as a fast casual version of Mongolian BBQ.  Pick a starch, a meat, veggies, a sauce and they grill it up for customers. 

The interior setup is awkward with customers having to cut the line in order to fill their cups with ice and tea, which are positioned opposite each other. Besides that though, I'm a fan. 

I ordered the subtlety spicy finadene chicken with brown rice, broccoli and mushrooms and left not even a grain of rice in the bowl. I finished it off with a piece of crazy good carrot cake, and washed it all down with some u sweetened tea. With the tip, it cost me about $15.

We were taken to this restaurant by our son. He said he had been there recently, saying the food and service was really good.  They did not disappoint us. 
We had a party of five and asked for seating in the patio area. They didn't have any cleared tables, however immediately cleared and cleaned one for us. I later realized it was the manager that was clearing tables to help the serving staff.

      Our waitress was very helpful with the various menu items, both food and drinks. She was very prompt with any request, or plate removal. She also made our dinner a relaxing, fun social event. We have been in the area for a week, and this place was probably our best dining experience so far. We will be back!
Had a great experience.  Luccua was fantastic - very accommodating, and positively impacted my experience, which I think is rare at car dealerships!

Seafood dept. knife was so dull it ripped the tuna he said no one would let him sharpen knife. I find that hard to believe  I fished for tuna most of my life awful to see fish destroyed like that. He was fine with it I left it on the shelf. Will shop elsewhere. Capt. Dissapointed

I went to Modish Nails, and I will say this I love there services, and I'm a flight attendant and I've gotten my nails done everywhere. I love the ladies here, and the men are awesome. You gotta try Modesh Nails! Cherry
Really good food with a very fun and beautiful atmosphere. Yes, the wait can be long but it's a fun place.

This is the best place to eat in Idaho. The wait staff are very welcoming. The price is perfect. Very clean environment. They cut there own meat which is top quality product, house made dressings and sauces. The thing i really like it's that it's easy to get to, and in a great location for when ever you have to eat a real meal.

Mmmm. Talk about some good pizza and their prices aren't too shabby either.  I eat here frequently since it's only 5 minutes up the road from me. I can go pickup a large 2 topping for under $9 tax and all, there's not any other pizza places around town where you can do that. I haven't tried any of their other food as I'm perfectly content with pizza. They've got one of the best marinara sauces I've ever had and their mozzarella cheese sticks are mouth watering.
If you haven't caught on yet, I'm a big fan of this place. I highly suggest you go try it out if your around town. You can do take-out/delivery/or dine in. They have a good size dining room with servers who tend to you. If you go on a weekend sometimes they have a live band or singer on the stage. That's right,  they have a small stage as well. Good times. Go. Try. Enjoy.  -TnT-

I have been to Pancake Pantry more times to count, and I will continue going their until I move away from Nashville or I die. I'm not much of a breakfast person, but I don't know what they put in their pancakes, but I've never tasted any other pancake that good. Seriously every single type I've tried is a whole new taste of magic. I've waited for an hour and half before and I will still proclaim its worth any amount of wait time. There is nothing better in the world than their Pecan Pancakes with their special syrup. 

Fun tip: If you want eggs and a meat with your speciality pancakes, on their eggs and "insert breakfast meat" combos that come with three pancakes, you can sub out for 2 speciality pancakes.. highly recommend this route, but even their eggs taste better than any eggs I've had anywhere else. 

Its nicely priced too. Service is always great! I don't know how the ladies do it in there, but they are sweet and so efficient and on top of everything.

Good place for a beer or inexpensive lunch or maybe a wildcat game. It's bar food. Cool that is a Navy and SEAL themed and your supporting a vet. If your looking for a bar is a good option. 

Burgers used to be awesome but then they were hit and miss so I have since given up on them. I don't like wasting my cheat meals. So I usually get the chicken skewers app as a meal for my healthy choice. 

I do feel the food has been inconsistent, seems like product gets changed a lot like different buns, fries. But the service is always good, great servers. One of the bartenders used to pour a great guiness.

Burger changed my life. De Rigeur = cocktail I want to drink all the time.

http://mealsihaveeaten.blogspot.com/2010/09/this-burger-changed-my-life.html

Really wanted to like this place, but sadly, I dont like anything about it. 

We ordered four rolls off the specialty rolls, and they were mediocre. And VERY VERY SMALL. 6 tiny pieces to be exact on these rolls, execpt for one that was 8. Such skimpy sushi. $42 for a bland meal. Unfortunate.

First time I've had dinner here, and I can't say enough about how much I love this resturant! The service is outstanding, the food is fantastic and the abiance is warm and inviting. Dinner for one with two glasses of wine is $50 so come prepared  ... but if you need a nice night out this is the place!

Dr. Davidson did cataract surgery on both of my eyes. It was done quickly and with absolutely perfect results. I couldn't ask for better results in a better attitude from him. I have and will continue to recommend him to anyone I know that needs cataract surgery.

I've come here twice since first writing my review, as recently as 12/12/15. I stand firmly by my initial assertion that this is the best restaurant I've been to in Philly. How is it possible that the food can be even more delicious every time? I don't know, but Khmer Kitchen makes it happen. My sister and I got the fried calamari again, the weekend special which was a coconut curry soup situation, the lemongrass beef stir fry made extra spicy, and the caramelized pork. Sigh. Just wonderful. This time the lemongrass beef was tender and delicious! And wow...they weren't joking about the spice. We might have to go down a few spice levels next time. Basically everything I wrote before about the dishes we'd already had rang true this time as well. The surprise was in the weekend special. Wow...it was everything we didn't even realize we needed. The flavors were complex, warming, with a hint of sweetness and spice. I loved the giant, soft chunks of potato and carrot. My goodness, it was delicious. 

I love this place. I will take everyone I care about here, and you should too. 

Oh yeah, our waiter is always awesome! Really attentive and doesn't mind that we ask for a million bowls of rice :)

I had been here a year or two ago and enjoyed the atmosphere and my services, and decided to try Glossy 130 out again a few weeks ago when back in the area. Sadly, it didn't live up to my previous visit, and I won't be returning. 

The Good: 

Easy to make an appointment. Guy at the counter (the owner? Not sure.) was very friendly and welcoming. Good polish selection. Nice touch with offering a drink during service. 

The Bad: 

Bad ventilation; smelled like chemicals - you know, that "bad nail salon" overwhelming smell. My tech seemed miserable - barely spoke, in monotone, and was extremely rough. Started with a pedicure, and she cut me accidentally on the first toe. Seemed rushed and inattentive. "Massage" of feet / legs with pedicure was actually painful - in a "I feel your nails digging into my skin" way, not a "you're working out knots" way. My pedicure took 10 mins less time than the person who started the same level of pedicure right next to me at the same time, logically because my tech was clearly rushing - I was ok with that, though, as I just wanted the grumpy , rushed service over so I could move on to the manicure I'd also scheduled. 

If only it were that simple, though. Nail tech didn't give me any (I have no ide what they're called, so let's call them...) toe-separator-thingees, then had me follow her (walking fast) to a manicure table. Well, in my attempt to follow her quickly, my second toe swiped my big toe, and since the polish was crazy thick and wet, the polish squished away from about 1/5 of that toenail. The guy from up front (owner?) happened to notice and told the tech to fix it; she leaned down to do it under the manicure table where she either thought I couldn't see or just didn't care if I saw her remove the polish and do only one single coat of color to replace it - no base, no second coat, no top coat.

Then we moved on to the manicure - no option for me to select shape; tech started clipping without asking / before I realized to say something. She grabbed the wrong gel color when I selected one from a set of nail examples, though thankfully I caught that. Randomly and with no explanation my tech then left and had someone else take the reigns, who moved me to a new station. New tech was significantly friendlier, so while the switch was surprising and not explained, that worked out better in the long run. 

Overall: this felt more like a cliche mall establishment, with the smell, rushed feeling, lack of attention to detail, and seemingly unhappy staff. Maybe it was just an off day for one tech, but I'm turned off enough that I'm not going to try it again to find out.
Awesome place to get drinks and watch free live music. A nice spacious bar upstairs with a lounge style room. Nice live music thu, fri and Sat nights.

The first time we dined at the Barrel back in March was phenomenal. Visited again last night and our experience was lack luster... there was a faint smell of vomit wafting throughout the dinning room. We ordered the Chilean Seabass. It was incredibly over cooked, tough and chewy. The pappardelle pasta with creamy vodka sauce lacked flavor. Luckily our server was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Amazing coffee and prices! Housed in a little cute drive through. They have some fancy drinks that you don't find elsewhere! I got the Irish creme breve. Yummy. :) our wait was very short, there was only one other car in line. When it was our turn the server was very friendly and fast!

Really liked this place - inviting on the outside with some outdoor seating and stringed lights. The inside was darker and there are several rooms with seating in the back. You first walk into a very basic bar front with a pool table. Really friendly service and a good beer selection. Will be coming back to try the food!

I found V Street incredibly disappointing.  While I'm neither vegan nor vegetarian, I always appreciate vegetable oriented dishes that push the envelope flavor wise.  I found almost every dish I tried at V Street to rely too heavily on overwhelming spicy, heat.  

A run-down:
Za'atar Corn: frozen corn, overly spiced :(
Kung Pao Green Beans: too spicy, not well executed
Peruvian fries: these were the best items we had but I feel that fried potatoes drenched in sauce is cheating (and super unhealthy)
BBQ Seitan tacos: ok
Korean Fried tempeh reuben: this was decent 

The cocktails were good.  I particularly enjoyed the Miles Davis in Byblos

Another strike against V Street: we sat at the bar and were not informed that a food photographer would be monopolizing the space.  We were quite uncomfortable and self conscious that we would be in the shots and we kept having to move out of the way so that he could achieve the angles he desired.  It made for a fairly unpleasant experience.  I would not return.

Went here mostly because it was near where I parked and I had a craving for Chinese food. So I went in not expecting much. But it was really good! And very reasonably priced. What I wanted was not on the menu but they accommodated my request. I'll go back!

Neat store, I love the history.
The sales help is helpful.

I forgot my coupon , and they lent me 
One....so cool.

I've had coffee there a few times (umm, I think we already know how great that is), but today we had lunch there. The French Drip is absolutely delicious! The roast beef is cooked to perfection and is loaded with deliciously caramelized onions and melted gruyere on a crusty roll. I wanted to drink the broth provided on the side, but I thought that would make me look like an ass. I had a glass of the Rioja, which was an excellent complement to the roast beef. The atmosphere is also very nice. A bit different from the current offerings on Frankford Ave, but lovely nonetheless. I'll be back and will be bringing others.

Be warned - I have a limited perspective of the menu. I went here for Happy Hour and just ordered a side of fries. I was not too impressed. The fries seemed overcooked and soggy (and at times burned). The upside is that the side came with A LOT of fries, so you can easily make a meal out of it. I tried the blueberry cornbread, which was good - but it was a little dry for my tastes. The mac and cheese was a solid option though. This place seems to be known for their drinks/burgers, so it might be worthwhile to come by to try that.
had great experience there rented a gun to see what I like thanks jr will be back again

On a recent trip to NOLA we were looking for a good Italian restaurant. Our friends are seafood eaters so we needed something with fishy stuff as well. I found The Italian Barrel and everyone was happy. Our friends has some salad with various ocean creatures and they said it was great. We started with bruschetta and it was the best bruschetta ever - and we have had it many places!

My wife and I had pasta meals and both were great. Our friends had pasta with fish and they loved it also. Predinner drinks and wine were also good.

We sat outside which I would recommend. Inside is crowded and was very loud. It was totally full inside so it looked like no one minded but it was more peaceful outside.

Definitely a winner!

These guys are awesome!!!!   They fixed my jammed SIM card on my SAMSUMG Galaxy  6+ Edge and saved me over $200 because I would have had to file an insurance claim for it to be fixed.  

Great customer service and they fixed my phone same day!  I would highly recommend them!!!

No shortage of great chow in NOLA. My primary stop has always been the Bon Ton Cafe-still great and will continue but Ron's is now a new go to for me. This place is the real deal. Chef Ron is cooking and looking at you as you eat. Your not happy, he is not happy. The balls are the best, jambalaya & gumbo were better than any I recall. I so wish that I had had room for dessert-next time. Strip mall space, unassuming but if you want great food-find this place. Food 5 , Staff 5, Stuffyness 0

To Whitney W. and the team at Reis Nichols, I wanted to write to thank you for a seamless, pleasurable, and hassle-free experience at Reis Nichols while buying our wedding rings. We appreciated your kind demeanor and responsiveness to our needs, and that you had no problem keeping us within our desired price range while getting us exactly what we were looking for! We will certainly be back as customers in the future!

I had an appointment with the Genius Bar and I must say the staff was very efficient. I was able To get my problem resolved in no time. The guy that was helping me was super friendly and everything he was explaining that was wrong with my MBP was understandable. I would highly recommend this location, definitely better than the galleria.

Really nice massage place located in Snap  fitness on 109 street! Natalie is an awesome massage therapist and the central location is totally ideal to grab a 45 min or 60 min massage on your lunch break. Beautiful massage room as well and she offer direct billing to those with benefits!
The staff here are very nice, accommodating and attentive. The food was good, we would go back. The one bad thing, on the day we went, it was very hot inside, but I would still go back

Low key place with good beers on draft. Their burgers are solid, definitely try the blackened green beans. Despite how it looks from the outside, it's a kid friendly establishment with lots of food offerings for your tyke. If they're fussy, promise them a fro-yo from igloo next door after your meal :)
The staff was so polite! They did hot stones under my feet during my pedicure and put a hot wax on my heels. It was awesome!!!!
Great place excellent Tequila selection.  Blackberry Mint margarita is worth stopping for!!!   Food is excellent and large portions.   Staff is friendly.   Highly recommended.
Second time here and the consistency in food is awesome. I wouldn't mind driving here all the way from Philly to eat Indian food.

superb service.

superb products.

excellent turnaround time.

they truly know what they are doing.

they put our young son at ease.

everyone seems to be a trained tailor.  

experienced and knowledgeable.

Should be 2.5 stars. The menu sounds amazing, but this places is hot as ballz and I don't mean in a cool way. You will sweat your ass off upstairs! The food was decent, but too many flavors made the taste overwhelming. Fries are good, but you will pay 2 bucks for each small jar of ketchup. So pay attention. I've eaten gluten free for 3 1/2 years and these were prob the worst buns. Super dry! Interesting experience with hipster vibe, but I'll prob never come back.

Had a cup of the Thai Basil Coconut & Rose Water w/ candied rose petals. F#% your vanilla. Lol

2 different ice creams but belonged together like they had the same parents. 

The Cookie Monster, roasted pistachio, red velvet, honey lavender, earl grey tea were also major highlights. Don't go anywhere else for a cool treat until you go here.

Highly recommend. I would definitely return. Wonderful staff.  Gigi did my manicure and pedicure and she is great.  She made sure I approved my nail color before proceeding.  She made sure my nails were dry before leaving.  Gave it 5 stars for the following reasons: 1) place did not smell 2)organized nail polish (wall of OPI and ESSIE)  3)nail polish section was organized by color so it was easy to browse through 4) quick and great.

I heard friends talk about the food here but I just never tried it out bc maybe I was scared maybe I was just lazy bc it is in the county. But man, when I did go the first thing I ordered was the fried tilapia and jollaf rice. It was so good. Came right out.piping hott and so authentic. I thought I had landed in Africa with my first bite. So I continue to come to AP about once a week and I have since then had just about everything on the menu and off. For first timers I would recommend the beef, jollaf rice, and plantains. So good. And I'm telling you once you eat it you will get periodic cravings which you will just have to fill. I really enjoy the place and it really feels like a little family when you walk in. Everyone is so friendly and the staff is pretty great.

Best burger I've ever had. Friends convinced me to add the fried egg in addition to my caramelized onion and bleu cheese. Absolute score!
The seasonal beer was an oatmeal brown ale that was fantastic.

OUSTANDING location for Santa Barbara getaway!  This boutique inn has cute cottages, well suited for sandy kids and pets (linoleum floors), a pretty courtyard with classic Santa Barbara arches, Spanish tiles, fountains and bouganvilla.  GREAT location a block and across the street from the beach!  

They have some nice touches such as coffee and continental breakfast in the morning and fresh fruit in the afternoon.  

I will definitely stay here again and prefer to be off the main street in a quieter location such as this.

Crazy Sushi is a popular sushi joint located conveniently near the shops of Chestnut St. I have read many reviews of both Crazy Sushi and Vic Sushi (see review) so I decided to try them both.

From the outside, Crazy Sushi looks like a typical sushi hole-in-the-wall. When you enter, it quickly turns a bit fancier. Dim lighting, nice tables, clean bathroom - a solid looking restaurant. I dined in at around 5:00 PM on a Sunday and was the only guest. But, onto the food.

I ordered a spicy tuna crunch roll, a mango/avocado roll, and an order of tamago sashimi. The food came out quickly and the waiter was friendly and polite. The presentation was also beautiful. They served my sashimi on a mountain of ice with the rolls to the side. However, I was rather disappointed with the food, especially after reading the reviews. The spicy tuna roll was incredibly dry. It seemed like it was 85% crunchy, and 15% tuna. The avocado/mango roll was actually very good, but not worth $7. The tamago was just okay, would not order it again from here. 

Although the menu had a plethora of choices, ranging from sushi appetizers (one I recall was spicy tuna wrapped in seabass) to a two page special roll list, the sushi fell short and I do not think I will be returning. These reviews are a bit Crazy.

Pulled in Sunday for dinner. This would have been our 3rd visit. Was greeted by an attendant who said their parking lot was full (though there were about 10 empty spaces) - was told "sorry". Pulled around and saw another guard and he suggested we find public parking somewhere. I asked why couldn't we park in the empty spaces he said because those were saved? We've been their before and the food is decent. The fishtank is the awesome. But this service is not what I would expect from a nicer restaurant. Sorry to say, I'll be scratching this off my list.

Went there for lunch I ordered a #1 with no ketchup I hate ketchup got back to work with a whopper with cheese and only ketchup and you dumb fucks want 15.00 you can't even follow orders it's really not that hard

The food was really good I got the fried shrimp tacos and that sauce was to die for. I also tried the carne asada tacos but they weren't as good. The waiters were so nice and it really is a great place to eat.

Wing Stop, is one of the most affordable meals, that Reno could offer a college student. The meals are not that expensive. For example you could buy a meal with 10 wings, any two different flavors, with a basket of fries. The meal is cooked, right when it is ordered. And it should take up to about 14 minutes to prepare the meal. So you know the meal is fresh. 

The service that the employees provides make you feel as if you are in a family oriented environment. The environment is very clean. They clean up after everyone that leaves, 

THis is a great place to go

Best tapas restaurant I've been to. Wide cheese plate selection. Their is an excellent variety of selections and we had 7 dishes with each being delicious. Fantastic service. Nice location in Olde City and easy to find. Despite being a busy Monday night, we were not rushed yet out within an hour. Looking forward to our next visit.
Food is great and fresh!! Love it here!  Servers are a bit slow at time but that wouldn't stop me from coming back!

How can everything on their menu be so flavorful? But more importantly, who cares? It simply is! At this point I believe I've tried 4 different kinds of their tacos, the chicken tortilla soup, cowboy beans, rice and black beans, all the salsas, guac, and their "almost guilt free" donuts. I'd honestly be hard-pressed to choose a favorite anything. 

Also, despite a poor first experience due to a corporate happy hour taking place while I was dining there, subsequent visits have been quick, courteous, and pleasant! I was in and out in an hour when taking a lunch break for work, even! 

When Nada found out about my lengthy wait times during my first visit they were extremely generous and provided me with a gift card to come back and try them out again. I couldn't help myself - I went back the day I got the gift card in the mail! You'd better believe I'll be back again soon.

Ohhh Stella. You rock. 

I've been here so many times since they first opened, and every visit has been a pleasure. Family and friends are always happy here. First reason might be because the pizza crust here might be the best: so insanely flavorful, with a perfect leopard-spotted undercarriage indicating expertly tended char, plus the right amount of cornicicione. Secondly, the menu offers diners both the complex AND simple pizza options, and there is no 'bad' choice. The balance of flavors--in the simple Margarita or the epically delicious Tartufo--is always on point. 

It seemed appropriate, then, to celebrate true love over a love of pizza. For our rehearsal dinner, Starr Catering (the BEST!) helped us come up with a delightful menu that made all our guests happy in this fun event space. The antipasti course was loaded with so many options, and served family style, that everyone nearly forgot to save room for the main attraction-the pizza, obviously! We went with the margarita for those who like to keep is simple, the spinach because it's amazing, and the tartufo for those willing to be adventurous. Lastly, our servers began bringing out all the flavors of gelato for everyone to sample. In short, nobody left hungry or thirsty and plenty of pizza was packed up to go back with the boys to enjoy later!
A four star Buffet , clean, well lit, restaurant , tonight the seafood delight was wonderful

Hutton staff was great. Very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Although it was wonderful that a shuttle is provided to take you within a 3 mile radius, we almost always waited over a half hour and sometimes up to an hour for the shuttle. When we would call we were often given a 25 minute wait time and after 45 minutes of waiting we'd call again and they'd say another 20 minutes. We often ubered it as a result so the amenity of a free shuttle was a moot point. Also, apparently at a certain hour they give complimentary wine tasting. We were never told about that so we never had the opportunity to enjoy that. We happened upon it one day coming off of the elevator. And don't drink the $7 bottle of water in your room, they give you free bottles of water if you ask at the front desk.  Overall we had a fantastic time in Nashville with a few glitches at the Hutton.

SO- I retracted my first review after the owner contacted me in his defense, and since I can appreciate his efforts, I promised to give the place a 4th chance and re-write my review. ( I was a little dramatic, claiming they "were dead to me", blah blah blah.) NOW I see that many have been contacted by Brendan; so much for being special!

Nevertheless, I WAS able to actually get a seat this time around, though I attribute that to heading over painfully early at 6pm. Still, there were seats to choose from at this point, which was not the case when I had visited before. 

I have to reiterate what a lot of low-star reviewers are saying, which is this: West Philly is a foaming at the mouth for any mediocre establishments, and while the beer at local 44 certainly is NOT mediocre, everything else is just sort of okay. The food was okay, the wait staff has been different every time, sometimes friendly, other times just too busy to care, but the beer stands alone.  The fish tacos and french fries are pretty good, but a mayo dipping sauce for the fries would be awesome.  

This place will stay busy no doubt, and I think they deserve to... but not having a lot of options doesn't mean we have to settle for mediocrity.  And while I may hit up local44 for late-night beer and fries during the week (if space allows,) I just happen to get turned off by hype. And since there are other bars around town with stellar beer AND stellar food, I'm willing to make the trip outside of west philly.  (Though I wouldn't be opposed to another local 44 above 48th street!)

**5 START ALERT, 5 START ALERT**

Great food, right in the middle of the strip.

Customer service is amazing, Ben if you're reading this you're the best!

Unfortunately our New Year's Eve was cut short due to food poisoning. Not something I expect at Creed's or any other fine dining restaurant!  Creed's used to be my favorite restaurant but something went seriously wrong with my last meal. I hope this was an exception to the normal quality that Creed's produces time and time again.

Sincerely,
A concerned customer

This has been by far the worst Boston pizza experience I have had in this city. Apon going for dinner with my family to celebrate my daughter finishing kindergarten. We were promptly seated. That was the only thing that was prompt. Our server hardly came to check on us. Our food was either under cooked or way over cooked. We would have added salt or pepper to our meal. However those basic things were not even at the table!!! I don't recommend this place at all!!!

I work one block away and unfortunately so I constantly have to go to this location The store manager is extremely nice and considerate but at the same time I have waited 15 minutes inside for a coffee and sandwich

Yelena, you're a good woman.

I had a wedding this past weekend, and in true Aimee style, I realized my dress wasn't hemmed about four days before I had to leave. It wasn't just a little long... it was about 4 inches too long. When I called Yelena she said she could get it done, and that she'd just have to charge me a rush fee (which I was more than okay with.) 

I brought it in and she had me try it on... do take the time to do that vs. just telling her how much to take off. The dress ended up being longer in certain places so she really had to pin differently all the way around it. Even with that, though, I had it dropped off in about ten minutes.

When I picked it up on my way to the lake for the wedding, I just gave it a quick glance and was happy to see that the new hem line was flawless. Later that weekend when I put it on, I was even happier... it was the perfect length, just skimming the floor. Happy times indeed.

I'm grateful she was able to help me in a pinch and it was well worth the $35. I'm going to bring her a handful of things next week because I've been waiting to find someone who does such quality work.

Thank you Yelena!

My husband and I are so lucky we found this awesome Motel.  Staff is very friendly, clean and beautiful room. Also, very close by too the beach and good places to eat. We are definitely coming back very soon! We love Carpinteria, people here make the experience so welcoming each and everytime we visit!
The sangria is excellent. Just enough spice, not overdone. Do not miss the chance to have the stone crab bisque.

Our group of 4 came in on a Friday on this holiday weekend. The servers were great and attentive. We all wanted to try multiple samples of the beer, so decided on the Around the World Sampler. It was perfect for the 4 of us. The apps were good. We recommend the beer bread (dense bread with yummy dipping sauces) & the pretzel breadsticks were amazing. 
The portions are large. My group split 2 entrees. We split the prime rib sandwich with a side of potato salad and the other 2 split the mahi tacos with fries. People around us were ordering the mussels which looked good! Nice place! We would definitely go back!

First time here, two of us sat outside. The bartender was decent, knew the menu, and was very friendly and appropriately attentive. We just went in for drinks, but the food menu looked good so we went back about a week later to try it. It was empty on a Sunday afternoon, and two of us sat at the bar. There were four bartenders behind the bar, all avoiding eye contact like it would kill them to throw a menu to us. One had air pods in, looking uninterested. The woman who finally gave us a menu after 11 minutes of sitting at the bar was chewing gum aggressively. We had the menus for about 5 minutes with no drinks, hadn't even gotten the chance to order water. We had no problem leaving and going next door, given no one working there wanted our business at all. Won't be back, and the first experience is the only reason this place deserves more than a star.

Holy meats, Batman! I got the pulled pork and Beau got the trip tip and the burnt ends. I am a little jealous the way he looked at his plate, daaang girrrl! We got the pit beans, chips, and pasta salad as our sides and I was impressed with the beans and the pasta salad. I'd get a large McMarge size for some event or gwthsring it's that good. This place is superb and underrated, I'll definitely be back!
Lots of running room for my big boy and his little sister. They come home clean and tired after a long day of play and I couldn't be more pleased with the customer service!!

I ordered my food through door dash, I can tell the packaging hadn't been tampered with so I couldn't even get frustrated with the dasher. So I called Subway which I spoke with the manger about my food being of poor quality. The bread was stale, and shriveled up, there were jalapeos smushed and infused on the outside of the bread, mayonnaise, oil, and mustard everywhere. Sick! to prepare this for anyone. The manager Julie says, "only I could bring the sandwich up and she'll remake it" Totally inconveniencing me, but I obliged. I get up there and Julie the General manager has the nerve to give me some spill about how they don't do this, and how she is only going to make a 1X exception. Excuse me?  I told her this service was absolutely poor and that I wasn't pleased. That I should at-least be compensated to a 12" in sandwich for my inconvenience, since she wouldn't allow the dasher to reorder it. I paid 8 bucks there and back for a lyft, not to mention the door dash fees. For her to act like this service I received was perfectly fine? Look at this sandwich! Mind you the next sandwich they made looked nothing of the sort. You literally have to watch these people to ensure your food is made right. Sick!
Big and delicious butterfly shrimp. Rude service and no drinks. If they had drinks they'd get an extra star.

I had a hair cut by James on November 13 of this year. I am Nigerian-American and I have natural hair (what naturals call 4c hair texture). I hadn't had a professional hair cut in over a year. The last hair cut I had, I did it myself in the summer of this year. So my hair was in need of some serious love. I went to the salon for a blow out and trim. The assistant washed my hair and then he got to work. 

Let me tell you, he is AMAZING!!! He did a round brush technique to blow out my hair with a blow dryer. Then he gave me the hair cut of a lifetime!! Then he flat ironed my hair. I looked amazing!! The blow out alone was fantastic. I had no idea my hair could look like that. Also, James is very, very talented with all hair types. The woman before me had naturally straight hair. The salon etiquette is great. I was given water while I waited. I only waited because I came so early to the appointment (perhaps 20 minutes early), but I sipped my water for about 3 minutes before I was seated for a hair wash. The entire appointment lasted about an hour and fifteen minutes. For my black sisters out there, that is unheard of. James doesn't overbook. So when you are in the salon, you are the only one there and that makes you feel special. The experience was so soothing and relaxing. I am making an appointment again, and I will recommend him to anyone who wants a bomb hair cut or blow out! 

Now for my ladies with afros, don't be afraid to get your hair done. I'm sure you've had some bad salon experiences in the past. So you may be hesitant, but do not be afraid. James knows hair. I have the thickest, kinkiest, African hair. My natural hair is an afro. He handled my hair like he works afros in his sleep. I am telling you. This man is a hair wizard. I got the hair cut of a lifetime. It looked amazing on my straightened hair, but when I washed my hair and got my curls back... WOW! I fell in LOVE with my afro all over again. The shape is perfect for my afro. I don't know how he did it. He is a hair wizard.

Everything I had was amazing, and our entire group was really happy with what they ordered. Theresa was our waitress & she was fantastic!

I highly recommend the shrimp cocktail, the filet (Oscar style!) and their sea salt caramel ice cream!
Went for Mardi Gras, but finding this bar was probably my favorite part of the weekend.
The Udon salad rocks (so much that I've never even tried anything else except the sweet potato fries (which are equally amazing!

We went to Muriel's for Sunday Jazz brunch. The staff was amazing and made us feel very welcomed. Even though it's a fancy restaurant, they still welcomed our 2 year old daughter and treated her very well. The drinks were excellent. The pork chop was the best I've ever had and that is not an exaggeration!

I've eaten at this location once or twice. I've ordered a few times and had it delivered to my office. But no more shall I have something delivered!

Lots of employees at my work get delivery from here. It's lightning fast. But coming back from my lunch break, I see a Jimmy John's delivery guy.... He stopped his truck in the middle of the business drive blocking a lane. And was PEEING on a tree in front of my office. Ewww!! I saw the truck and was going to stop to see if he needed car assistance. Not what was happening. He was handling the situation... "That's what she said."

So. Basically. He peed on my office and pretty sure he didn't wash his hands.

Two stars because I did like the Sammie's there.

I've been looking for a jacket that would be useful in spring and fall conditions. I've been to this location before and they have a good variety of "sportsman" type stuff but also some quality clothing. After looking for about 5 minutes I had to track someone down to reach something for me. From that point on I had 3 people who stayed with me until I found what I wanted. It took 3 of them because as the first 2 got called away to look after somethings else, there was someone else to take over. After looking at Simons, the Urban Barn and few other places, I found exactly what I was looking for. The North Face, a great fit and priced at $150. I was happy with the product, the price and the service. What more is there?

There is something that I love about the elegance and old school regal nature of steakhouses. The irony is that although I love steakhouses, I am not a big fan of steak. I went here with a friend for restaurant week and found the ambiance to be ok. The staff was cordial.

The wait staff took a little too long for my taste to come take our order but was very pleasant upon arrival. I had the Morton salad which was good. I then had the salmon (which I often get when going to steakhouses). The salmon was was good but the portion size was small (even for restaurant week). The dessert served was chocolate mousse or creme brulee. The problem with dessert was, I eat neither dessert and substitutions were not optional. 

This place is a nice quaint place to eat with coworkers, friends or family. As far as steakhouses are concerned, there are other places in the city of Philadelphia that I would recommend over Morton's.

I've been in here a few times (always for brunch or lunch) and it's been pretty good. Sometimes service can take a while depending on how crowded the bar is and the last time I went, one of the bartenders was obviously not very happy about something but that's not enough to write this place off for me. 

Brunch is great, mimosas are really good and I've had the crab cake benedict and a breakfast sandwich before, both were awesome although I wish the portions were a little bigger, maybe. I tried some of their pressed cocktails over the summer and they were great, it convinced me to buy a french press so I could try to make some at home!
A group of 18 and it went off without a hitch! Everything was great - pesto pizza, wings, and cocktails. Our service was great as well as the music!

They literally stole from me. I went in needing only the transmission solenoid 1-2 replaced. It took them over a week, and they performed the "repair" without my permission. When I argued that they never even asked for my permission they made me feel like I was personally attacking them and got extremely defensive. They told me they were unable to fix the problem, but still charged me $400 for the replaced solenoid. However, when I took my car to a transmission specialist, he told me that the solenoid had never been replaced, and that they had simply taken my money. This garage should not be on this web site. Period.

I'm not happy with their Customer Service.  I made an appointment and it was from 4-5pm for my snow tires.  I got there at 4 on the dot and they said it would be ready at 6 or 6:30 that they were busy and running late.  THEN to make it worse I called at 6 and they said 'we should be able to get it done tonight". How the heck am I suppose to get home?  You have my car!  No apologies when I told them I had to cancel 2 appointments and wait 3 hours longer than expected.  I'm still here.  It's 7pm and I will never go back here again,  They seem to just ignore the fact that they are late by telling me they were busy.  That is not good customer service.

I have had good and bad experiences at Walgreens Pharmacy at Rancho Vistoso. The only BAD experiences I had was when I was using pain medication, and they were extremely stringent to the point of being rude . But, that was long ago. The pharmacy manager at the time was very kind to make sure my orders were in, as I had an unusual prescription. 

However, now that I am no longer on constant pain medications I have had nothing but GREAT experiences there. All of the pharmacy techs are kind, caring and efficient. They remember me, which often surprises me, as I am not there often. That makes the place seem like your hometown pharmacy, which is rare in this impersonal age 

And they never fail to give my service dog a treat, which makes the experience extra special. 

I would never use another pharmacy in this area. I highly recommend Walgreens
Some unique colors and blends, but very small selection considering the square footage and skeins going for upwards of $50! The prices have certainly scared this yarn customer away.

I have been living in the Westchester area for five years could not find a decent pizza place to save my life on west chester . We finally went to Broomall  to eat here . This place did not disappoint. 

We had  the pizza and wings . The  pizzas flavor was very good. The crust of the pizza was very crispy and flavorful. They use fresh ingredients and high-quality for the pizza . The wings were good but nothing to write home about. The had good flavor and we're not to sauced. The meat was moist so overall a good wing ! I saw a bunch of people get the cheese steaks next time I will try that!!

Came here today to pick up a delicious dinner. I got a side order of babaganosh and 6 falafels. Babaganosh came with delicious pita and was tasty and creamy. Falafel was tasty and crispy. The tahini sauce was very good as well. This was my first time here. The restaurant has a very nice feel with cute tables and very friendly staff. I will be back.
Eric K was awesome. Prompt and got my boxed packed tight and shipped with quality. Kind manager. Simple process.

I used to order to-go twice a month from Spitale's about 2 years ago and thought their lunch fare was solid. Unfortunately, I went back to Spitale's on two different occasions recently and the food has gone downhill. The first time I went back, I ordered the Red Beans and Sausage lunch plate...the beans were beyond bland and the sausage was tough and rubbery. I could heat up Blue Runner beans and cook sausage at home and it would taste better than the $12 lunch platter that I bought. The second time I ordered a salad to go. I know, ordering salad from a deli is dumb, but it's hard to screw up a salad. The veggies were soggy and the chicken was flavorless. I don't think I'll be ordering from Spitale's anytime soon.

We stopped in on a Friday night and had such a great experience!

All of the staff was friendly and the service was excellent. 

The bread is SO good! How did I not know those incredible buns existed? I'll be dreaming about them for sure.

I got the Fire Grilled Chicken and was very impressed. The Parmesan peppercorn topping was delicious, and it was set upon a delicious rice pilaf. I've honestly never liked rice that much in my life. It was that good. 

Overall, not sure why this location has such poor reviews. We will definitely be back!

Although the healthcare was fine, we have had an extremely difficult time dealing with billing.  My daughter need a physical and two immunizations for school.  They made my daughter pay in full, even though we have Blue Cross Blue Shield and Premier is in network.  They then sent us an additional bill.  I have been calling for the past 4 months asking them to submit the claim to insurance.  They say that they will, but they don't.  When I call the following month - they say that they didn't submit to insurance since it isn't covered.  I just got off the phone with my insurance company.  It should have all been covered less a $20 co-pay.  I'm just going to submit the claim myself since I can't get Premier to do it.  A friend had a similar situation.  I recommend checking with your insurance company before you go - and insisting that Premier contact your insurance company before you pay anything.

I don't really take the time to write bad reviews because everyone has their days... but this is something that I have to address. We JUST left this location to head over to the one in Bruce B Downs because the service at this location was not good quality at all.. we were greeted nicely and were sat quickly but once we asked about the dinner for 2 deal that they have our server told us we had to wait 15-20 until 9PM to be able to do the dinner. I asked to verify I understood him and nicely said, "so we have to be sat back down to wait to be seated again because of a 20 minute difference?" He responded "ya.. you can either sit at the bar and it'll be quicker either way it depends", so I then told my boyfriend that we'll just wait. We get up from the table to wait and paid for the virgin pia colada the server just HANDS me the tab and leaves.. I then asked the girls in the front who I'm suppose to pay the bill to and she responded, "the server?" as if I knew that because he left us in the front with the tab in my hand. I finally paid it and we left. Nobody tried to help us figure something out, or apologize for the inconvenience so we will not be returning to this location..

I recently received a gift card to the Magic Touch Car Wash, so I headed over to get the "full service."  

Magic Touch was easy to spot with a big sign, but the actual car wash entrance was a bit confusing and located behind the building. After checking out the different services, you hop out of your car and tell the attendant what you'd like. From there you walk through the building where you reach the cashier to pay for your service. There are benches outside that are covered by umbrellas. 

The washers did a great job washing my car and really took their time. Overall I was satisfied but did see some room for improvement. 1. I wish they vacuumed my seats better & 2. My car had a funky (not fresh) sent to it when I drove away- I assume this is from on of the cleaning chemicals they use.

If urban outfitters and a noodle bar had a baby it would be this place. Very hipster/fun atmosphere... so if you're a millennial you'll be into it. Not many tables mostly bar seating. None of the chefs were Asian.... and I was the only Asian person there customer wise. Not like that's an issue.... but if you're wanting to go to a more authentic noodle/ramen bar i'd suggest heading to china town. The broth for the miso ramen was pretty tasty but the pork was disappointing. It's shredded like as if you were to get a pulled pork sandwich. The pork in ramen is my favorite part of the soup so this was a downside for me. Also thought it was overpriced. Overall if you're on a date wanting to try somewhere new this place is not that bad but not a staple go to.

The students who staff the front desks are friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful.  I lost my keys and they came out to the parking lot to find me when they were turned in.  They definitely go the extra mile!  Keep in mind that they don't make the policies but they have to enforce them, so take your complaints to the top...

Yum! There were lots of things I could eat as a vegetarian. My boyfriend and I went for lunch. We got: Scallion Pancakes, Dan Dan Noodles (meat on the side), Hot Sauce Style with fried tofu entree size, side of rice, Dumplings in Chili Oil, and Red Bean ice cream. SO MUCH FOOD. Our meal (and probably lunch and dinner tomorrow!) cost $45 including tip.

The wait staff were very nice and always had my water in my glass.  The food was SO FREAKING GOOD. You just need to try it. If they have red bean ice cream, GET IT! Just trust me...it was amazing.

Let's start with the good.

The food was really good. Here's what we had:

Blue crab and corn fritters- The tarragon aioli was delicious and paired well with the fritters. The crab flavor was strong and the corn had a good bite to it.

Gumbo- M liked it more than me. He remembers liking it more last year. Not a big fan of all the okra.

Shrimp & Grits- Yum! I liked the heartiness of the grits and the sauce was tasty. Good amount of shrimp.

P&J oysters- I didn't have any but M like these a lot.

Now onto the bad. Our waiter was never really around. After having the fritters, we were served the oysters but our table didn't get cleared of the empty basket of fritters. After the our entrees came, the basket of fritters,the oysters, and dirty appetizer plates were still sitting empty on our table. We had not received the gumbo we ordered so someone else (still haven't seen our waiter) brought it out. 

When Matt was 80% done with his main entree, our waiter finally came to check on us and asked if we needed anything from him. Uhh... Yea! How about clearing the table? Or checking to see how our food was because maybe then he would have known we were served our last appetizer after we were already served our entree. 

Food was great, but the subpar service tainted the experience. We did let a manager know on the way out. If our server was around we could have told him too.

I have a favorite sushi place that unfortunately is not very close to me. I've tried finding one a bit closer that would compare with no luck. Until I tried Masami. I love this place, and the fact that they deliver makes it even better. It's not the closest place to me, yet they still deliver to my house and in a promptly manner. There's a lot of options, and I find most are really good. I highly recommend the spicy kani salad. That is both mine and my sister in law's favorite. The pork dumplings are really good. My mother in law is obsessed with the bbq squid. It's hard to pick a favorite roll. I like just about everyone I have tried.

Great quality cuban food ! One of our regular lunch places, fast and easy service. We never wait long to order and get our food and everything always tastes amazing ! We found the place very clean and the staff very professional and pleasant!

Long story short. Ehh. I didn't think this place was worth going out of our way for, nor was it worth the $10 entry fee - but I guess if you're really into art (which I am not) then give it a try. I was not too impressed but again, not a huge art person talking. 

My boyfriend and I were visiting Philly and thought it'd be cool to check out the place that we've seen so frequently on our Instagram feeds. I think we both had the impression that this place was a lot bigger than it actually was. We spent about 30 minutes here, and that's after we walked around twice and took some pictures. The colors are really beautiful and if you recognize all the time invested in this masterpiece . . . it really is inspiring. 

Okay for a first time visit. Not too impressed and not at all as amazing as social media makes it out to be. But if you want to take nice pictures, here you go!

Woodlands is EXCELLET! From the Sunday buffet to the many selections on the menu.  I have been there at least 15 times in the past 3 months and I'm also ready to go again.  

Warning for the meat eaters (like me): This is a vegan restaurant with a lot of curry selections.  This place was a great new place for me and made me open my eyes to vegan cuisine.  :)  

-Shaun

Ordered delivery from a hotel that was close. Very quick delivery, food was hot and good. Ordered pizza, breadsticks, and kids cheese ravioli. My 8 year old ate all of her ravioli, and a breadstick. Would order again.

Ordered 2 Prime burgers at the bar.  Cooked Medium.  Waiter delivers saying they are past medium, but here this one is less well than the other one.  HUH?  I certainly hope this does not happen in the restaurant when you are ordering pricey steaks.  They are thin so I can see medium requires watching.  Based on this experience I would not return to try  the restaurant.

Came in from out of town. Huge menu. Got the blackened chicken sandwich as recommended by the owner. Fantastic.  Jerry (the owner I think) was super friendly. Everyone was for that matter. Cool place.

This restaurant was incredible.... I almost have no more words but that. Except - MAKE A RESERVATION! The owner took pity on us and got us in, but we were fortunate. There were 5 of us at a table for 4!  But it was perfect. There chefs surprise plate was the most Amazing dish I've ever had, seriously! I couldn't even have dessert which I bet I missed out on some deliciousness! Check this place out! And have the Chefs Surprise Plate! You won't be sorry!!!

The blandest food I have ever eaten. It's like hospital food. The only thing worth eating is the marinated peppers they serve before your meal (for free). After the yummy peppers, the meal is that much more disappointing. This place is literally around the corner from my house. I would love to have a decent restaurant within walking distance; unfortunately, I don't.

In addition, the bar in back has a distinctly unfriendly vibe. People look at you like you're invading their space when you walk in.

I got there around 8 30pm ..no more lobster's !! Not sure if that's a good thing or bad? I guess for them it's good, but for me if the name is Luke's Lobster I want lobster. I ordered a crab sandwich it was good but really wanted lobster. Is that the new trend like Federal donuts (have to run out so people come early). I hope they start to order more lobsters or they will have to change the the name to Luke's out of lobster.

I'm convinced that Commander's Palace is just overrated.  I've eaten here about 4 times over several years and have never been impressed.  Certainly the pomp and circumstance is like no other, but the food itself is just ok.

My last visit was on a week night during Restaurant Week.  I was with 2 friends and we ate from the specially priced Prix Fixe Menu.
