I ordered a fish (drum I believe) and found it bland and was also disappointed in the presentation.  I know that sometimes with fish there's sections of dark meat, but I would not expect Commander's to serve my fish dark meat up.  For dessert I ordered the peach shortcake and was incredibly disappointed.  It was like they had added no sugar at all to the peaches and they definitely needed to kick up the cinnamon and other spices.  It was just another bland dish.

I am not kidding when I say I had the best fajitas of my life here! They were amazing! Foodies dream to find a place like this. Incredible food at low prices. This was my first visit, so I can only talk about the fajitas I had but other people who frequent there tell me everything is delicious. I completely believe them. I cleaned my plate. And the place is super clean. The owner runs a tight ship. He definitely has a gift for cooking up some delicious Mexican food in a warm setting. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

We drove into the city to try Sauce on the Side and when we arrived, we found out they closed and moved ad wouldn't be open for a few days. So, since we already paid for an hour of parking, we decided to try another restaurant close by. We found Baileys Range and decided to give it a shot!

The atmosphere is hipster/casual. The decor is cool and the building is brick which adds character. What really caught my eye was the "community" table. A big long table that you can sit at with strangers. Awesome idea, but we opted for a table upstairs for 2. 

We were seated and a waitress brought us a couple pitchers of water right away. We looked over the menu and I was impressed by the amount of variety in the burgers. I also loved the idea of the burger battle. Basically every week 2 burgers battle and whichever one has the most ratings stays for another week. Very cool. I ordered the California Bison Burger and fries with the house ketchup and house cheddar cheese sauce. 

The burger was incredible. Very juicy and just the right amount of gamey taste. The cole slaw was perfect on top as was the pork shoulder. The beer bun was delicious! The fries were crispy and seasoned which was great. The cheddar sauce was very good. The house ketchup was unique. It was very cinnamonny (Yes I made that word up). 

The water was room temperature which was strange and the waitress wasn't overly friendly or personable. She was just kind of there to do her job, which was fine. Also, for $12 I expected the burger to be a little bigger. But it was cooked perfectly so there's not much to complain about. 

Overall this place is awesome! Definitely worth the stop in and we will be back for sure. I want to try a bunch of the burgers from the menu!

This is our absolute favorite place to go out for breakfast! The thirty minute drive is always worth it. 

Although sometimes the service can be slow because they're always slammed, the coffee and food always make up for it.

This bar has a great relaxed atmosphere. Good beer selection although sometimes their draft offerings seem a bit dull. The food is excellent, I've had the grilled cheese, bratwurst, and the reuben and all have been excellent.  You can tell the cooks care about what they are serving.

Last time trying Kaiseki was in Kyoto Japan and I enjoyed it tremendously. I was glad to find out that Yoichi's offers Kaiseki and I don't have to fly across the Pacific. As a fan of authentic Japanese traditional cuisine, I could not pass up on this opportunity. It was a great find during my visit in the lovely city of Santa Barbara.

There is definitely a difference when using all five senses of touch, smell, taste, sight, and hearing. The presentation and simplicity says plenty. The main ingredient of each dish were never overpowered but accentuated. Each course is presented with an introduction. 

The staff is friendly just like the service you get in Japan. The experience was unforgettable. Thank you Yoichi's!

We eat here every time we come to Reno. We love the atmosphere, food and drinks. Usually  a hit or miss with the wait staff. Last night however we had THE ABSOLUTE BEST WAITRESS BY FAR!!! JORDAN I believe  was her name ( sorry I forgot after the 3rd beer)please forgive if that's wrong. Talk about "royal treatment " she was AWESOME!  I didnt even get this kind of treatment when we ate her in January  for my birthday!  My hubby and son noticed some food  items were gone from the menu and she explained  to us about the new head chef. She asked us what we  usually order and made some suggestions  to try. I ordered my beer (wildcard)and she asked if I had tried any other brews from the menu. I showed her the ones I had tried and she asked if I wanted to sample any others(no one ever asked me that). 
Yes please! Big Dog IPA is my new fave!
The food was also delicious. My daughter,son and I ordered  pizza and salad. My husband had the street tacos. All were equally delicious. Decent  prices & good portions Of food. I had to take mine in a container as I was full from the beers. We all walked out happy and full ( and kind of buzzed). I made sure to leave her a good tip. We will be back soon!

Another "Delco Proper" hotspot! 

The restaurant is totally 70's with orange vinyl booths, faux wood linoleum, wood paneling, etc. The place reeks of smoke, and the regulars monopolize all the counter seats (and they are not friendly people). The waitstaff is normally decent; it's a diner so don't expect much. 

It is crazy how this place is open 24-7 and someone is always there eating something. We once saw a family there at 4am who were talking about how they just finished driving home from a road trip vacation, and all they wanted to do was eat at Tom Jone's, and then go to bed. On Sunday after church it is crazy, and the line is out the door. When we were in our early 20's we'd often have parties and send the late-night people to Tom Jones for some food to sober up. They always loved it. There is something about the atmosphere, reminds me of "Pulp Fiction" somehow, in a vintage way.

What to eat? BLUE RIBBON, Baby! Last time we bought... for $3.89 you get: 2 sausages + 2 bacon + 2 pancakes + 2 eggs + OJ + coffee + 2 slices toast !!!!

It is always done FAST and it's always decent diner quality.

Brookhaven is dry so don't expect any booze here.

It sucks, but CASH ONLY!

They have a walk-up pick up window on the side, but any time we ever did pick up they never used it.

(This place is so Delco, Tommy Pope's gotta know about it... hopefully we may see a rendition of it in his Comedy Central "Delco Proper" webisodes.)

Very consistent, which is important to me... I am picky and the owner makes my Greek salad the way I like it (even though he looks like he is not happy about it) :) ....I have had several items on the menu, and everything is delicious.  The salad dressing is unbelievable... (sold by the bottle, also)
Mediterranean wrap, Pasticcio, Greek salad(either size) and the gyro's are 5 Star..
Listen ... it is Greek business, so order the Greek food, but the pizza was pretty good also..
2 for Tuesday is great...mix and match, with a great assortment.. my order has never been wrong...

Wonderful dining experience all around. Attentive service (Diana was amazing), casual atmosphere, and delicious food. We got the ribs, chicken bruschetta, crab ravioli, and the chicken Valdostano. The ribs and Valdostano were our favorite but everything tasted great. Looking forward to coming back!

Great find ... Though I grew up in Tucson, we have lived in San Diego for 30+ years.  When we visit a few times a year, we try out local diners in the area for breakfast ... So we know that part of the Tucson landscape pretty well, and were very pleasantly surprised with this great find ... Definitely toward the top of the pack!

Good breakfast food (between the three of us we had the biscuits and gravy combo, a scramble and a walnut-banana pancake combo), great atmosphere and very nice staff.

Will definitely be back...

Fantastic beer list with a lot of local brews, great way to get a taste of Pennsylvania flavor if you're passing through the area. Even through the hell of Thanksgiving weekend, the bartenders remained cheery and made my long layover a little more relaxing. Beware that the kitchen closes at 10pm. I arrived just after 10 and they were so nice to get me some fries anyway. Unfortunately, the service was slow and the staff wasn't too attentive, despite their happy demeanor.
